Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Tally6556
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in late march for 7 nights and loved it. The hotel is located very close to the arc de triumphe, air France bus stop and CDG Etoile metro station. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. the breakfasts had the basics and was ok for 12€. We stayed in a club twin room which was small but very clean. The beds were very comfortable and bathroom clean and modern (with a pretty good hair dryer). We did hear a bit of noise from the street on a few occasions as there is a cinema across the road but nothing that disturbed us too much. We also heard a tv from another night once but otherwise no noise from other rooms. I would definitely recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at Home in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Payam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel during March for 3 nights and again after a short trip came back for one night. Hotel kept our two luggages during our short trip for 4 days with no problem. This was our first time in this hotel and I was relied on TripAdvisor again to choose this hotel and it was wonderful. I have been in some other hotels in Paris already but this hotel absolutely is the best 3 star according to my experience. Staff: Really friendly & helpful staff with overall warm atmosphere. All of them good in English and also some other languages. Location: Perfect location to be comfortable during your stay in Paris.Metro, RER, Air France Shuttle (Line 2), Taxi Station are in just 3 min walk. Too many different restaurants are closed by include Mac Donald & Quick which serves until 2 AM! Rooms:We were in Junior suite and then upgrade complementary by hotel on our one night stay to Deluxe suite.Both of them are really clean and enough space for 3 to 4 people.Deluxe suite is two room with bigger bathroom.Only the floor carpet is old and I believe it should replace. Beds are comfortable and bigger in Deluxe suite.Wifi is free in rooms which is really Hi-speed and my son enjoy it a lot with his iPad! There is a safe & minibar & Coffee maker in the rooms. Only issue about the rooms is that they are not sound proof.As suites are located in the wings of the building with no common wall with other rooms, we just have some noise in our room which is sometimes disturbed us specially during morning. Breakfast: It is limited but acceptable for 3 star hotel specially for children with different types of cereals and serve till noon even in your room. It is free for kids under 12. I will be back in this hotel again in out next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the Value”
Reviews.Author: Ian091
Reviews.Content: My family (spouse and two children 12 and 13) enjoyed staying at this hotel. We were able to check-in early and they even offered us a coffee while we waited. The staff are very freindly and helpful. The breakfast was very good and my 12 year was free. We stayed in a deluxe suite as it accomodated the four of us in one room (this is hard to find in Paris). The rooms are very clean and offer the basic amenities that North americans are use to. The best part of this hotel is the location, it is located minutes from "Arc de Triomphe", 20 min to Eiffel tower and Louvre. We loved walking and stopping off at cafe's and various street vendors for crepes etc. My daughter and I walked around the area and shopped on the famouse Champs Elyses. There was a Macdonalds on the corner of the street that the children often went on their own, for Ice cream and snacks. We defenitely reccommend this to families and just about anyone else who wants the location for the value.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rogerkrist
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for a weekend in January and wanted a nice hotel, but also one that wasn't too expensive. We found that Royal Magda was an excellent choise. The service was great. We got our room on arrival even though it was pre check-in time. We travelled with our 3 months old child, and the staff was very helpfull with the stroller we had for him, and they could also help us with restaurant suggestions. The holtel is located close to Arc de Triumph and sub-way/train station, and we will stay here the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Helpful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kpasa_1999
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The location is idea- easy to get around, lots of restaurants etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. Unlike a lot of hotels I've been in the WiFi connection was perfect anywhere in the hotel. Just don't bring a lot of luggage because the elevator is TINY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Nickjl67
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel a few times and it really is a little gem,great location near the main attractions of Paris,service at this Hotel is always of high standard not to mention good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, extremely clean, friendly staff & well located”
Reviews.Author: voyageuse_81
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for 2 nights on a last-minute rate of €100 per room per night. It is a few minutes' walk from the Etoile station, which allows direct links with much of Paris in a very short amount of time. The staff at the front desk were consistently friendly and helpful. Our rooms (which were standard double rooms) were tiny, like the smallest I've ever stayed in, but immaculately clean, with a flat-screen TV with English and French channels, a minibar, spare pillows etc, a safe... everything you need for a short stay. If staying for a bit longer, I would recommend a larger, more expensive room over the standard room, as it's so small and could get a bit much over more than a few nights. Our only minor complaint would be the noise - it was SO noisy. All 4 of us were woken up one morning by two men fighting on the street and screaming at each other, and the other morning by roaring motorbikes and cars. The windows just didn't block any noise out at all. The walls are also very thin and we did hear the couple next to us becoming, ahem, 'amorous'... but hey, Paris is the city of love;) In terms of local restaurants, we had dinner at Le Hide and the food was good, but not amazing. We found it to be quite expensive for what it was. Overall, I would easily recommend this hotel to anybody. Great location, lovely staff, immaculately clean and in a good spot for accessing other parts of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda in February after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and I have to say that we are in agreement with other reviewers who rated this hotel as Excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. They even helped us with making a reservation in advance at a nearby bistro. Located near the Arc de Triomphe and the Avenue de Champs d'Elysees, the hotel was close to bars, restaurants, shops etc. We were able to walk to many of the main tourist attractions from the hotel. the rooms were clean and there was maid service everyday. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we ate out in one of the many nearby cafes, however, the breakfast room did look look tempting! We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Gab H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very receptive, with receptionist talking many languages (inclusive portuguese), everything is clean, the bathroom was recently refurbished and everyting inside the room is new. It is also well located, near of the subway, lots of good restaurants and fast foods. When come back to Paris, for sure I will stay there again. Gabriel Hegab

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: PistolP83
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me about this hotel was just how central it was. Its around the corner from L'Arc de Triomphe, 5 mins walk from the metro and only a few minute walk from the Champs Elysee. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. They were very happy to give us directions and recommendations. For food they recommended Chez Clement but it didnt suit as one of us is Veggie and there is very little for that on the menu. The only downfall would be the room. The room was small which i know is the norm in Paris but walls are paper thin so we could hear the tv from next door or hoovering downstairs. The buffet breakfast is a little overpriced at 12euro per person for what was a bowl of cereal, bread, fruit and pastry. But otherwise our stay was very enjoyable. Suit a couple for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 3 young kids”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We struggle to find hotels that can properly accommodate 3 kids aged 8, 6 and 2 - if you're in that situation in Paris, this is a great choice. We had a deluxe suite which was two adjoining rooms sharing a bathroom, one with a full double bed and one with a sofa bed. We brought our own travel cot (our choice) and found there was plenty of room for us all with the two older kids sharing the sofa bed. The room furnishings were simple but tasteful and robust (a blessing if you've a destructive 2 year old), the bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. We had a room towards the back of the hotel which was very quiet - you'd really not know you were so close to the Arc de Triomphe. There is easy access to a microwave downstairs to heat milk, the staff are really very helpful and do everything possible to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel is about a five minute walk from Charles de Gaule Etoile Metro (quicker without kids), which is a big interchange metro with direct lines to Eiffel Tower and the area with Louvre, Pompidou and Notre Dame. It's possibly a little pricey given it is three stars, but given the warmth of the reception, the easy location and the helpfulness of the staff, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: alexis_michau
Reviews.Content: First of all: THE STAFF ARE REALLY GREAT ! Extreme helpful and great customer service render to us. Speaks very good english! Requested for early check in, about 11am. Upon arrival, room keys were prepare and check in was really no hassle, very very prompt and efficient! We requested for level 5, ask and it shall be granted! Had a balcony, view was great! Room is clean. Bed comfy. Bath room is clean! Housekeeping done a great job! No complains at all! Very near to major shopping streets, great location for those who loves to shop till you drop. ^_^ The location is perfect, a short walk to the Louvre, the Seine River and Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysee. We love the hotel, and we will definitely be back when we visit paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: MauroSantos
Reviews.Content: First of all: THE STAFF IS GREAT; Lili, Julien and the others are really sympathique and helpful; Lili speaks portuguese too. They couldn't be better. I spent 6 nights there this January - couple and a 13 years old boy. Got a Junior Suite, with very good bed and sofa-bed. Room and bathroom good enough; only negative: the carpet was ugly and a little spotted, over a a little irregular ground (minors problems). Hotel is very clean. The wi-fi is wonderful even in your room. The lift is too small, for 3 persons without bags. It's not located at one of the famous banlieu, but is very close to Arc de Triomphe, in a small and quiet street, and at a jump to CDG-Étoile Metro Station (lines 1, 2, 6 and RER A). To Tour Eiffel, 5 stations (or a 2,1 km walk); to Museé du Louvre, 6; 15 a 20 min walk to Abercombrie or Virgin Mega Store on Ave.Champs Elisées. Didn't have breakfast there (12 euros); a croissant and a hot chocalate for 5 euros nearby was good to me. I've payed 1.580,00 euros per 6 nights, no breakfast included. Expensive for a 3 star hotel not so well located, isn't it? For comparison: the same period in January, at Hotel Diocleziano, a very good 4 star hotel in Rome, it will be 832,00 euros - very good breakfast included!!! (I've stayed there last october for 4 nights). Despite this, its a good hotel and you can book it without fear, but if you have time, who knows you find a better cost-benefit hotel in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “"Felt at home, great location,”
Reviews.Author: renovia
Reviews.Content: Coming from our homeland Indonesia in connection with our 25th years wedding, we were a bit afraid since it was our first visit to Europe. It was a real surprise to find that the staff of this this hotel were friendly even though we couldn't speak even a French word.We got champagne and snacks as a gift for our wedding anniversary. Our room was spacious and clean, especially the bathroom, it was very clean. During our four night stay, we had a very good sleep and the breakfast was perfect. The location was great, we could reach many interesting places on foot. Definitely will pick this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice staff, Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: dgino
Reviews.Content: I had to send in this review after reading some of the poor reviews that were written. No it's not a Hilton$$$$,but the rooms are very clean, the staff was GREAT and so helpful. The location is perfect, a short walk to the Louvre, the Seine River and Arc de Triomphe. The Hotel Royal Magda Etoile fit the ticket for us :) on our Euro tour!!! June 2011

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: woozal74
Reviews.Content: My mum, dad, daughter (10) and I stayed at the Royal Magda on 20 Dec for 2 nights. Our stay was the best, the staff were friendly and helpful in everyway. Rooms were clean, cosy, warm and comfortable. Excellent shower and large bathroom. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. This is a must stay in Paris. Many thanks to the staff for an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay & best location”
Reviews.Author: Italophile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights. I had carefully read the reviews here and decided, for the money, this would be a good choice. We weren't disappointed. First off, the location was perfect--close to a main metro stop, many good restaurants in the neighborhood (of all price ranges), and the hotel staff were just simply charming! Our room was not large, so we knew to keep it organized. Our room had a cute balcony with a tiny table and chairs squeezed onto it, not usable in December. But the door was nice to let in fresh air. Our room also had a window, so natural light could be plentiful. The lined curtains also kept the room dark when you wanted it. The bathroom was small--one person limit--but water pressure in the shower was fine. The wifi worked well & was never a problem. We ate the breakfast a couple of times and thought it was plentiful. Yes, the elevator is small, but we thought it typical of a small European hotel. We seldom had to wait for it. The TV was fine--mostly French stations but also BBC & CNN. Our room was always cleaned very timely & throughly. The only complaint I have is the walls are thin, which I had read in other reviews. This was only a problem two nights when we were awakened by the couple in the next room "being intimate." They were surely right on the other side of the wall from our bed as we could hear every single movement and utterance. Even given that, I would book here again without hesitation. The staff went above & beyond to make us comfortable! They were so very friendly and helpful, and we don't ask much of hotel staff. We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sulliy
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this wonderful little French Gem. We arrived early in the morn and although our room would not be ready until midday, we were offered a cuppa and a nice comfy sofa to rest a while......very nice touch and muchly appreciated. We were then given a map and shown a few restaurants to go have breakfast......and a few local attractions When we returned, our bags were in our room. Room was very cute, nicely appointed and very comfortable n clean Staff were so friendly and helpful...excellent The Magda is well situated.....near Arc de Triomphe, close to the underground and hop on hop off bus and with in walking distance to many shops n attractions We would highly recommend this wonderful hotel for all travellers

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SunsoutFunsout
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night during our vacation. The hotel was very centrally located, staff spoke excellent english, and the rooms were very clean. Upon check in the front desk was kind enought to upgrade our room! Hotel is also just a short walk from the Metro Station. Our stay was short but I would stay at this hotel again if I visited Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CRISTYRS
Reviews.Content: After six times in Paris and several hotels, this was the best one.The location is great, the rooms are nice, clean, good bathroom and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “If you are an American, do not stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Carebear214
Reviews.Content: Seriously. I don't mean to be rude but c'mon TA reviewers what are you thinking? A TA choice award winner?! This place was old, dated and dingy. It was literally like a hostel except you got your own room. You had to use a key (not a card) to open the extremely old, flimsy door. And we could hear every single noise that our neighboring rooms made. The carpet was old and dingy as was the bathroom. The only reason I am giving it a two because the bed was actually comfortable (but I did just get off a ten hour red eye) and there were no hairs on sheets or towels (surprisingly hard to find these days) and the staff was friendly. And yes, this is close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs but so what? You look at the arc for like 5 minutes and the Champs is a gross representation of what it once was so then you have to walk (or subway) over to all the other sites on the other side of town anyway. Trust me, find a place to stay in the 6th and you will be so much happier.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best Hotels in this area in this price range”
Reviews.Author: Mounh
Reviews.Content: Is stayed at probably a dozen hotels around the place de l'etoile in the past 4 years, this one was one of the best. Location is great of course, but the room is really clean (some other hotels out the have unfortunately a too broad definition of clean), staff is very friendly and you can have your breakfast until noon, which is a great plus for me. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CorMonte
Reviews.Content: Hotel near Arc de Triomphe - close proximity to subway, McDonald's and laundromat. Awesome location and great staff. Our room was not ready but they accomodated us (2 adults/2 tweens) by keeping our luggage while we went out on the town. Very clean and the beds were comfortable after a long day out. Quiet and roomy for European standards. Would recommend to anyone looking for clean rooms, friendly staff (spoke English) and great location.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED - Dirty & had to sleep with headphones.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandMatt
Reviews.Content: VERY DISAPPOINTED!! I booked this hotel based upon the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. It was quite the contrary. This hotel was similar to a hostel, we were very disappointed. TripAdvisor got it wrong! * CHECKIN: We entered the hotel lobby the receptionist said "Bonjour, what is your last name" and that was it. She then showed us to the lift and said "you are on 5". I am not big on small talk but I was at least expecting a briefing on the hotel, breakfast, wifi, etc but that did not happen. We were not informed of any of that. * THE ROOM (First Impression): After reaching our room, I thought I may have booked the wrong hotel, so I double checked from my iPhone, yes this is the same place: Royal Magda Etoile, 7 Rue Troyon, Paris. The room had a very bad, very strong damp/mold smell. Room size was 10 foot by 10 foot. The room small (even by Paris standards). The carpet was badly stained, very worn. The room was so dirty, that I had to lay towels on the floor to avoid walking on the badly stained carpet. The bathroom was clean but small. ISSUES: * Our room (on 5th floor) had a very bad damp smell which made me sick; it smells like cancerous 'black mold'. I called the reception desk (Dec 28 approx 20:00) the man said they couldn't change my room. The next day I talked to daytime reception & explained the terrible smell. They told me to open the window. They said they were fully booked & there is nothing they could do. * I called reception (Dec 28 @22:00) for an extra blanket & they told me to come down to reception to get it. I asked if he can send it up & he said "no, you have to come down and get it". I had to go all the way down to reception in my PJ's, how embarrassing. * I spoke to 'Sacre' both times, he was not friendly. * No wash rags, had to wash my body with full size towel. * AC did not work. VERY LOUD: * The building was very loud. I could literally hear the people next door going to the bathroom and talking. I had to sleep with my iPod on. The building next door was under construction and the building on the other side is a night club. OVERALL: Both my wife & I were sadly disappointed. We travel a few times per year on vacation & stay at various chain & boutique hotels across the world. I can honestly say that this hotel is the WORST HOTEL I have ever stayed at. I have stayed at other boutique hotels in Paris (hotel Elysees Regencia is great) and the Royal Magda was terrible. If you would stay at a Hostel, than you should stay here. If you think hostels are disgusting, than you would think this hotel is disgusting. This hotel was basically a hostel with a private bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarceloZani
Reviews.Content: I reccomend for the location, services and quality of the room. We received chocolates for the new year`s eve and champagne. If i come back to Paris again i definitely would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming french hotel offering so much more than other 3 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: lozmum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris a few times previously, and by all standards, this hotel is by far the most well kept, good value for money & location. Close to Arc de Triomphe , 2 major metro lines,easy walk to Champs Elysees, and buses to the airport literally around the corner. Extremely clean, comfortable rooms, despite the typical European small rooms (mind you I have seen smaller!) and 1 person elevator. Things like the ironwork spiral staircase, the bar, and shuttered windows (which open!) only add to its charm. All staff so friendly & helpful. I dont think I would ever consider stay anywhere else in central Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience. The hotel had it all.”
Reviews.Author: KarimZB
Reviews.Content: Not one bad comment about this hotel! Everything was great! From service to rooms to cleanliness to wifi connection, location... Everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: PYPF
Reviews.Content: What we liked: Very friendly and helpful staff at the front desk, everyone we met spoke fluent English and was not unhappy to speak it Minutes away from subway and Champs-Élysées -made shopping very easy, esp. later in the night Decent food places nearby as well as a McDonald's There is a nice little "closet" for our things so we didn't need to constantly try to find things in our luggage Not too much noise from outside or from rooms on the same floor What we didn't like so much: The room smelled stuffy/damp, probably due to the moisture coming from the washroom, there is no extractor fan to get rid of the moisture We had to wait for a long time for our room to be ready when we wanted to check in, the staff was very nice and offered us drinks but we were very tired

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom U
Reviews.Content: Quite a good hotel, wifi was fantastic, very central. Literally walk fifty metres down the road and the Arc de Triomphe is right ahead of you! We had about 4 different members of staff, and they were all very nice, extremely helpful, and spoke English quite well. Definitely would recommend it. Only downside was that our room was on the 1st floor, and as such whenever the staff went out the back to the staff room it was quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: The staff were willing and able to help us with any questions we had, all ticket purchases, and knew every metro stop for the attractions. They left us champagne in our room when we arrived, for our honeymoon. It's true the adjacent rooms can be heard, especially the room service - but that is the only negative for this hotel. The value and location far outweighs any small inconvenience - the location is perfect, close to the metro, CdE, and Arc de Triomphe. We will definitely return if we stay in Paris again. We want to thank the staff again for all their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, too much noise”
Reviews.Author: FrenchLIT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room on the top floor. The hotel is very clean, the bed was comfortable and the room, albeit very small, was pleasant. BUT, the evening room service was lame, and one could hear absolutely everything that was going on in the adjacent rooms and in the hallway. Plan to sleep only between 12 midnight and 6 am!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda Stay : A*****”
Reviews.Author: nik p
Reviews.Content: Location is awsome. The service from the staff is great, very polite, very helpful. good value for money. Would most definately come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shh! Keep it secret!”
Reviews.Author: mjalford
Reviews.Content: What an excellent find. I've been coming to Paris for business for years, and tried hundreds of hotels. Having read the reviews, I thought I'd give the Royal Magda Etoile a go. I normally try & avoid the tourist areas like the plague. It was the best stay I've ever had in Paris by a long way. Unpretentious, the hotel is a couple of minutes easy walk from the metro/RER. My room looked over a central courtyard, and was absolutely silent...no hint I was bang in the centre of a bustling city. Excellent bed, tea& coffee facilities (quite rare in 3* hotels in France). Room was traditional but immaculately clean. But best of all, as countless others have said, the staff. All of them. From the cleaner to Manager. Please don't go there, or I might not get a room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: YellowTinker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Royal Magda Etoile in August 2011. The room was clean and nice. There was a kettle for making tea and coffee. Very good, because in Paris a simple cup of tea in a restaurant may cost you 4 euro. Two variants of pillows (low and high) were a bonus. There was also a tiny, but romantic balcony with a table and chairs looking at rue Troyon. It was just 2 minutes walk from Etoile metro station. This hotel cost us 130 euro for a double room (best offer), and it was a little bit shocking price for us after a similar, but muuch cheaper hotel we had in the centre of Prague. And in Paris you can't find anything with decent reviews for less than 100 euro. The service for this high price is excellent, of course, though sometimes I even felt uncomfortable about all this luxury and smiling staff around me. In the future I would prefer something more basic and cheaper. The second thing I didn't like was the size of the room. There's only a half-metre way around a bed and that's all space. We had two average suitcases and anywhere we tried to put them, we still had to jump above them, which was not pleasant at all!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paris”
Reviews.Author: macdCloverdaleBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights in September and could not ask to be treated any better by the staff, from the moment we arived till the time we left. The Hotel was a boutique hotel from the circular stairway to the elevator built for 2. We ended up eating at the contiental breakfast all but one day as the French pastries, fruit, cheeses and coffee were a great way to start the day. The location is close to the Arc de Triomphe, used the Hop on Hop off to see the city, but were able to walk to to the Museums, Seine river, St. Germaine district etc. (we are walkers).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwedenMep
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a few times at the Magda and has never been disappointed. It is well situated and there are many good restaurants in the neighbourhood. (I especially recommmend l'Accolade, which is about 15 min walk from the hotel.) The hotel is quite small and has a parisian atmosphere. It is at a small street so it is not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and reasonable boutique french hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patti P
Reviews.Content: This very pleasant and comfortable hotel is tucked on a quiet side street just past the Arc de Triomphe and a short two blocks from the Charles DeGaulle metro and a stop for the airport buses. We stayed in a suite so our daughter, who is studying abroad, could take the fold-out couch. The front desk staff gave us wonderful guidance throughout our stay. I would certainly recommend this spot to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: JamieB_UK
Reviews.Content: From arrival it was clear that we'd chosen a good hotel. The lady checking us in was welcoming and very informative. Location: Great location just a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is located in a small side road so it benefits from quietness and privacy, yet the side road opens out onto major thoroughfares so it's easy to eat out locally as there are a selection of restaurants within a short walk. The Metro station is nearby at the Arc de Triomphe and there is a Taxi rank up on the main road. The area felt safe and at no time were we concerned for our safety. Check-in: The check-in process ran smoothly, with our booking being accurate. We'd booked two rooms, a double and a twin and these were exactly what had been reserved. Our details were correct and the facilities of the hotel were clearly explained to us. Rooms: We'd booked two club rooms, as these have a little extra space. I'd been told rooms in Paris can be on the small side, but these were both more than adequate with none of the 'croom-cupboard' feeling that some hotel rooms can have. There was enough space to easily have several people in the room. Everything was clean and tidy, and the beds were very comfortable with none of the saggness that can affect older beds. The bathrooms both had a bath with a shower over and there was plentiful hot water and toiletries. Breakfast: On a couple of days we ate in the hotel. Breakwast was of the continental type and there was a selection of pastries, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, cold meats and cheese. Staff were attentive in ensuring nothing ran out. The bread and pastries were lovely and fresh and it was easy to have a very satisfying breakfast to set you up for the day. Check-out: Continuing with the overall experience at the hotel, this was accurate, friendly and professional. They asked specifically if we'd enjoyed our stay and seemed actually interested in the response rather than it just being for effect. They also booked a taxi for us and this was done correctly too. Overall: This hotel could teach many a major chain about customer service. Without fail every member of staff was friendly and very professional in their roles. It was a great combination of high end hotel quality with small friendly customer service. I highly recommend staying here if you visit Paris for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ryost44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights on vacation. We had a very nice stay. The hotel is a boutique style hotel, so the rooms are on the small side, but has everything you need to make your stay comfortable. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff, Lilly and Mila, were very helpful and friendly. The metro is within walking distance to the hotel. You can walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees from the hotel. The only thing we had a problem with was that our room was on the street side and there was a lot of noise coming from a club which is located across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikee M
Reviews.Content: My dad, my mom, my sister and I stayed in this hotel last October when we had our Paris trip. We had the best experience in this hotel. We got the family room which was a very comfortable room to stay in when you are a group of 4. We had 2 big beds, 2 flat screen televisions and a big and roomy bathroom. I was 6 months pregnant at that time and Royal Magda made my trip and stay in Paris very comfortable. Their hotel attendants, Mila and Juliet are very friendly and helpful. We wouldn't enjoy our stay if it were not for them.

Reviews.Title: “A coomfortable, character filled stay”
Reviews.Author: WhereEverITravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a mother and daughter for a 50th Birthday present The hotel had plenty of character in a boutique style whilst still having all of the modern accessories needed to guarantee a comfortable stay. Rooms as many have suggested are compact, but no more so than I would expect from the centre of Paris Staff were really helpful and although we both spoke French, when words escaped us, all had perfect English! We decided not to have breakfast at the hotel, but found a great restaurant a short walk around the corner which was surprisingly affordable considering it’s location and your are spoilt for options for breakfast. The Metro is in easy waling distance and if you are using busses these are equally easily caught from the side roads around the hotel. Although you should walk up to Arc de Triomphe and down the Champs Elyees at least once during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simple business model done well”
Reviews.Author: Donjob
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one midweek night on a business trip in November 2011. Location is really good on two fronts - the AirFrance bus from CDG drops directly around the corner 50m away. Also the hotel is within walking distance of top of Champs Elyees with a metro stop closeby. The hotel is a boutique style - rooms are small but well appointed and very clean. The concierge was extremely friendly and efficient; repeated at check-out next morning where there was assistance available to him at the busy hour from a most attractive lady. Breakfast is slightly disappointing with a bread roll, cheese and some ham available with cereal. The coffee was good though. All in all, a good choice if not a spectacular one!

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly in a central location”
Reviews.Author: B52s
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel just a short walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. We booked here following good reviews and location - we were not disappointed. Although we only met reception staff, they were very friendly and helpful, all spoke good english. I needed a restaurant booking cancelled at the last minute and this was happily done with no fuss saving me a charge to my credit card. Our first floor room was fairly compact with limited storage space, but perfectly adequet for our two day stay however the shower was a good size and the bed firm and comfortable. I don't remember mentioning that we were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, but on our return from sightseeing we found a half bottle of champagne with two glasses and best wishes from the management! A lovely touch. Even without the gift we would certainly stay again and have no hesitation in reccommending the Royal Magda.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice near Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: HolidayOnHarry
Reviews.Content: Great location around the corner from Champs Elysees, although the rooms are small they are friendly enough. The staff bent over backwards to be helpful and the breakfast was very plesant. Also the restaurant 2 doors up is great food and good fun.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: msydalg
Reviews.Content: this was my second visit to the royal magda and stayed 4 days both times staff were very friendly most helpfull always willing to assist rooms were clean plus a good size by paris standards great location close to all amenities already looking forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at the Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: PatandJohn_11
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed four longish stays at the Royal Magda Hotel, as a couple and with various adult family members. The hotel has what we want the most: quiet, cleanliness, friendly assistance. The mattresses are firm and the sheets are crisply clean every day. I think the hotel has gotten very busy, but it does not seem that way and we never had to wait for assistance or at breakfast. We never felt rushed either. A "Do Not Disturb" sign is not necessary. The housekeepers are almost invisible, (no taps on the door) but the room gets cleaned no matter how late you leave or how early you return. On our recent visit, it was hot in Paris, and our room was comfortably cool thanks to the AC. The location is convenient, but this is not a tourist area. You are close to the Metro and the museum cluster along the Seine is a direct trip on line 1. With a little exploring, we have found a variety of nice places to eat, a laundromat and a superb market area all within five minutes walk. The place has charm. We love the spiral staircase with the leopard skin pattern on the rugs. It is basically a small hotel with a nice mix of clientele. It has no gym and no computer stations, but there is a little iPad in the lobby. The WiFi works. There are ways to get your boarding passes printed with help from the desk. You cannot go into the garden which is a bummer. The rooms are small with small closets, but we do not feel cramped. In our favorite room, the bed is up against the wall on two sides. Reading lights are adequate and there are enough plugs to charge the cell and laptops without unplugging the lights, etc. The boiler blew at the end of our trip last year. Obviously fixed now, and the hot water is hot. Our shower leaked a bit. That was not a problem for us since the puddle stayed in the corner. Hope they fix it, though. Little kids will have no diversions. The hotel works because the staff are dedicated. Change that, or get too many rowdy guests, and there would be problems due to the size and intimacy of the place. In summary, we can relax and rest at this hotel. It is terrific for people who want to recharge every night so they can enjoy the city. Not for those who need a big hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: federic j
Reviews.Content: Happily, the previous reviewers were right on. From the moment we walked in, the staff and hotel were hospitable, accommodating, and comfortable. We arrived at 11 am, and the staff took care of our luggage, got us drinks, and made us very comfortable while they got our room ready early. The location was great. We saved a ton by using the Metro (Charles deGaulle Etoile station was blocks away) and the Air France airport shuttle, and there were plenty of decently priced restaurants close. Get a balcony if you can. We enjoyed breakfasts, light dinners, and midnight snacks al fresco with provisions from visits to open air markets and the Publicis Drugstore about a 10-minutes walk away. If you're thinking of making dinner or cabaret reservations but don't really speak French, take advantage of the friendly staff. They took care of reservations for Crazy Horse (lots of fun!) and helped us avoid some very legitimate looking but actually fake ticket websites. When (not if) I go back to Paris, I'll go back to Royal Magda Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: cherosu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. Yes, the room is tiny... the smallest room I think I've ever seen! But the service and location make up for it... and really, we weren't in the room all that much because we were in Paris! The people at the front desk were so helpful and friendly. They not only recommended two terrific places to eat dinner, but also printed a map and drew how to get there. They helped us figure out how to get to Versailles (not that it's hard... we just didn't know how to get there) and were genuinely friendly. The location is superb! Even though the Arc de Triomphe is very close by, as well as a metro stop and many restaurants and pastry shops, the hotel is tucked into a quiet street so you don't hear any outside noise. A downside to the hotel though, is the walls are very thin. We could hear whole conversations in the room next to us on the last night. Overall though, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Redo23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Paris for 3 days and stayed at the Royal Magda. The service we received from arrival to departure was exemplary. Staff at reception were always happy to provide assistance to our many questions. The location is great, 50m from the Metro and a further 50m to the Arc de Triomphe. There are lots of good restaurants (formal and informal) within an easy walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its finest”
Reviews.Author: divelovers
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels are notoriously small. This one is no exception. By American standards, the room is a closet. That being said, we found it beautiful, clean, close, and local in its feel. We stayed 2 nights. The front desk was incredibly helpful. We took the metro from the airport and found the hotel without any trouble. We walked everywhere after that. We enjoyed the 5 minute walk to the Arc, the 4 mile walk to the Louvre and about the same to the Musee d'Orsay. Restaurants are all a little touristy in this area, but that's the price you pay for proximity. The walking is beautiful. Internet connection was wifi and reasonably fast. We did not buy the breakfast in the hotel, preferring a croissant or crepe on the street. If you need your chain hotel, go for it, but this place is Paris through and through. I stayed at the airport Marriott last time on a layover and paid 50% more than Magda. This place is at the top of its game right now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Qwerty62
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel. It has a great location near the Arc de Triomphe and is not far from the Air France bus' drop off point. My room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Paris hotel rooms tend to be small so I paid a little extra for a "Club Double" room and appreciated the extra space it offered. The front desk staff were unfailingly helpful. The hotel's breakfast was better than average. I have stayed at four other hotels near the Arc de Triomphe, on past trips, and I think Royal Magda Etoile offers the best value of them all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Samster2805
Reviews.Content: Location: Awesome! Metro/subway is just 1 min walk away and the Triumph Arc was 2 min walk. Many eateries, cafes (even MacDonald's) just across the street! Convenient!! A 10 min walk will get you to champ elysees. Reception and check in: Fast and efficient. Was given some important and useful tips for moving around the city! Room: Small but cosy. We found it cute that we had to open 2 wooden doors to get out of our room (We felt safe and secure). Room was clean and bed was nice and comfortable (we had 2 separate beds) Pillows were a little thin so we called to asked for extra pillows but they didn't have we used the extra winter blanket that was in the wardrobe as a pillow instead. Breakfast: Standard continental breakfast was served but items such as bakery and fruits were fresh so we enjoyed it! Overall: We often heard stories that Asians are not very welcomed in France but Mila (staff at reception) proved it wrong. She was really kind and helpful and even gave us tips when we were asking about a where to purchase a particular perfume (she bought the exact same one!) Thank you very much for taking care care of us! We will recommend your hotel to our friends and will definitely return again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, cozy room”
Reviews.Author: corndog09
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Royal Magda Etoile. Easily accessible by Air France Bus. Room was small, but adequate for our needs. We did not have breakfast at the hotel due to cost. Friendly staff. Located very close to metro stop for convenience on vacation. Would stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ForACause
Reviews.Content: As stated I am the event organizer for the non-profit For A Cause, www.rfac.org. I selected Hotel Royal Magda as the pre and post hotel accommodations for our France 2011 trip. We stayed at the hotel on 3 separate times during our trip to France this September. The hotel is exactly what it claims to be, a small European style hotel. If you are looking for a big American style hotel look elsewhere, as you will not be happy. The hotel was in a perfect location for us, just around the corner from the Arch de Triomph which also just happens to be a major stopping point for several Metro Lines making it very easy to get around the city. NOTE – when leaving the station, look for exit # 4 Wagram! We found the best way to get to and from the airport was via Super Shuttle or the AirFrance Shuttle, if you only have an overnight bag then take the Metro, but do note you will need to transfer trains and there are lots of stairs and we did not find an escalator. The hotel is located on a small side street, about the size of an alley, which is not listed on many maps. The hotel is smack dab in the middle of everything and the street is active with local bars and a playhouse located directly across the street and as such there is city noise, but we did not find this to be an issue we live in the city (Chicago, NY, LA…). Also, the windows are double sealed which blocks out just about all the noise. If you are looking for a hotel where you will wake each morning to the sounds of chirping birds and crickets you should not be looking for a hotel in Paris. Check-in – Again, the hotel is small and so is the lobby. As I mentioned we stayed at the hotel on 3 separate occasions during the length of our stay, we were in rooms 112, 312, and 612. We booked club double rooms and were there for 1-night, 4-nights, and 1-night respectively. Check-in went smoothly all three times, on our first visit arriving for the US, our rooms were not ready (we were early), but the hotel offered to stow our bags, offered coffee and a snack and then we went for a walk. When we returned our rooms were ready and we took the small elevator to our room. I have read peoples negative comments about the size of the elevator and it is true it is very small, about enough room for 1-person and 2-bags. So you take turns, there is no reason why everyone needs to get to the room at the same time. Relax folks you are on vacation and things run a little different in Europe than they do in the US. The elevator was reliable and in working order for our entire stay. I have been in other similar sized hotels that did not have an elevator, so the shear fact that there is one was a plus for us… On our return visit there were 12 of us check-in taking 7-rooms, we lined people up outside so as to not overwhelm the lobby, the check-in process or the elevator. All our rooms were ready and the check-in went very smoothly. On our final return it was just the two of us and again we had no issues checking-in. The rooms – 112, 312, 612. As I stated earlier, we booked club twin rooms for me personally and several other type rooms, including club double, standard double and single rooms. I will not speak for the other rooms, just the rooms I personally stayed in. Rooms 112 and 312 are identical to each other. The room has 2 twin beds which are pushed up to each other with a night stand on either side. There is a small desk, fridge, coffee machine, very small safe (not big enough for an average size lap top, but maybe an ipad), and a place to hang some clothes. There was room to put out 2 large suite cases, but you will be bumping into them… The rooms had double doors, which blocked out noise from the corridor and as I said earlier the windows are sound blocking. You can also close the shutters for added noise reduction. The rooms are small, but about average for a European hotel. The rooms are not designed to be spend any quality time. It is a room to get a good night sleep and a nap in the afternoon. Really you should be out seeing the sights of Paris and not spending it in your room… If you want a large room so you can spend the day in it then you should check your self into an American style hotel. Bathroom – is very small. Only one person can be in the bathroom at one time (and do you really want to be in the bathroom when there is someone else in there…? OK, maybe when you are trying to get ready for dinner...) There is a small sink, toilet and a small tub with a hand held shower on a pole. As is typical in European hotels there is no shower curtain, but a ¾ glass divider and yes water gets everywhere… One note the ventilation system did not work very well and the room gets very steamy when taking a shower. Room – 612 – On our final return to Paris for one night, we were put into room 612. As I noted I booked club twin rooms for myself and this is the only room that I would have complained about, but I did not. We were only there for the one night, but this room is even smaller than the other 2 rooms 112 and 312. I am not saying I should have received any special treatment, but I was the organizer for the group and booked 60+ hotel nights during the month of September. It would have been nice to maybe have one of the rooms I previously stayed in or maybe even an upgrade, the hotel was not fully booked. Again, I did not complain we were already in our room and it is on the 6th floor. If we were going to be there longer or when we go back, I will ask for a different room. Checking-out – was just as easy as check-in, but I did book as a group so things are a little different for us. Front desk – was exceptional they answered all our questions and were able to get us last minute reservations for a group of 14 in some exceptional restaurants. I and I think everyone in our group would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LesMLondonderry Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay in the Royal Magda Etoile and yet again everything was perfect. The hotel is in a fantastic location, the rooms are clean and comfortable, but even better than either of these is the friendly staff from whom nothing is too much trouble. This was a family holiday and we had 3 rooms, all of which were very good. I know where I will be staying if I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: devsamra
Reviews.Content: Have to say the thing that made staying at this hotel such a great experience was the exceptional staff. They bent over so far backwards to help us with everything, they were like Chinese gymnasts. They helped with everything from recommending good restaurants to eat, making reservations, giving advice about travel and how best to get to any tourist destination. Always with the most genuine of smiles. If there was a Nobel Prize for hotel staff, these guys should get it. The hotel itself was just metres from the Arc de Triomphe and the Charles De Gaulle metro station. It was probably only a 20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. It was in a quiet street off the Avenue Wagram. We stayed in the suite which was brilliant. It had a separate living room with a sofa bed for the kids and a bedroom for us. The beds were extremely comfyand there was plenty of room. TV in both rooms was a nice touch and the bathroom was really nicely done up. We really loved the very European windows that opened up to overlook a pretty courtyard. The breakfast was lovely and there was plenty of it. Wi-fi in the room was free. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff--was a perfect home base in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: stlawraj
Reviews.Content: Happily, the previous reviewers were right on. From the moment we walked in, the staff and hotel were hospitable, accommodating, and comfortable. We arrived at 11 am, and the staff took care of our luggage, got us drinks, and made us very comfortable while they got our room ready early. The location was great. We saved a ton by using the Metro (Charles deGaulle Etoile station was blocks away) and the Air France airport shuttle, and there were plenty of decently priced restaurants close. Get a balcony if you can. We enjoyed breakfasts, light dinners, and midnight snacks al fresco with provisions from visits to open air markets and the Publicis Drugstore about a 10-minutes walk away. If you're thinking of making dinner or cabaret reservations but don't really speak French, take advantage of the friendly staff. They took care of reservations for Crazy Horse (lots of fun!) and helped us avoid some very legitimate looking but actually fake ticket websites. When (not if) I go back to Paris, I'll go back to Royal Magda Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Junior Suite - which had a bedroom and separate living room with a pull out couch. Completely spacious and perfect for people traveling with children, or 2 couples. I can't say enough about the service. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful, from providing electrical converters, calling cabs to suggesting places to eat. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a 5 star experience at the price of a 3 star hotel. Also - you can NOT beat the location! Steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Élysées!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel -so close to the metro!”
Reviews.Author: Exploremt
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. It was a great little place. The staff was just as friendly as everyone else said and it was nice to have our little oasis with a tiny balcony on the fifth floor. I am not giving the hotel 5 stars because of the bed. The bed was as hard as a rock. We ended up having to put the Duvee beneath the bottom sheet just to add a little padding, which worked surprisingly well. Luckily it was warm enought just to sleep with a sheet. The hotel says it has A/C but we didn't seem to have any. The thermostat was for heat only. Overall these are minor complaints for such a great hotel and at under 200 euro per night it was a real value. We used booking.com and it worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “A very good find”
Reviews.Author: canmex23
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Paris for 3 without mortgaging your future in high season (or the end of it) wasn't easy. With so many options and research we took a chance on the Royal Magda and weren't disappointed. Great location just a block from the Arc de Triumph and the metro. Staff were very kind and eager to assist with anything needed. The room was actually pretty large compared to other hotels in Paris and the suite accomodated 3 no worries and in comfort. Back to Paris again and this will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Pat P
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beat for location and service. Very close to the Arc of Triumph and Metro station with many different lines. While the rooms are small, they are clean and the bathrooms are modern. Service at the front desk was exceptional. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and the daily selection was very good ( fruit, cereal, yogurt, rolls, croissants, sliced meat and cheeses etc) There are tons of restaurants to choose from within walking distance. Would have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Amenities, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Royal Magda with my two adult daughters. We chose the hotel after reading very positive reviews on TripAdvisor and the hotel lived up to expectations. The room was a good size for three adults and was in good condition. Breakfast was tasty and a good start to the day. We found all the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. The location was perfect - handy to the Metro and to key sights. We highly recommend Hotel Royal Magda to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Rick B
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 6 days and wanted to stay close to all the action. Royal Magda delivers as it close to cafe's, great restaurants and the metro. Staff were very attentive and remembered your name. Room was small (it's Paris) and clean. Overall a great place to stay and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Kind staffs, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: because99
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. It was just 1-2 minutes away from Arc de triomphe and metro station. There were many restorants and nice bars around the hotel. The room was small but very comfortable. Most of all, the staffs were very kind. I've lost the receipt of payment for the hotel, which was necessary for the refund from my company (because it was a business trip). After I've come back to my country, I asked them to send me a copy of receipt by an e-mail. They kindly sent me a scanned image of the receipt immediately. I hope other people also enjoy the travel in Paris with these kind staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Service at comfortable, well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiantango
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Magda Etoile a couple of times and will stay again. It is in a good location near L'Etoile, but quiet. The hotel is nicely appointed and the staff are outstanding! Truly some of the best guest service anywhere. We have stayed in a family suite with our sons and also in a deluxe king (or equivalent) room. The suite was spacious by Paris standards with nice furnishings, comfortable beds and a beautiful bathroom. The deluxe king room was on the small side and could use a new carpet, but nice just the same, with comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The staff have always gone out of their way to help us and insure that we were happy and had everything we needed to make our stay enjoyable. I have found that the hotels own website is the best deal. Their pricing is very reasonable for central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip at Easter”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here after reading fabulous reviews on Tripadvisor - and have to admit I came away concluding that most of them must have been written by friends and family of the staff! The hotel is in a good central location, a couple of minutes walk from L'Etoile. But ... The rooms were very pokey (ok, I know this is Paris, and cat swinging is bonus in rooms). As well as a double, we had a family room for our four - yes, count'em - kids. Opened the door and the room absolutely stank - a musty, stale odour - as though it hadn't been cleaned or certainly aired for months. The staff meanwhile were less than friendly. Ok, so I know this is Paris - and we're English - but still ... I would try elsewhere, and go here only as a final resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. We are going back to Paris in December and have already re booked”
Reviews.Author: expitch6
Reviews.Content: Super Friendly and helpful staff set this hotel apart from the rest. Great location right by Arche de Triumphe and close to Champs. Also right be Metro. Great staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: saralara64
Reviews.Content: The front desk was helpful and accommodating as soon as we arrived. Plus - the hotel has an elevator which was helpful with a stroller. Room was definitely on the small side even though we had the junior suite but we were able to squeeze 2 adults, 1 child and 1 infant in a crib. Room was clean but could definitely use some updating. Location was phenomenal - right near the Arc de Triomphe. Great hotel if you need to get a room for 4 people at a reasonable rate 229 Euro for the last minute rate. Con was that i ordered 2 small waters from the bar - 3 euro EACH kinda pricey in my opinion. otherwise i was happy.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find. We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Carmel H
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay when visiting Paris. Metro & Coach stops to the Airports are right beside it. I was there on business but also wanted to do some sight-seeing. The location was superb. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The room I stayed in was not very spacious-but had everything I needed, was nicely decorated and very clean. I did not avail of the food in the hotel as I like to eat in different places when on a trip and there were no shortage of well priced eateries and cafes in the immediate area. I will certainly book this Hotel again. I booked well in advance and got a very good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: KristiCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block away from the L' Arc de Triomphe and so close to the Champs de Elysse, metro stations, tour bus stops which means you can get anywhere easily from it. The room was simple, neat and clean. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. I would stay here again. The only annoying this was it is a breakfast included place and we had breakfast on our day that we checked out - it makes sense because you do not have breakfast on the day you check in - and they charged us 15 euros each. They didn't tell us before we ate or we wouldn't have eaten. I had a coffee, a banana and a yogurt. It was so annoying!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay! will be back.”
Reviews.Author: HeavenAF
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is really what makes it a gem. They are so friendly and knowledgeable. All three of the people we dealt with were wonderful. The hotel was clean and the location cant be beat. It is right next to the subway, which can take you anywhere in the city. The staff also will tell you what lines to take to get to what attractions. The only downside is that the rooms are tiny, my closet at home is bigger than our room was! Apparently though this is pretty standard for Paris, and we will be going back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: brynjones9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed for a short stay in Paris and at a very reasonable cost per night. The lady on reception could not be more delightful or helpful. The rooms are not large but quite suitable and perfectly clean. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as there were many alternatives close by. In all an excellent choice for what can be an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristaMM
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on reviews we read on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel, and specifically our room, looked exactly as expected. We were especially pleased with the front desk staff-they were always so friendly and helpful. If we are fortunate enough to visit Paris again, we will stay at Royal Magda Etoile!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lesl_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near the Arc de Triomphe, great for getting around on foot or train. The room was very pleasant and comfortable and bigger than I expected for the centre of Paris. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5th time back - and won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: RBB-7
Reviews.Content: We like the Magda. My wife and I have always had great stays. This past May we stayed for three days. We wish it could have been a month. Of course, the hotel is always very clean and the location is wonderful for walking and public transportation. But-- the real reason we keep coming back - is the staff. From the front desk to housekeeping, they could not be nicer. It is a pleasure to be greeted warmly and to feel that it is genuine and not an act. Aurelie (Lillie) on the desk, is a joy to deal with and is always charming and helpful. Call her, and she will suggest the best times to visit and she probably will give you a good rate (sometimes better than the internet), as well. Actually, everyone is friendly and helpful, but lillie also speaks excellent English. We love to walk down the Avenue de Wagram for a concert at the Salle Pleyel - a world class concert hall. Just book on line and pick up tickets at the door. Read all the other positive reviews for nice things to do in the area. Please take the slightly negative "little elevator" complaints or the "expensive breakfast" complaints with a grain of salt. This isn't a Hampton Inn in Cleveland, It's a small hotel in Paris. The elevator is fine, and we've never had a problem with the breakfast - it's convenient , good and served with a big "bonjour". If you want a cheaper breakfast there are at least five places (including a MacDonalds) within a 2 minute walk. Bottom line - Still a great place for a Paris trip. Love the place! Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: fourfivesix
Reviews.Content: We had a total of four nights in Paris - two nights at the start and two at the end of our trip to France. On both occasions we stayed in the Etoile area, and our stay at Royal Magda for two nights was at the back end of our trip. We liked the location. It's very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. It's also very convenient if you plan to take the Air France bus from (and to) the CDG airport; the stop is just about 5 minutes away on foot. The staff at Royal Magda was friendly and helpful, the rooms clean (we had two rooms). Although it is charming in a way, it does need some updating. The rooms are pretty small and bathrooms and furnishings very dated. The lift is really tiny and slow, so be patient unless you're prepared to use the stairs. Compared to the two nights at Le Meridien at the start of our trip, we didn't feel that our stay at Magda was very good value. But to be fair, I must point out that we were back in Paris during the Bastille Day weekend, which must affect the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: camimalia
Reviews.Content: Great recommendation. We have two teens and booked the junior suite at the recommendation of the hotel. they said that it's most comfortable for 3 but 4 would work fine. They were right. The pull out bed in the living area was already made up for us when we arrived. The main room was spacious and the bathroom beautiful and tasteful. The suites, apparently, lookout onto the inner courtyard but that was fine. The staff was helpful with every suggestion from sightseeing, to restaurants, to metros. Very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast for 12 euros is plenty. Meats and cheeses, coffee, tea, bread, yogurt, fruit, hot chocolate for the kids, butter, jam, juices cereal, milk, a great deal. The hotel is conveniently located just up from a metro stop, 2 blocks from the Arc and 3 blocks from the Champs. Clean, inviting, we'll definitely stay again, with kids or without! Thank you trip advisor for advising us well. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lise C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and 3 children for 5 nights. Overall experience very good. Convenient location near Metro station. Front desk staff very helpful and accomodating. Rooms were clean and air conditioned but could be improved with some paint touch ups!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: utchampions
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and had the "european" feel to them. Not large, but had everything you could need, and was clean. The elevator was a little small for two people and our luggage, but that was not a problem once it was in the room. Staff was cordial, but not overly nice. Great location, just a few hundred feet from the Arc, and the metro stop is right around the corner. The one negative, and it is a small one, is that the breakfast buffet is not worth the high price. With local places right around the corner (and a McDonalds at the end of the road), it isnt necessary. Overall, for the price, I would recommend and stay again. It didn't wow me or go above and beyond, but the room was clean and nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: bex12345
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was warm upon welcome and readily available throughout our entire stay. They were friendly and offered many helpful suggestions. The suite was clean, cozy, and very comfortable. The hotel offers a nice breakfast in the mornings, which we did not try, but looking back, we would've had breakfast in the hotel. Perusing the spread, the food looked much tastier than what we ended up having out-and-about. The location of the hotel is excellent, right by L'Arc de Triomphe and the subway. There are many cafes and tabacs in the area, open all day long. We had a very lovely time at the Royal Magda Etoile and in Paris, and will choose this hotel again for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Paris break”
Reviews.Author: Eggy_sandwich
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, literally 2 mins from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro stop. The rooms are small but well equipped and spotless, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Don't be put off by the uninspiring exterior, inside it's lovely - would happily stay here again and would definitely recommend it for a Paris weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded - Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: craig84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Royal Magda on 30th July for 1 night as a surprise weekend for my girlfriends birthday. From the booking process direct with the hotel to the check-out was first class. I booked direct with the hotel a Club Double Room a good 4 months in advance. After seeing all the great reviews over this period I was really excited about staying here. I had contacted the hotel in advance to request restaurant recomendations and to mention the reason for my visit. Upon arrival (9am) on Saturday morning, we decided to drop our bags off at the hotel so we could do some early sightseeing. The lady behind the desk informed us that we had infact been upgraded for free to a suite and that we could come back from our sightseeing and check in to our room later. We did this later in the afternoon, the suite was lovely and so was the complimentary champagne and nibbles. A great surprise! The suite consisted of a living area, large bathroom with shower and bath and a large bedroom and big bed. Everything was perfect for the occasion. The hotel recomended a restaurant very close to the Hotel, and it turned out to be a fanatstic recomendation at Le Hide. Once our ngiht's stay was over we again left our bags with the hotel (very handy) and went off sightseeing again. The hotel itself is lovely as well as the helpful staff - but its the location thats the big seller - literally 2 mins walk from the Arc De Triumphe and Charles de Gouille Etoille metro station, Thanks very much for a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 2\3 star”
Reviews.Author: psellus
Reviews.Content: Paris is one of the most expensive cities in Europe for hotels though that's hardly surprising given it's such an amazing place to visit. Needed a cheap hotel for 3 weeks and this was well reviewed on TripAdvisor. Location wise it is indeed brilliant. A minute from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee with good Metro connections. There is not much in the way of luxury but it's fine, the room is clean and if you are there to see the sites you wont be spending much time indoors anyway. Would I stay again? If I could afford somewhere better probably not but at around €130 it's a complete bargain by Parisian standards!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Imedvindfranord
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel with a perfect location in Paris. It is located in a quiet street just a few minutes walk from Champs elysees and the Arc de triomphe, barely 300 meters from the hotel entrance. This is a small hotel, with a tiny but nice lobby. My room was of a good size compared to other hotels in Paris with similar price level. It was also of a much better standard than I am used to when paying about 120 euros pr. night for a room in this city. Breakfast was all right, but nothing to remember. I suggest you rather have your breakfast at a nearby café. The staff was very nice and service minded. They also spoke english very well. If sightseeing and shopping is your primary target for a weekend stay in Paris, I would definitely recommend you to stay at this hotel. Good value for money and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Poppychristchurch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with another couple in May 2010. The rooms were very nice and spacious and modern decor. Bathroom adequate and roomy. Very friendly and helpful reception staff. Close by to underground train and Arch de triump. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Room Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: skedadl
Reviews.Content: Great location of the Champs and right around the corner from the Arch, but the room needs help. This is the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in Europe! I had a single room. The bed was hard as concrete, the housekeeping service occurred very late in the day (4:00 or so), the sheets were never changed over a four night stay, the room was noisy due to thin walls, and the bedding smelled like smoke. The carpet was soiled and had cigarette burns, as did the bedspread. The Internet, while free, will time out after 2 hours and cut you off, and I had trouble reconnecting on two occasions. The shower stall is a joke. It is so small it is very difficult to move, and you bump the shower handle either turning off the water or changing the temperature while moving an inch in any direction. The front desk staff is great, very knowlegeable and willing to offer touring advice, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: RovingWanderers
Reviews.Content: Service was efficient and Lily was great with her tips about the various sights, tours etc. Service was efficient and Lily was great with her tips about the various sights, tours etc. We stayed in a street facing club room - we found the room and the bathroom rather small, however there was no noise from the adjoining street. The hotel has an elevator although it's not very big like most hotels in Europe. Breakfast was good and was served till late. As other travelers have already mentioned, the biggest plus point of this hotel is it's location - 2 mins walk from from Arc De Triomphe, the metro station, the Air France airport shuttle (Les Cars Air France and also the stop for the 'hop-on hop-off' red bus (Les Cars Rouge). Highly recommend the Air france airport shuttle as it was only EUR 15 per person as against EUR 60 for a taxi! We found the red bus to be very convenient and cost effective, and used it extensively during our stay to visit the various sights - EUR 10 for a 2 day pass (unlimited usage).

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS TRUE! HOTEL ROYAL MAGDA IS FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: SimonWWA
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as ninth during the honeymoon. Experience excellent! We got a great room on the top floor with small balconie and nice views. After we unpacked our bags we received champagne to the room with wishes from the director of the hotel. Very nice gesture. It was a real surprise. Thank you very much again. The hotel staff very nice and helpful. Breakfast delicious, more typically French. Hotel situated perfectly. Everything in this place was just wonderful. We highly recommend We recommend also at least once - instead of going to a restaurant (plenty around) - make solid purchases of prepared meals in the store Monoprix (lots of delicious salads, cheeses! Wraps, shrimps, fruit - and baguette is a must!) and sit by the table on the balcony, open a bottle of good wine, stay together and just talk to each other - a typical romantic - as it should be in Paris ... and later... the night is yours ;)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: thastmc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royal Magda Etoile was a perfect experience in every way. The hotel is situated in an ideal location, approximately 5 minutes from the Arc de' Triomphe, which is a great location for taking the metro nearly anywhere in Paris. The surrounding neighborhood had excellent restaurants, some which rank as the best in the city per Tripadvisor. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and always had a welcoming smile. They gladly assisted us with storing our luggage while we toured the city before our train departure. The breakfast was maybe the best I've had in all of Europe and would highly recommend it. The room itself was more than sufficient and comfortable, with a great bathroom (good hot water pressure!). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city. It truly was a great experience and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “location location location!”
Reviews.Author: fiona0284
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot - close to metro and Champs Elysees. Rooms were comfortable (if a little noisy - but I think that's standard in Europe!). Staff were friendly and informative, and breaky was lovely :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but please invest in some shower curtains!”
Reviews.Author: ianross239
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a double club room in July 2011. The staff were friendly and helpful, the location is excellent, the rooms were clean, and internet access was free. My only complaint is that there was no curtain around the bath so the bathroom floor was soaked every time I had a shower.

Reviews.Title: “A gem with perfect location and great, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: yns_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived shortly before 10am for two nights in late May and although our room (312) was not ready for an hour, we were able to leave our bags. The location is perfect: three very short blocks from both the Arc de Triumph and the buses from Orly/Charles de Gaulle. The elevator is very small, it only fit the two of us plus our two small bags, however, there are stairs (useful for getting legs fit to climb the various monuments). Our room was compact, neat and clean with a flat screen TV, small table, two chairs, safe, and cupboard with a curtain for clothing. Bathroom was also compact with a hair dryer, bath/shower and all the desired amenities. There is free wifi throughout the hotel. Although centrally located we were able to sleep without any interruption from outside noise and the beds were firm and comfortable, ensuring a good rest.
