Breakfast was just delicious – cold cuts, cheeses, yoghurt, croissants (plain and chocolate), doughnuts, juice, milk and coffee was brought to order. Eggs were offered but we were more than satisfied with the buffet offerings. The reception staff were outstanding, especially Mila. Boarding passes were printed for us; and when asking the best way to get somewhere, maps would be printed and the best route marked; and recommendations on what to see based on our interests and where to dine were spot on. Highly recommend for location, quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for the quality of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: okiemom
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient for the subway. However, the street the hotel is located on is loud and full of trash bins etc. The carpet in the room was stained and dirty. The shower caused a lake on the floor no matter what we did. The room and hallway smelled moldy and musty. There was loud construction just outside our window all day long. We payed more for this hotel than any other in our 2 week, 4 city trip. It was the most expensive and the least deserving of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: SashSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and very clean. The staff are just brilliant, and so helpful, I couldn't believe it. On the downside, the street that its located on is a bit dingy and you have to navigate your way through the garbage bins of the various clubs and restaurants to get there. Its fairly noisy at night and the rooms are small, even for Paris. There's barely enough space for 2 people, and a larger person is not going to fit in the bathroom. It is good value for money and ideal to use as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LuluBurke77
Reviews.Content: This was a last minutes booking and we were thrilled with everything, location is fabulous being able to walk everywhere the service is impeccable we had two young children with strollers the staff stored them for us. Breakfast was delicious!!! 10/10 :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe vacinity, hospitable service”
Reviews.Author: Fyzzida28
Reviews.Content: A stone throw away from champs elysse, this hotel is must stay. Close to CDG Etoile Metro and RER, accessibility is never an issue. Rooms are clean,prim and proper everytime I came back to the hotel room in the evening. The service staffs are very efficient and they are well versed in english. I got to know my directions with their help. Also book Eiffel tower tics through them. Will definitely stay here again my next trip to Paris. For it's price, my Safety and comfort is assured.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location, and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: s7reamliner
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on trip advisor looking for a Paris hotel that was: clean, in a good location (near restaurants, monuments, shopping), and presented good value for cost. This is exactly what the Royal Magda Etoile presents. What we liked most about the hotel was the staff and how helpful they were. We dealt frequently with two different girls and one man at the front desk and they all gave terrific recommendations and provided assistance with anything we needed. As with most hotels in large cities, the rooms are pretty small but at an expected and manageable level. Enjoyed the free wi fi and breakfast here was pretty good as well. If I return to Paris this will be the first place I look for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not more, actually a bit less”
Reviews.Author: Jpug70
Reviews.Content: We bookwd this hotel based on TripAdvisor's reviews and info.The hotel site and reviews somewhat represent the reality buuut, the elevator is so small, you cant fit with your luggage, let alone your significant other, the doors to e rooms have this automaric spring that shuts the door as you try to open them, which makes entering or leaving the room with luggage a titanic feat, thereis barely room in the room (can u say that?) to pkace yournluggage, let alone extra bags, breakfast is ok, but very repetitive day after day. Would I stay here again, probably not. I would try to find something a bit better, even if it meant paying a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not convenient”
Reviews.Author: SFmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Magda for 8 nights based on good reviews. The breakfast was good, especially when they're open from 7 to 12. The front desk was nice and welcoming but didn't seem to know the city that well based on their answers to our questions. Free wi-fi was a definite bonus. The metro entrance was conveniently close by. It was our first trip to Paris and if I had to do it again, I would stay closer to the Marais area. The hotel is close to the Arc and expensive shopping area but we spent most of our time on the other side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will go back there for sure”
Reviews.Author: RCBY
Reviews.Content: Went here with a group of girlfriends. Brilliant location 5 mins away from the Arc de Triomphe, which was great for the Paris first timers in our group. On arrival, our rooms had been mixed up, but that was quickly sorted out by the friendly staff. Rooms are a decent size, with a nice, very clean bathroom. Note that the lift is for two people only (or one and the luggage !), but if you're there for the sight seeing, that is fine. Decent prices, and given the location, the Magda is definitely worth a visit. Will recommend it to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: DaveML
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Magda and very much enjoyed the experience. The staff were very welcoming and offered great advice on local eating options. Three adults shared a junior suite and we had plenty of room especially given complaints about room sizes generally in Paris This area is by no means the cheapest part of central Paris but has great access to the city via 2 very nearby Metro stations. The area feels very safe at any hour and there are some great bars nearby. All in all a really nice experience, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “My parents loved their stay in Hotel Royal Magda Etoile!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBliss7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents 60th wedding anniversary and they arrived back enthusing about the very warm welcome and excellent hospitality they received. They said they got a lovely room, and the bottle of champagne on arrival was a much-appreciated nice touch! They also said that the location was hard to beat and that the hotel staff - especially Lilly - were very helpful and lovely to deal with. Going on their recommendation I am hoping to stay there myself one day…

Reviews.Title: “"Just like staying at home"”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeFergal
Reviews.Content: The title is the review of our 9 year old son - he loved it. Nice room, with a nice double bed for the grownups, and a decent pullout bed for our 2 young sons - 9 and 7 years old. Breakfast was good value as it was free for the children, and was excellent for what it was. The location is fabulous - convenient for both metro and RER. The staff couldn't be more helpful, with advice and restaurant tips. We would definitely stay again, next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service & location”
Reviews.Author: bartmcvey
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had a recent short stay at the Royal Magda. The location just a few blocks from both the Arc de Triomphe roundabout with Underground access & the Champs-Elysees was very convenient. All members of the staff that we interacted with spoke English freely & were very helpful with inquiries concerning restaurants & transportation. The morning breakfast was very good & serving staff always attended to our needs with a smile. There are also several good restaurants within short walking distance of the Hotel. Our room was clean, comfortable & properly attended to each day. The only inconvenience---& it was minor---was the small elevator. Only one person could occupy it with luggage, & two, maybe three persons otherwise. However, this is a smaller boutique hotel & this did not detract from our overall experience. Considering the price, the Royal Magda represents a great value & may provide significant savings for a comfortable stay to anyone not spending the majority of their time in their hotel room while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Charming! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: workanai
Reviews.Content: This hotel started off our honeymoon! First off, they had champagne waiting for us in our room- which was really sweet of the staff to acknowledge! In addition, the hotel was clean and moderately sized for a hotel room in Paris. Also, it was in such a great location. Only a few blocks away from the Air France Shuttle bus to and from CDG. Also, less than 5 minutes away from the Arc and the Champs! The side street was really quiet at night- although it was so close to the Arc. Also, it was very close to the Metro- which was perfect to navigate all of Paris and it's wonders. The only con, if any, were the walls- we could hear some of the other guests in the rooms next to us. However, this didn't affect our sleep, as we exhausted ourselves with tons of walking and sightseeing during the day. Great place- will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: camelia_d
Reviews.Content: By Paris standards, this is a very good deal. Yes, the space is tight (6 rooms on each floor, elevator fits one person, rooms are on the small side), but that is to be expected in the City of Lights. But what it lacks in space, Magda makes up for with (1) great location, few minutes from Arc de Triomphe; (2) friendly staff ready to lend a hand including making available an ipad when I needed access to a computer, and giving best advice on airport transfers; and (3) cleanliness. There was a large LCD TV in the room, mostly with French channels, and free wifi (good speed). For the same budget, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkstein
Reviews.Content: My wife, two adult children and myself recently stayed at the Royal Magda. We really enjoyed our stay there. The rooms were very clean, the bedding was wonderful, and the staff, from the front desk to the housekeeping were top-notch. The front desk were extremely helpful for suggestions and advice. We had to catch a plane at CDG airport to fly to Vienna, and the hotel had a taxi waiting for us at 4:00 am, no problem. So close to the Arc de Triomph..right around the corner. Had a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to book there again. Thanks again the to the staff for making our stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda Etoile - Very Special”
Reviews.Author: ardithsue5
Reviews.Content: Spending three nights at this wonderful hotel less than three blocks from the Arc de Triomphe (and the metro station there) was perfect for getting around Paris. Our junior club accommodations were extremely spacious - not typical of Paris hotels - clean with modern TV and wifi too! Breakfast was excellent. The hotel staff does everything you could ask to please guests and always with a sense of sincerity. My sister and I were delighted at staying there. it was also near many restaurants and shops but off to the side on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, phenomenal service- a great find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: lordoftheonionrings
Reviews.Content: My parents and I just returned from a five-day stay at this hotel, and had a wonderful time at this lovely hotel. The location is terrific- about 1.5 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, next to a metro station with multiple lines that allowed us to get anywhere we wanted to go in Paris with only a single line change. Most sightseeing destinations were a straight shot. Additionally, the Air France buses from Charles de Gaulle and Orly stop about 1 block from the hotel, making transport from the airport inexpensive and easy. Also, the Champs Elysees is about a 3-4 walk from the hotel, with easy access to amazing shopping and dining. The hotel itself is very beautifully maintained, and the service was incredible. The reception staff were truly the most responsive, courteous and thoughtful I have seen at a European hotel, and they consistently went out of their way to be helpful. They even offered to provide us with breakfast at 5AM the day we were leaving to catch an early morning flight! I really can't say enough about the service, as this is what truly distinguishes this hotel from all others. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable- we stayed in a large and comfortable two-room suite with a large bathroom. There is free, fast Wi-Fi in all the rooms, and there are dozens of places to eat within a stone's throw of the hotel. Our room faced the back of the hotel, and we had no noise issues at all. Overall, I am very impressed by this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone, and will certainly be staying there again the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A real find. Fantastic location and gorgeous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Muff03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in early January. Weather was cold and wet but the hotel was warm and friendly. The most helpful of staff and a fantastic location. Terrific breakfasts and only 100 metres from the Metro. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT THE ROYAL MAGDA ETOILE AND YOUR STAY IN PARIS WILL TRULY BE A MEMORABLE ONE - IT'S PERFECT IN EVERY WAY!”
Reviews.Author: ROXYBEV Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff was excellent and they were all English speaking and very courteous at all times. The room was nicely decorated and light and airy. We had clean sheets every day too. We were ten minutes walk at the most from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees where we caught the open top bus for a tour of the city. There were plenty of bars and restaurants just up the road from the hotel but there was no noise from anywhere when you were in your room and both myself and my mother slept well. This was my mother's first trip abroad at the age of 75 and she hasn't stopped talking about what a wonderful time we had. We will definitely recommend the hotel as there was nothing at all to dislike. Thank you to all the staff for making us so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robbywillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the other weekend and would echo all the other reviews re. location/cleanliness/breakfast/staff/ etc. Really nice hotel but, quite disappointed with the room we were given. It was on the top (6th)floor, facing the inside patio, which we could not see due to being so high up. ( I think it was room No. 611 or 612). It was small and because it was in the garret, it was made even smaller due to the inward sloping external walls. One side of the bed was pushed up against the wall. I pulled it away from the wall, leaving just enough access to get into the (nice, large) bathroom. The room was also quite drab. A thin carpet, and a curtain across the very small hanging space. It was quiet though. I didn’t request a move as the hotel was full due to it being Paris Marathon weekend and to be quite honest, other than to sleep, we hardly spent any time in the room. If staying here again, which I definitely would, I’d make sure we didn’t get the same room again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkestel
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor ratings and location to the sights. Having been to Paris a number of times in the past 2 years, this hotel is definitely a good choice. Although starting to look a little shabby around the edges, the service is very good, the room clean, bed comfortable and an all around pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: k8mcg0811 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was great, the people were really welcoming and friendly. The location was fabulous just being a few minutes walk from the Champs Elsyee and Arc de Triomphe. The room and bathroom were brilliant, perfect for two. Breakfast was good but would not pay extra for it.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a lovely quiet side street.”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie34
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and a quiet night's sleep, yet the hotel was only 200m from the Arc de Triomphe. Rooms small (as in most hotels in Paris) but pristine with good facilities. Reception faultless.

Reviews.Title: “they deserve the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Perisse
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Royal Magda Etoile due to the great reviews they got at tripadvisor. I should say that they deserve each compliment that they got. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice, the location is excelent. But the service is their best. The staff make what is possible to please the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Hariharan_S
Reviews.Content: To be frank, I had been warned to expect snooty service in Paris, and some of my experiences at more than a few places lived up to that reputation. However, the Royal Magda was a glorious exception. The front-desk staff (esp Lilly) were unfailingly courteous & extremely helpful. We stayed on the top floor in one of the Mansard rooms, and the room was comfy. Compared to what I'm guessing is the standard in Europe, our room was spacious enough (20 sq m), and the amenities were quite adequate. If pushed to quibble, I'd say the Internet connection in the room was patchy, but I never really needed it much, given how well-informed & helpful the front-desk staff was. They managed to get us dinner reservations, tickets to shows & helped immensely at check-out (my mistake in reading our itinerary led to a rushed departure). The hotel is located very conveniently, being 2 mins from Arc de Triomphe, and there's a variety of places to dine at, all around. I did not use it (owing to said rushed departure) but the Air France shuttle to CDG & Orly is also only 2 mins away, as is the Charles de Gaulle Etoile RER. Looking back, Paris was a superb choice of place to celebrate our anniversary at, and I think the staff of Royal Magda played no small part in ensuring a truly memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: vandal9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our Honeymoon in January 2010, (my review is a little overdue)Staff was extremely helpful and it was in an amazing location. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “May well be your choice!”
Reviews.Author: HotelCooler
Reviews.Content: Taking into account the overall situation of hotels in Paris, which are usually overpriced, old, and dirty, this hotel is an exception. This could well be your choice during your leisure trip in Paris. In this, slightly overpriced, three-star hotel you will find what you expect in an hotel of this category. Ideally located close to Etoile. Close the metro station, touristic bus stop, taxi stop, restaurants of all types, etc. The great staff and quality of services were beyond any expectation. Congratulations to all of them. I would appreciate a little more thorough cleaning of the room and more variety in breakfast. The slightly overpriced room rate could well include breackfast but didn't. Didn't try the Ethernet Internet connection at the room, but the free WiFi at the ground level worked conveniently (for some reason I had problems with it at the evenings). Wonderful sleep quality. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk makes this place!”
Reviews.Author: lovetheowl
Reviews.Content: Great location. 24 hour coverage of front desk, all workers most pleasant and helpful. There is a metro stop on Wagram, toward Arc. Metro lines go up Champs to many sites, and you can come in from airport on Air France bus close by. McDonalds on end of block very handy. Bus stop at Arc on Champs goes to D'Orsay. Wireless internet worked in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mrsspurs
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by friends. The location is excellent, so close to L'Arc de Triomphe and a very easy walk to the airport bus which is extremely useful when you have a heavy suitcase! Great value. We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Ali2703
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, Saturday and Sunday at the end of march 2011. One of the best things about this hotel has to be the location. We took the air France (route 2) bus from CDG airport and the bus drops you off literally 5 mins away from the hotel. The hotel is just around the corner from the arc de triumph and champs elysees. It is 2 mins walk from Charles de Gaulle toile metro which is a great central stop, the first couple of days we just walked everywhere but in our last day we took the metro from Charles de Gaulle toile to Anvers to visit sacre coeur, the journey took approx 15 mins. Our room was very small but we expected this of hotels on Paris. The decor is simple and the whole hotel was very clean. Our bathroom was again small but very clean with a good hot and powerful shower. We never ate breakfast at the hotel as the cost for this is 12€, you can breakfast for the same price sitting on the champs elysees or a bit cheaper off it. On our first night we ate at the restaurant next door to the hotel Le petit bouchon gourmande - I have written a separate review about this. Our meal there was excellent, I would definitely reccomend it. The staff on reception were very friendly and spoke perfect English (puts my ability to speak very little French to shame!). I would definitely return to this hotel if I visit Paris again and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!! A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: J-Hi111
Reviews.Content: The reviews filled us with confidence and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is in a fantastic location, you couldn't wish for anything better. The price was really reasonable and amazing service and cleanliness to go with it. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to others and I will certainly be going again. Loved it, Paris is amazing! :)

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Paris.You should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: shimmerrrrr
Reviews.Content: Three streets to Champs Elysees.You can have your breakfast on Champ Elysees. Metro station is very close.You can go anywhere, anytime. Rooms-bathrooms are clean. Recepcionists are very friendly and helpful. You can reach this hotel from Orly airport by Air France shuttle in 35-45 minutes. If I travel there again, I would definitely stay here again. You won't regret about it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and chic”
Reviews.Author: Robsdiroma
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just a few steps from 'etoile' and underground station, nice neighborhood, cozy atmosphere, 24h concierge with kind attention to any need. Reasonable price, clean and warm . A perfect hotel for family trips to Paris. Really recommended for families looking for best value. It has all the plus(es) of a family-run business with a professional touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fireguy199
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous posters comments .I was using the free wifi by the front desk and notice 3 different staff helping with all kinds of questions and myself by printing off boarding passes. The hotel is a 7 min walk from the Air France bus from the airport ( 54 euros for 2 return) 25 min walk to the tower and 1 hour walk to Notra Dame. Subway stop around corner straight run to Lourve. Also all the hop on hop on buses run around the Arc de Tiromphe. which is a 5 min walk to hotel. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chumsy17171
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 8th to 11th March. The trip was a treat for my birthday. The hotel knew it was my birthday and left a very welcome bottle of champagne and nibbles in the room. The reception staff were excellent and helpful with taxis, etc. There was a good selection at the continental breakfast and the service was very good too. The well equipped room was a little on the small side but as this is normal on the continent it was not a problem. We also had a small balcony on which we could sit and watch the street below. The main reason for selecting this hotel was the location which could not be bettered. Two minutes walk to the Arc-de-Triomphe and it was easy to walk to lots of attractions from here too. The metro was just by the Arc as was the Air France bus which is handy for both Airports. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Royal Magda (says it all)”
Reviews.Author: Jaypsea
Reviews.Content: We still maintain the ratings given to the Royal Magda following our stay in December 2008. We're not the sort of people who have the need to always visit the same hotels, however with only limited time for a long weekend break, a return to Paris seemed in order. After thinking about it for 2 seconds we didn't even bother to look at any other hotels. The Royal Magda is in a fantastic location (very quiet but only 2 mins from the Arc) The staff are great, the breakfasts are fine, the rooms are comfortable, the price is fair (for Paris). No the rooms aren't huge, yes, some are probably due a bit of TLC, but overall I really don't think you can beat the overall Royal Magda experience. Sadly, I feel sure we'll be there again with the next 18months or so, there really isn't an alternative that ticks all the boxes at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “C'est fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: jracine
Reviews.Content: All reviews are true — this is a fantastic, well run place. Yes the rooms are small — book a "club" room or a suite if you can. The _real_ strength is the service — all the staffers could get a job in one of the "Palaces" in Paris. Serviceable, they are ready to help with anything.... On my last day I was having a challenge with some personal matter.... They made my issue their own and did something that I had never expected. KUDOS. I will be back very soon — this is now _the_ hotel I will book in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel I have stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JamieLong
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money. At around £110 for a Saturday night (booked online) it is cheaper than the walk-in price obviously. It benefits from a great location (close to the Metro and the beautiful Arc de Triomphe) and is a well furnished hotel. The staff are friendly and the complimentary Champagne was a really nice touch (for our anniversary). There is lots to do and see in Paris, so we really only used this as a place to sleep, but I was very impressed with the room and facilities. The close-by Metro has great connections and is just one line to get to the Gare du Nord (Eurostar). Will be returning to this hotel every time I visit this beautiful city and also recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mario_Mireille
Reviews.Content: Hi I went there with my husband for a 3 day stay in paris. This is not a big hotel, so do not expect huge rooms. However it has what you need: very clean, comfortable rooms. The bathroom is big with a bathtube and shower. The only thing is that it only had about 20 channels on tv, maybe 1 of them is an english channel, but who cares, go visit paris. Location is just walking distance from the metro station, so u can go anywhere u want. The staff is super friendly. I would definitly recommend it for couple and single travellers, i also saw people with kids so it seems fine... I would definitly go there, even though i woudl wanna try a new place, but i m sure i will be in a dilemma between goign to a new place and being safe in a great place i already experiences

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff, acceptable for Paris prices”
Reviews.Author: milkyway23
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights - asked to change rooms after one night as first one did not meet expectations (under roof, no space to get up on one side of the bed) - was no problem at all. Very helpful staff. Great location - just 200m from the Etoile. Neighborhood a bit dodgy at night but bearable.

Reviews.Title: “They make your holiday memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Morgmob Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We could not fault any of the staff, they go out of their way to help and advise you, and generally make you feel very welcome. It is well situated to the metro and train service, which makes travelling to Disney very easy, especially if you have children ( no train changes). It is also within walking distance of the Eifle tower, and we felt very safe walking around the locality. Breakfast was lovely, with a good choice of quality produce,especially the coffee! Why pay more and get less?

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent location....read on....”
Reviews.Author: GemsNI
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has usual Paris-size rooms, very clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast until 12midday each day and check out at 12 midday also. Excellent location 2 mins walk from nearest Metro stop. Our only problem was that we had asked for a non smoking room - which we got, unfortunately the room beside ours had smoking guests and our room quickly smelled of smoke. The staff on reception moved us immediately and up graded us to a suite - problem solved. Do not let that put you off staying here, it is a brilliant hotel, reasonable price for location and like i said, helpful and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCitybreaker
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel just one minute from Charles De Gaule Etoile Metro Station but in a very quiet street. The room was very clean with a tv hairdryer kettle etc. Towels were changed every day. We paid the extra to have breakfast which was fine - plenty of tea or coffee, nice french bread, croissants and pastries, ham & cheese, yoghurts and fruit (nothing hot) but plenty to set you up for the day. When you are paying 4- 5 euros for a cup of coffee in a cafe the extra 12 euros for breakfast was well worth it. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They made you feel very welcome not just another guest to give a key too. The lady who was on reception during the day was especially good. I left my umbrella in a restaurant and she wrote out in french how I could ask for it back. Everyone's english was excellent as usual put us Brits to shame. There were plenty of restaurants and bars near by to eat in without having to go to far and it was in a great situation if you wanted to walk to various sites then get the metro back at the end of the day. Would definately recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Services”
Reviews.Author: monaco98000
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice rooms , the service is fantastic, polite and efficient . Very good price. 100 meters from Arc du Triomphe. What more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “What brilliant service! What a great location! What a cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fashion_victim_no_1
Reviews.Content: If every hotel had someone at reception like Lily, they would secure a great deal of repeat business and leave plenty of mere males stumbling over themselves for words. To be fair, all of the staff at this great hotel were friendly and helpful, but Lily's efforts to recommend and book amazing restaurants (and provide us with printed directions), call the Eiffel Tower to check why it was closed (strike and bad weather), trek to our room to fix the broken safe, help drag our bags out to our shuttle taxi etc etc made our Paris experience a wonderful one. The hotel is stereotypically Parisienne in that the rooms are small and the elevators take only two people (or one person plus bag) at any one time. But so what? That's part of the experience. The hotel is well maintained, the large room we stayed in was ample, the bathroom was big and the place was spotless. Free internet available in the lobby only. No complaints to say the least. Oh yes, and the location? Well it's a couple of mins walk from l'Arc de Triomphe and even less to the nearest Metro station. Enough said! The only minor gripe was a (once weekly?) nightclub which had somewhat loud music blaring for a couple of hours late at night. Ignore it or take earplugs and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: starbord_traveller
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very helpful. The rooms were lovely and clean, good shower pressure and very comfy. They were not very big as is typical in Paris. The breakfasts were good and the location was just behind the Arc De Triomphe. From here you can explore The Champs Elysee, The Arc, Palais Royal, The Invalides and more- and the shopping is pretty good too. There is a Metro 2 minutes walk away. It is The Charles De Gaulle which is a central line. We found the Metro easy to use and a brilliant way to move around the city. It is worth the walk from here to The Laduree Salon- a beautiful tearoom. Try the 4 berry tea with and the macaroons. 6 Euro for a pot but you can share. Yumm

Reviews.Title: “perfect 3 star hotel - 100m from the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: tedzinho69
Reviews.Content: Spent a magical weekend in Paris getting engaged in the Tuilleries .... hotel was lovely, clean and super convenient for the tube (both local and main lines) @ Charles de Gaulle Etoile which is about 15 minute walk down the Champs Elysees to the Louvre. Service very good, drinks were mixed to taste and not too expensive. Shower lovely and powerful and bed comfy. WIll recommend and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I'm hoping to return in October this year and I can't wait”
Reviews.Author: Zorkstars
Reviews.Content: We loved our 10 night stay at Royal Magda. The room was quite compact and a little stuffy at times but we opened the window until we went to sleep. You can’t sleep with the window open as it is quite noisy but with the window closed, the street noise is blocked out. You can still hear other guests in adjoining and overhead rooms. However, none of this matters. The staff are fantastic (and probably deserve a pay rise!) The desk staff were incredibly polite and helpful. They booked tours and restaurants for us and helped us plan our days around rolling strikes that were in place while we were there. We liked the breakfast and ate at the hotel about half of the mornings. The breakfast staff were very cheerful and sweet. The location is fabulous. Extremely close to Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro station which is on lines 1, 2 & 6 which makes it very easy to get around. It is also a wonderful walk from the Arc de Triomphe, along the Champs Elysees, across Place de la Concorde, through the Tuileries to the Louvre. Make sure you stop in at Angelina’s (near Tuileries metro station) for the best hot chocolate! My husband loved getting up in the morning and running along the Champs Elysees. I’m hoping to return in October this year and I can’t wait!

Reviews.Title: “So convenient to everything love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveller00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Magda before and always recommend this hotel to friends. I love staying here it is like visiting and staying with friends the staff here are always so helpful and kind .all of the sites are in easy walking or a quick inexpensive taxi ride. I was celebrating a birthday on my last visit and they organised a suprise cake and bottle of champayne. When I am in Paris I want to enjoy the city not see it from the confines of a stuffy hotel. Magda always gets my vote I am always sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and central, no luxury”
Reviews.Author: Marit35
Reviews.Content: We had a quiet room towards the backyard, excellent in central Paris. Easy access to Metro line 1 and RER. Don't trust the restaurant recommandations from the hotel. Use Trip-Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & value”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights for New Year with my wife. We chose the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews, plus the fact they offered a reasonable rate for Paris (many hotels increased their rates for New Year). Overall, would say this hotel offers very good value (we paid 155 euro including breakfast) and excellent service. Positives: 1) Service was excellent...helpful before the trip...pleasant welcome on arrival...extremely fast check-in...helpful during the stay (good restaurant tips)...fast check-out. Every request was greeted with a smile. Left chocolates in the room to celebrate the New Year (nice touch). 2) Location...2mins from metro (& start of Champs Elysee). 3) Clean...rooms, while small, were clean. Fresh towels every day as needed. 4) Breakfast...simple but satisfactory. Fresh pastries, bread, etc. Warm welcome. Negatives 1) Not really a negative as value was excellent...but as this is a small (family run?) hotel, the rooms are small (as is the breakfast area). But since we spent very little time there, this was no issue (& it was clean). 2) Rooms have no sound insulation, so you can hear any early morning risers or any vans that might pass by the hotel (if you have a room facing the street). But again, this was a minor point. Overall would say this is an excellent choice if you want something offering great value in a major city like Paris (& providing excellent, friendly service).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RMcIntoshOhio
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Royal Magda for two nights during our recent visit to Paris. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is convenient to metro stops and restaurants. We had a deluxe suite (family room). It was a good size for European hotels. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size as well. I would stay here again and recommend thie hotel to others who are considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Over promised, under delivered”
Reviews.Author: DrBonster
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Royal Magda Etoile for two nights while stopping in Paris during a two week jaunt across Europe December 14-16th. I was really looking forward to our stay here, especially after reading the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor but I have to say that we were extremely underwhelmed and disappointed in our stay here (which is sad because Tripadvisor had always given us the best tips/advice!). First off, we probably had the world's fastest check-in totaling approximately 3 minutes (if even that). We said hi, gave them our name and they handed us a key, pointed to the lift and that was it. Not even a friendly "How are you" or "Is there anything else we can help you with?" After riding the world's smallest elevator and placing our bags down, we went back downstairs and inquired about places for lunch. Surprisingly, the staff at the desk just shrugged their shoulders and said "I dont know." In fact, throughout the next three days at the hotel we received ZERO assistance in any type of planning as far as suggestions on places to eat and transportation options (trains vs walking vs taxi) when we inquired how to get to popular destinations such as the Lourve and Versailles. They weren't rude or mean about the process - just very unhelpful. And it wasn't just one staff member who was unhelpful, we probably came across 4-5 different staff members who were equally useless in suggesting and assisting us while touring Paris. It was also disappointing to have WiFi access only in the lobby and not in the rooms. In addition, the internet access was spotty and frequently the box/router had to be reset by a staff member so we could use it. Also, I read some reviews that people received a complimentary bottle of champagne upon their arrival. Needless to say, we DID NOT even though we got engaged in Paris and the first person we ended up telling was the person at the concierge desk who just said "Oh, congrats - you should buy some champagne" and promptly handed us a bottle that ended up costing us ~48euros. On a positive note: each staff member spoke English and the room was very clean and comfortable. Yes, it was a tad on the smaller side but not too uncomfortably small. Also, I had emailed ahead of time about the room and they responded promptly to all my emails and included useful photos and information. Sadly, I would not recommend this hotel to a friend or stay here again. There are just so many other options in Paris that I can't help but think we got the short end of the stick.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat this location”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: Hop off the metro at the Arc de Triomphe and you have almost arrived at this very charming very convenient very clean hotel. The staff was very friendly and one particular person at the desk remembered what room we were in right from the start and never had to ask again. Not many places to put things in our room, but it was lovely and had a usable balcony overlooking the quiet street that it was on. And speaking of the street that it's on, you can hop across the street to Guy Savoy's restaurant should you have an extra wad of cash in your pocket (we could see it from our room). This hotel was so convenient that we were able to go back, just to drop off some things we bought across town and then head back out again. It is on three metro lines and really, I don't see how it could be nicer for the price. A very good choice for either the first-time Paris visitor or the seasoned Paris aficionado.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean small hotel near Champs Elysées”
Reviews.Author: starbean
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor. We stayed there two nights with my mother, the beds were very comfortable, the rooms are small but I expected it. Even if our windows were on the street we slept well, the street is very quiet. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast cost 12Euro, and is ok, but nothing special. I suggest to go to Brioche Dorée on the Champs Elysées, there is much better choice. Metro is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: YANNICKPERAIS
Reviews.Content: Not only did, the hotel send us pictures of various bedrooms to allow us to choose the room we wanted, but offered us half a bottle of champagne on arrival to celebrate our wedding anniversary! I could not fault the quality of the service! - Excellent Location (less than 5mns from Champs -Elysees and 2mns from Metro Station Etoile) - Great choice of rooms (especially if you email them before arrival) - Very clean and comfortable. - Outstanding Service (one of the best I have had) The only 2 things I think they can improve upon are: - A WIFI connection in the whole hotel rather than just the reception area! (However you have cabled connection for free in your room) - A more extensive and varied breakfast A part from that, I would strongly recommend that Hotel to friends, family and fellow travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaCarolRama
Reviews.Content: For the price, excelent stay... very close to the Arc, to the bus to airport, to everything. Staff was always helpful, quick, effcient. Rooms were very good, silent. Excelent stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located in the thick of it but remarkably secluded”
Reviews.Author: Tinsley_S_D
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a 2 min walk from the Air France #2 shuttlebus stop. Literally 3 mins stroll from the Arc de Triomphe, and therefore close to shops and metro too. As it was on a backstreet though, none of the bustle of the city intruded. Room was a little tired in decor (which actually quite appealing as it didn't seem as clinical and impersonal) but was clean and as we got one of the rooms overlooking the courtyard it was generous in size too with separate en-suite toilet and en-suite bathroom. There was a sofa bed which was ideal if you wanted to spend a little time just relaxing in the room and a fairly priced mini-bar. The bed was a UK king size and the shower was powerful and hot. Staff at the hotel were pleasant and were willing to speak English or French. Breakfast was simple but filling. Room service meals were available but didn't take advantage of this. These must have been brought in from another catering facility as the hotel didn't seem to serve evening meals in the breakfast area. The number of restaurants and eateries within spitting distance meant it wasn't an issue anyway. All in all a fine and convenient location from which to base a 4 day trip to Paris. At around 160 euros B&B it wasn't an utter bargin, but the location, comfort and service meant neither of us felt ripped off. After all Paris is not the cheapest of cities!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complaint about”
Reviews.Author: aris20
Reviews.Content: This review is based on the 'suite' (room 113), with bedrom and seperate 'living room'. The room is facing inner yard, so we had no sound issues. The staff was polite and helpful, and we had no special incidents requiring any special action (xept perhaps when the missy managed to lock the safe, we had to get some help to reset it :) We booked on-line, so we had a 3 nights, pay for 2 deal. The price reduction from 'normal rates' also helps increasing the score for this hotel, Im not sure I would have payed the 'top' price. Location is great, we walked to Eifel tower in about 20 mins, and we walked to louvre in about 40 mins (5 mins on metro btw). Main metro line is 1 min walk from hotel, and so are the airport buses. Just remember that bus fare is NOT included in metro tickets, even if we where told so in the metro-information boot (and they made us buy a 20 Eur ticket). So we had to take the metro/train back to the airport (3 train changes). I would reccomend taking the bus (around 11 Eur per person) or prvate car (55 eur). Before we left, I read some negative reviews, mostly stating that the rooms are small (By looking at the floor plan, I guess the normal rooms can be a bit small, so if you intend spending a lot of time in the room you might opt for the bigger rooms), the elevator was small (it is a bit small, who cares), and that your luggage is not carried to the room for you. If the later is impoprtant, I think you need to try some hotels in another price-segment. I don't think its very common in europe. Personaly, I prefere carry my own bags anyway. We had breakfast in the room one of the days, and it was a regular breakfast. Some bread, croisants, cofee, youghurt, jam and cheese. The last days we had 6 hrs from checkout to plane departure, and we could leave the luggage at the hotel. So to conclude: perfectly fine hotel, clean, good location, and nothing negative. Normaly I might give a 'good' rating, but extra reward for the complimentary champagne offered for our aniversary trip. I will also write a report on our trip to the next door resturant 'le petit gourmand'. Not so reccomended :) Savoy (3 star michelin resturant) across the street is fun experience if you can affoard it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Robmalta
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is strategically placed close to all amenities near the Arc de Triomphe... the metro is just close by as are the airport buses... and a good number of excellent restaurants are very close by too... the hotel is nicely kept and the staff are friendly. the only problem was that the walls are very thin and it seems like people in other rooms are right by your bed... we had a couple of frights during the night and the noises kept us awake at times... one last hitch was that whilst wi-fi was available, there wasn't one computer available for guests who did not get a laptop...a bit of an inconvenience! otherwise it just the perfect place for a business trip/pleasure weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: goldma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Magda with my girlfriend to celebrate our first anniversary. What a place to stay!! A stone throw away from the Arc De Triumph, the location was superb! The service and friendly staff topped our magical experience. No wonder this Hotel was recommended to me. We got to our room to find some nibbles on our desk with a bottle of Champagne on ice and a note saying, “We hope you have a very enjoyable first Anniversary in Paris”. Fantastic!! That started what was a very memorable weekend. The hotel was elegant, our room view of Paris with the small balcony was amazing. I could type for hours! You want to experience a memorable stay in Paris, go to this hotel. Sam| Broker

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HamsterBeamin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Saturday night in November, very nice hotel, very convenient location, close to the 1, 2, and 6 metro lines, handy for most of the big attractions. Room was nice and clean, standard size. Big plus was the staff were very friendly and helpful, very good for recommending how to plan your day in the city and where to eat etc. Would definately stay here again, fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “still great”
Reviews.Author: RBB-7
Reviews.Content: All the reviews that praise the location and cleanliness are correct. My wife and I have stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile 5 times and will stay again. The real advantage and pleasure in staying here in Paris, is the staff. Yohan and Lilly at the desk are superb and speak flawless English. Everyone else , including housekeeping, night clerks and breakfast waitstaff are great, and that is what makes the visits so pleasant. It is true that it may be time to replace the carpet in a couple of rooms, but those rooms are absolutely spotless nevertheless. We love the area and have been pleasantly surprised with some of the local restaurants and shops. Book "Le Hide" for dinner. It is a great choice for your last night - right around the corner with terrific, interesting food. Check with Yohan for local cafes and walking distance sights. We found a nice antique shop nearby. Just explore, and don't be afraid to stroll the neighborhood. Yes the Champs Elysees is right around the corner, but walk around the Avenue Mac Mahon, and the Rue de Wagram too. Believe it or not, the MacDonalds on the corner has good salads unlike anything you would get in the states -cheap and a quick good value. If you like classical music, book a concert at the "Salle Pleyel" on line, a world class concert hall within walking distance that even has pretty good pre concert dinners. Paris is expensive, but we will come back to the Royal Magda again and again. It is a good value with a comfortable feeling. Yes it has wi-fi in the lobby and CNN and BBC on the TV, a nice breakfast too. The best feature? The people that make the joint run!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home (cliché, but true!).”
Reviews.Author: Sobotta67
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times and this is surely my favorite hotel. Location is just exquisite, within walking distance to the Arc and the Champs-Élysées. Subway and RER also extremely close. If you use Les Cars Air France (and I recommend you do!) coming from the airports this is also a specially good spot. The hotel is clean, charming, renewed. Basic rooms are small but pretty standard to Europe in general. Hotel staff is THE asset of this hotel: Yohan and specially Aurélie will go out of their way to help any customer. Good breakfast. Great buy for its price and category. I have personally recommended this hotel to about 12 friends: 8 took my advice and agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: freqtravellerNewYork
Reviews.Content: I travelled with 3 college friends from 30 years ago. We doubled up in two 'suites' with twin beds. The hotel was nicely located with easy access to the air france buses to and from the airport, as well as to the charles de gaulle etoile metro stop. lots of inexpensive cafes around, including a nice sitdown creperie (ask reception for recommendation). The rooms were large by Paris standards and the bathrooms were spotless. One suite (411) was divided into two smaller rooms, while the other (116) had one large room. Both had sofabeds and so could accomodate an extra adult or a couple of small children. The carpet and sofas were stained (sofa in 116 actually had two wet patches when we arrived) and this was the only true disappointment. Both rooms faced an interior courtyard and were on the corner of their respective floors, so were very quiet. Breakfast was more than sufficient and it was wonderful that this was included ... we could gather around and plan our day while we took it in turns to get ready in the morning. Unlimited supply of fresh hot coffee, good choice of croissants and rolls, and cereal and fresh whole fruit. There is free wifi in the lobby, and while each room has free wired internet, there is no wifi in the rooms, and this was a disappointment for those of us with mobile devices such as ipads and iphones! The staff were extremely friendly, cheerful, and helpful and this really helped make our stay in Paris very pleasant indeed. All said and done, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cbpalmer
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent. Shopping, sightseeing, and such easy access to a large metro station. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was small, but that's not unexpected in Paris. We were in a deluxe suite. The room was a bit musty smelling and seemed really worn (carpets stained, bedspreads worn). The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. However, for the price and location I would say this hotel is a good choice. Just don't expect that you're getting much luxury and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: piglet748
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel ,close to walk to everything and free WiFi. The staff were very freindly and helpful and breakfast was hot and tasty. We had a great 5 days here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: leiyeewing
Reviews.Content: I came here for 3 days and it was one of the most comfortable hotels. Great location. one block from metro and Arc de triomphe. They do not advertise it enough...the awesome location. The staff was wonderful. We had them call to help find reservations since we didn't have an international cell and they were more than helpful. I got a double room with a shower. Ended up with a bath. I had my little balcony facing the street which is quiet and made for good sleep. I wish they had down comforters to make sleeping feel cozier but I was never actually cold. I liked the real keys with each room that you had to return to the front desk prior to leaving. It was very nostalgic. The walls are a little thin, but wasn't really a problem at all. Overall I really enjoyed my stay esp for 150 euros a night. And i would definitley stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nature+surf
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Europe and Paris, so I don't have a big comparison, but I found this hotel to be very nice, great location near the Metro. It seemed like were able to go to all the sites within a few minutes. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was included and was good/adequate. Beds were really comfortable, wireless internet worked well. Rooms are small, which is to be expected; elevator is very small and hard to get two bags and two people in it. Once you are in the room it is fine, though. One plus, close to the Air France Bus to go to the airport. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me a believer in tripadvisor.com”
Reviews.Author: Locemup
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment trip and I booked my room the night before. I was pleasantly surprised to find that my room was ready even though i arrived a little before check-in time. It was Labor Day and I received a tiny bouquet in celebration upon check-in. My French is high school and VERY basic but the staff spoke English and made everything easier. My room was small by American standards but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. I slept very well and I usually have trouble sleeping when I'm away from home. The hotel was close to Metro and L'Arc de Triomphe but a little bit of a hike to other attractions. It was also on a small side street and as I was a solo traveler, that made it a little less attractive. I think breakfast was included but I preferred to walk the neighborhoods and taste the local fare.

Reviews.Title: “Cinq Etoiles for the Magda”
Reviews.Author: Po10472
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for 3 nights in early October and loved it. When researching hotels we found the reviews on TA really helpful and the location made this an ideal choice for us. Not only was it a 10 minute walk from our bus drop off point, the hotel was soooo easy to find as you're literally 2 mins from the Arc de Triomphe. We had the last room (616) at the top of the hotel on the 6th floor. The room was at the back of the hotel so was really quiet despite being next to the lift shaft. Sure it didn't have an automatic lock but it's a typical Parisien building, it's part of the charm. The room was spotless, the bathroom was gleaming and had a super hot shower and an amazing heated towel rail with plenty of big, fluffy white towels. The mini bar was well stocked and not overly expensive and there was also room service, sadly we didn't have any. Breakfast was served between 7am-12pm which was great cos it meant we could relax and not stress about getting down in time for breakfast. What can I say about breakfast, it was divine, not to everyones tastes I'm sure, but it had fresh meats and cheese and the most amazing fresh bread, croissants, pastries and home-made mini donuts. There were also various cereals, yogurts and fresh juice and a welcoming friendly waitress asking if you wanted cafe, te or chocolat. A continental breakfast!!! Always served with a smile. The front of house staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful and all spoke English perfectly. There was also free wifi in the lobby but on request, my husband was given a network cable to use in the room - free of charge. We were also able to leave our luggage in the hotel after we checked out (12pm checkout) as our flight wasn't til late in the evening - no problem at all. A few people have commented that this hotel isn't central, I would disagree heartily as the metro is 2 mins away and is only a few stops from all the major tourist attractions, what more do you want! There are lots of lovely bars and restaurants in the area and strangely the ones we frequented had no tourists and seemed to be filled with Parisiens which made it all that more enjoyable, the prices were no more expensive than other areas we had visited. What helped also, was the amazing deal we got, so if you want a clean, central, friendly hotel with nice breakfast, then this is it. We'll definitely return and recommend to all our friends and family who are planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We will always go back...”
Reviews.Author: sweptawayy
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough. Wonderful staff, location and I even loved our "smallish" room. So very clean, so very quiet-without a doubt the best hotel we encountered on our trip. At first I missed a coffee maker in the room but the instant coffee and the water boiler was addicting... nothing like the instant coffee in the states. We cannot say "merci" enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great, they were so helpful after a run-in with the Belfast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derek05
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, good location. Good sized rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: stravels6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Magda. The experience was very nice as the room was tiny but very clean as was also the bathroom. We marvelled at the comfortable bed and were appreciative of the quiet street that let us sleep after a day of exhausting but exhilarating sight seeing. The location is right near the Metro, the L'arc Du Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The staff were very polite and friendly as well as professional. We enjoyed our stay for our first visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: forster4253
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing, the rooms were clean but very tiny, the location was good (around the corner from Arc de Triomphe). However, next door to the hotel is an after bar which is open between 2am - 8am. The street is so narrow that the patrons from the bar can be heard for miles. Apparently the weekend we were there was the last weekend the bar was to be opened - (you should confirm with hotel first). Had it not been for the after hours bar our stay would have been perfect. I would recommend this hotel to a friend only if the after bar was indeed closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: aatrip08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August. I'm very happy with my choice, thanks to the reviews on TA which were spot on!. The staff at the hotel were friendly & informative. Our bags had been delayed, so we advised the hotel staff on check-in and they told us they would advise us when they arrived, but would not wake us if it was too late. We got a great night sleep and in the morning they let us know they were in! We were very relieved. The breakfast is good, which is a continental. There is free wi-fi in the lobby also. The location is great, not far from the champs elysee. We walked all over paris from the hotel, the only time we took a cab was to get to the Moulin Rogue. I think the location is perfect, there are lots of reasonable priced restuarants nearby. Definately stay here again & would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not huge fan of location”
Reviews.Author: lkwals
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda hotel was a beautiful hotel. We found our stay there quite comfortable. The hotel staff was helpful and accommodating. The room was neat, clean, with large bathrooms and comfortable beds. The breakfast was delicious, definitely a great way to start the day and it went until noon which was nice because we were able to sleep late and still have something to eat. The only drawback for us was that the hotel seemed farther away from the attractions than we would have liked. We enjoyed the Latin Quarter very much so it probably would have been better for us to stay closer to that part of the city. It wasn't a huge problem, however, because the hotel was very conveniently located near a metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cheng-Yi
Reviews.Content: I did some research at tripadvisor.com before the trip and chose Royal Magda Etoile Hotel in the end. I must say this little hotel exceeds my expectations and my good impressions were formed right after I made my reservation. Normally, one would receive a standardized computer-generated confirmation. In addition to that, their staff even wrote me another email, confirming the rooms that were allocated to me and were very quick in our email exchanges. They speak very good English and were attentive to one's possible needs. As with all Paris hotels, the rooms are quite small but they were impeccably managed: very clean and comfortable. (I would suggest checking out on the elevator, it's ridiculously small!!! LOL) I stayed in rooms facing the street but I slept very well and were not at all disturbed. There's no wi-fi, but you can always get your internet cable from the reception for free connection. I wouldn't say it's fast but more than adequate. And the location. I can't find other words to describe other than "great." It's not just very close to a metro station but it is also a big metro station, making travel really convenient. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, can get noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: bruintravel
Reviews.Content: I would echo the comments of the other reviewers for this hotel - excellent location, good service, clean rooms, and a good quality breakfast. Breakfast is expensive but the quality is good - very fresh - but nothing extraordinary. the staff is extremely helpful and friendly and always available for a question or request. The hotel is extremely well located - close to a central metro station with connections to several main lines as well as the open top bus tours which are good for a first day intro to the city. The rooms are a bit on the small side but this is more than compensated for by the excellent value of hotel - superb considering its location. as someone mentioned earlier, it can get noisy on saturday nights as the partiers next door stand outside to smoke. The crowd hangs out there until the morning and so when you leave there is still a bit of a rowdy crowd. they are mostly harmless though. also try the restaurant next door, Le Petite Gourmand. A bit pricey, but a Parisian restaurant experience is not to be missed. the manager is very friendly and the food excellent. To save some money, there is a cafeteria style restaurant with a 10 euro prix fix menu at the corner of Wagram and Troyon, across from the McDonalds I believe. the food is decent but good value - a must for paris. The Air France Shuttle is only a few minutes walk away which is huge time and cost saver - this means the airport is only about an hour away. Don't forget to keep your receipts and your plastic cards they give you. We forgot ours and couldn't use the return portion of our tickets. [These tickets (2 of them) by the way are available for sale as are our pre-purchased tickets to the Louvre (quantity 2), a Lonely Planet France book, and a French phrase book - together worth over $100. I can sell these all for $65. Email me if interested.]

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money, great location, great staff, will be back”
Reviews.Author: xpat73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for two nights in July. Front desk were super. Room was clean and modern. Excellent value for money at 150 Euros a night, when you consider the awesome location just off the Arc de Triomphe and we went in peak season. The breakfast at 12 euros was excellent, lots of chice, cereal croissants, meet and cheees, french bread, fruit, coffee etc...all you eat. I will definitely be back and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great little hotel that is value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel especially the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: businessvisitorNE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay in this hotel next to Charles De Gualle Etoile metro. Booked a double room with shower for about £140 a night (great value for the location in Paris). Arrived a little late but the reception staff where expecting us and greeted me by name before I even introduced myself! We were in room 513, small but clean and modern, we even had a small balcony with table and chairs. Reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and attentive during our stay. There were some problems during our stay, on the final evening the hot water went off. The staff dealt with this well, we got free breakfast (which despite other reports is good value for 12 euros). Obviously this was our last night so lack of hot water not a major problem; other guests were given lots of options e.g. move to nearby sister hotel. Also on final night was woken up by TV from room next door, rang reception and this was sorted quickly (if you are noisy, its one warning and your out, great!!). Would definitely return and recommend to others. Tried the restaurant next door 'Le Bouchon Gourmand'. The owner very friendly and attentive but does not disguise the fact that its overpriced for the service and quality of food. Mind you for UK travellers Paris has never been more expensive due to exchange rate....8-10 euros for a standard drink (thats about 8-10 sterling even in the cheaper places away from Arc etc). Did the Bateaux Mouches river cruise from Pont D'Alma. Ok not cheap at about 200 euros for two but actually good value with excellent food. Buy book of 10 metro tickets for 12 euros at any metro station, good value. Chatelet des Halles is probably the most confusing metro station in the world, avoid if you can, had to ask directions to get out after 20 mins of dead-ends!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Djsam1
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! Couldn't have been better! You can catch the Big Bus tour right from Shanz Elize, which is like 3 main roads away. Plus you got the McDonalds right at the end of the hotel's street. Furthermore you even have the taxis and the metro station just near the hotel. As I said, the location couldn't have been more better!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern updates, good location”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler34
Reviews.Content: This hotel near the Arc de Triomphe is the most modern hotel we stayed at during our trip to France. It had the closest thing to a true stand-up shower that we saw during our eight days. The location is great - in a vibrant neighborhood near the Arc and the Champs-Elysees. It was rainy during the two nights we stayed there, so we were happy to be in a neighborhood with lots going on. The beds here were pretty good, better than most hotels we stayed at in France.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but will not return”
Reviews.Author: Safvi
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. This hotel doesn't impress us that much. The good: convenient location to the Arch of Triump and metro station super friendly frontdesk staffs who are always willing to help and provide information The bad: This hotel has the smallest hotel room compare to all eight hotels we have stayed during our 5 weeks of road trip in Europe. We had a Jr suite but the room can only fit in a queen bed and a sofabed. The sofa bed was not that comfortible for my teenager son The key of this hotel is a big bolky traditional lock type. You have to lock the room manually on the way out every time because it won't auto lock. If you lock the door, the person can't open it from inside the room. My husband accidentally locked me in the room and I tried to call the front desk. There was no "front desk" bottom on the hotel phone.If you have young children, be aware of that. Breakfast is not good at all. Don't even bother. Very small hotel elevator. If you have big luggages, you might have problems like us. The room is not very sound proof. We can hear the people walking upstairs all night. The maid did not provide the supplies and towels enough on a daily basis. Overall, it was just an ok stay and the only credit we gave is the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “A magical little place in a magical city”
Reviews.Author: metrosexoars
Reviews.Content: I have to say, i'm not kind a guy who wrote comments, but i feel that i should share my wonderful stay in the Royal Magda Etoile hotel. i decide to book this hotel because its terrific location(very very close to the arch the triumph,eiffel tower etc),and for the price i get it was very good. it was a surprise present for my wife 30th birth day, we met the lovely reception guy Yohan that was very patience and polite with us, was happy to help everytime we needed. the morning breakfast was very "french" :-) i love it, all kind of cheese and pastry. we met also Lucie the waitres in the hotel, she was very kind and lovely as well. we miss this hotel allready!!! we surly comeback and surly recomended about him to our friends and to you all who want to book a hotel that close to everything and to the metroif you want to get further). i need to say that for my wife birthday,the wonderfull staff arrange us a wonderfull surprise for this occasion!! Yohan & Lucie keep it up like that, your kind of people make people wanna come back to the hotel! Roei Masuri

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with a very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Emile21012
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews I read on it here at Trip Advisor. I was a little concerned since it was only a 3 star hotel and was not associated with a major chain. I must say that we were not only pleased with the hotel, we were extremely happy and well treated and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely be staying there again on our next trip to Paris. The staff was so helpful and friendly, we felt very comfortable asking them any questions. They went out of their way to help us. Some reviews have complained about the expensive breakfast for 15 Euros, but if you eat at some of the cafes around the hotel, it is just as expensive. This is just a lovely, well run hotel with a marvelous staff. It's just down the street from the Arc de Triomphe de l'Étoile and the Champs-Élysées. SPECIAL TIP: The hotel is very close to the Air France shuttle which will take you to the CDG airport in comfort for only 15 Euros per person - Make sure to get info on this, it is the most convenient and economical way to get to and from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better, good value base in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: TassTog
Reviews.Content: As per other reviews, this small hotel has a very convenient location just off the Arc de Triumph, with the RER/metro station a couple of minutes walk away, and if you are done in after a days’ sightseeing or Disneyland Paris, this counts for a lot. The open top bus tour has a pickup point at the Arc, so the hotel was also handy for a wonderful couple of hours on a bus. There are also many places to eat within the vicinity, again, very helpful if you are coming back latish having not yet eaten. The hotel is a good three stars for a city hotel, our standard twin room was small, but clean, tea/coffee, tv, etc, and very importantly, a small safe. It is not in the luxury market, but the rates reflect that, and we were out and about all day anyway. Breakfast was good, nothing cooked, but all you needed and served with a smile. This brings me to the staff, who were all genuinely nice, and you got the feeling that if you had a problem, they would do all they could to help. My faltering French was received with patience, but when I became stuck, English was no problem at all. This hotel is perfect for a very convenient, comfortable, friendly base from which to enjoy the many delights of Paris, and we would most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mudseller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several nights in late October and early November. The staff were very friendly, the room was very clean and comfortable with a nice bath. Excellent service in the cafe, with good selection for breakfast. The atmosphere of this hotel is so charming, my wife fell in love with it when we walked through the front door. We really enjoyed our stay - the only caveat I would add is that the bed was hard. I think this might be normal in many hotels in Europe, but it still much harder than we are used to. Overall, however, I would highly recommend this hotel. Only about a block away from the Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe and within walking distance of so much of old Paris. Also, there is an excellent restaurant next door that we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Really well positioned”
Reviews.Author: d.dowse
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here, and found it to be extremely convenient for the Arch de Triumph, its a couple of minutes walk, everything is close by, the bus to the airport, the metro, and within spitting distance of the Champs Elyses. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful. The room was a little small, but thats nothing new for Paris. It was very clean, I found the bed a little hard for me. When we returned from our night out in Paris, we sat in the bar, and had a couple of drinks, the receptionist is also the bar man, and he couldnt have been more helpful. I would have no problem recommending this hotel, or staying again.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING YOU READ IN THESE REVIEWS IS TRUE”
Reviews.Author: cartagia1
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews on this website ( and hundreds of others for other hotels ) I booked this and boy am I glad I did. We got a Ryanair flight to Beauvais and got the bus in to Paris. Bus takes about an hour and you buy your ticket at a ticket desk outside the terminal building. Didn't even seem like an hour. The bus will drop you at a bus depot outside a very tall hotel called Hotel Concorde La Fayette. Great location for a hotel, had actually booked it for its location, but the reviews were naff so cancelled and booked the Royal Magda. You can get the subway to the Arc De Triumphe ( Etoile station) or you can do as we did and walk! It's a lovely, pleasant walk along the Avenue Grand Armee. we did this is 90degree heat and it was still lovely. It looks like a long walk on the map but it wasn't at all. Before you know it, you'll be at the Arc De Triumphe. The hotel is situated down one of the main roads off the Arc, I forget which one. Do yourself a favour and talk the little walk. Hotel room was ready and waiting. It was my partners birthday and they had very kindle left champagne and nibbles and hand written note on our arrival. I had forgotten to print out my ticket for the Seine River Cruise, but Lilly at the front desk let me use the hotel computer and printer. It's little touches like that that make a difference to your stay. Plenty of placed would have told you to use an internet cafe somewhere. The rooms are air-conditioned and of a good size. Full size bathroom and very, very comfortable bed. We had walked for miles and miled in 90degree heat and slept like logs. Lovely hotel, brilliant location right at the Arc De Triumphe and the Champs Elysee, a great price and air-conditioning! A little gem in Paris. In the lobby, they proudly show off their Trip Advisor awards and so they should. I'd stay again absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull..”
Reviews.Author: Anadolu
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for only two days last week. Our hotel was very beatiful. Location was very good, clean, quiet and friendly. Personell is very kind. If you go to Paris, you must prefer this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Hotel is exactly as it claims.....”
Reviews.Author: instns
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and helpful in this petite hotel. Its a small but the space is really well used. The hotel is really very clean and its a perfect, central 3 star hotel. It does not have a large, glamourous entrance lobby but for a city break it was just perfect for us. We would definitely try stay here again if we re-visit Paris. One of the reasons this hotel stood out for us is that so many Parisian hotels are poor and very expensive. This was really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: EPLFan
Reviews.Content: Great location by the Champs de Elysees, metro and all the great shopping and sites in central Paris. The hotel is clean and comfortable and serves a very adequate and civilised breakfast, if you choose to include this in your stay. The staff is lovely and accomodating.
