There is one small lift (holds one person and a couple suitcases) and the stairs are steep, so, if there is a crowd trying to use the elevator you either have to wait or climb. This is probably the most notable "drawback," but is easily managed, and well worth the inconvenience. The first night of our stay the A/C didn't work very well, but this was fixed and the ensuing nights were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: NatashaLitmanen
Reviews.Content: I had been one month ago and it was really a nice hotel. The location is perfect and the service nice. If a re-visit I will go at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, chic & swanky with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: leonardpetts
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel, chic and swanky with extremely helpful staff, just off the Champs Elysees with the metro at the end of the street, nicely located in the centre of wee Paris, we are a well travelled couple as my partner is an ex travel agent of over 10 years so are more used to the 5* hotels but what with the recession decided to down grade and we had no regret with this little gem. We dun our research and Hotel Royal Magda Etoile has won trip adviser in 2006 and 2010, very clean all that you need in the room, breakfast was good we would recommend this to our friends 10 out of 10 lennie from Hertford Hertfordshire

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelopalooza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in June and had a wondeful stay! We were travelling with two young children and booked the junior suite. It was a larger room for Paris but pretty small compared the the USA, yet comfortable. We had done connecting rooms in the past at another Paris Hotel and we would have booked the deluxe suite with the seperated rooms if it had not already been booked. The Hotel was comfortable, clean, quiet and had accomodating staff. There was a good French breakfast for 12 euro (kids free) which included coffee, bread/crouissants, juice, yogurt, cheese and fresh fruit. The Hotel was a 2 minute walk from a major metro station with multiple lines to take you anywhere in the city. There were good restaurants in clode proximity - everything from French food to Thai.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCooper
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me to this charming hotel in a truly fantastic location for my birthday and I was very happy! Well priced rooms for the location, very clean, great welcome, quiet, well lit and excellent air con - I would highly recommend. The only minor point was that the rooms are very small and there isn't much room for luggage or storing clothes. This, in my opinion is a small price to pay for the location and quality which has to be more important in the beautiful city of Paris! Great for couples!

Reviews.Title: “hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: GoncaM
Reviews.Content: nice, friendly atmosphere,breakfast very good,clean rooms,central position

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great staff. Hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: Wiliamtherabbit
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and thought it was a great deal. Things we liked about the hotel...the staff (especially Lilly), the nice breakfast in the morning, clean room, nice view, internet in the room, TV in the room. Location was nice. Quiet at night. Coffee and Tea in the room. Dropping our key off before we left and picking it up on the way in was great. We loved not having to be responsible for a key card. We did not like the beds. They were really hard.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Joncro
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a narrow side street near the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and metro. If we were to return to Paris, we might look for a place a little closer to the center of the city. Rooms are small but I understand this is the norm in Paris. Everything works. Our room faced the street but noise was not a problem. The elevator is claustrophobically tiny but we didn't have to wait long. Breakfast is good. The big attraction of this hotel is the staff. The people behind the desk are, to a person, enormously pleasant, helpful, communicative and patient. The detraction is the carpeting on the floor of the rooms and around the bottom of the beds which is soiled and overdue for replacement. Also, the shower tends to wet the bathroom floor seeping under the bathroom door and wetting the bedroom carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Travel200855
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenagers at the Hotel Royal Magda in June. We had a suite at the hotel which had a pullout sofa in the living area. Having heard that Paris hotel rooms were small, I was worried about the size of the room but I found the suite to be a nice size room, very clean and large enough for 4 individuals and their luggage. The hotel was on a fairly quiet street but a very easy walk to all of the shopping on the Champs Elyssee (5 minutes) and a 5 minute walk to a Paris Metro station. Having the Metro made it very easy to get to all of the attractions in Paris from the hotel. Also, the hotel served a lite continental style breakfast for 12 Euros. We found it very convenient in the mornings to go down to the lobby for the breakfast so didn't mind paying. Also the Breakfast staff was very pleasant. Our only complaint was the wireless didn't work in the rooms. It worked fine in the lobby but the front desk was more than happy to supply us with a wire to connect so we could access the internet in our room. Overall, I think the hotel was a great choice and after comparison shopping against other hotels in Paris, a good value. The hotel was very clean and had a good location excellent for exploring the city. Next time we return to Paris, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian gem...”
Reviews.Author: SoonerWiz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our two grown daughters. We booked and stayed in a deluxe suite. The room was beautiful and comfortably accommodated the four of us. The staff are friendly helpful and always courteous and were of great assistance to me before and during our stay. The location is excellent as well. I cannot recommend Royal Magda any higher. Thanks TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb, and the location is good. Its an easy walk to the metro and numerous restaurants. You can easily walk to the Arc de Triomphe. The bathroom was pretty small but I loved the shower!! You could shut the door!! It was awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “usual small paris room, but good value”
Reviews.Author: robp26
Reviews.Content: i spent hours and hours trying to work out where to stay in paris for 3 nights and ended up chooosing this one based on tripadvisor recommendations. My research indicated that paris rooms are tiny and this one certainly was no different, 13 square metres. But it was quite well done and so no drama. Location was ok, although i didn't thing arc de triomphe is the most lively area, would stay somewhere nearer marais, bastile or louver next time probably.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Emsbklyn
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research to find a decent hotel that was not overpriced. We wanted something in a good location that was clean, comfortable and since it was the first night of honeymoon a place where we were happy to be. Hotel Magda was all of that, they were very welcoming, cozy place, friendly staff. It is nicely decorated with modern Paris style. Our only complaint was the size of the beds, while this is common in Paris we felt it was tiny and we are average size people. But we'd definately stay their again whether with a girlfriend or my husband, it fit the bill on a lot of respects.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoNicole10
Reviews.Content: The is a great little hotel for trips to Paris for a couple. Nice staff, good breakfast (coffee is only average, but good coffee is surprisingly hard to find in Paris; go figure), with a choice of morning papers.Only drawbacks: wifi only in lobby (modem in the room; they lend you a cable), and one has to mention the incredibly small hotel rooms, which are normal for Paris, but which the uninitiated need to be warned about. But great location, very clean, and fairly quiet. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Classy establishment!”
Reviews.Author: bijlee
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 3 night stay online with this hotel for the end of July. I made the fully pre-paid reservation with my credit card directly through their website and chose the best rate, which was listed as "non-refundable". A few minutes after the transaction, I realized I had an extenuating circumstance which meant I could not stay at the hotel. I immediately called the front desk with a request to cancel the reservation. I spoke with the night staff who asked me to call back in the morning and when I did, the manager, Yohan was extremely helpful. When I explained my situation, he informed me that he would go ahead and refund the money, but would not be able to do so for a week since the funds had to be received from the bank first. I then followed up with Lilly at reception a few times and it did take a couple of weeks, but they gave me a full refund without any hassle or trouble. The entire experience was pleasant and seamless. I have stayed at the finest and most expensive hotels in the world, and have still encountered small mindedness/pettiness, and felt unfairly charged at times. At the Royal Magda, the compassion and efficiency with which my request was treated by the staff truly left a wonderful impression. While I cannot speak to the virtues of the property itself, I would strongly recommend this hotel and their staff based on my interaction with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - spotless”
Reviews.Author: FenderCork
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for husband, I and our teenage son. It had two adjoining rooms with a big bathroom and a tv in both rooms. The English channels were CNN, sky, a movie channel and a cartoon channel. The hotel is quiet - no noise at night. The room was very clean and 'fresh' looking. The rooms do not have wireless but the hotel provides ethernet cables - bring a long cable with you as the ones provided are short. Very near the metro and champs élysées. The thai restaurant and Italian called Caesars on avenue wagram are very good. parking close by but is €28 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jp3Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We traveled with children 5 & 8 and stayed in Jr Suite. I found the room to be large for Euro standards. Quiet and clean hotel with great service. We did not eat in the hotel with the many close by options. Elevator was small, but kids thought it was great...we never experienced a wait. We felt safe at all times and the neighborhood and property are in a great shape. Service and attitude from staff was excellent. We spoke only in English with no problem. When we return to Paris we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quie and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sonidanie
Reviews.Content: My mom picked this hotel for me. It is not far away from the Champs Elysees. It was pretty quiet and very clean. My room was pretty small but I didn’t mind at all. Everything is small in Europe. Near by the hotel you will find a couple of bars and some restaurants that I didn’t have the chance to explore. It was ideal for couples who are not big on the late night. It was also full of American in their early to late 50s. For a solo traveller like me who needed a good rest during the day after long night of fun it worked out fine. I have no complains about this hotel the only think I can say is I wish I were in a little more lively hotel with reasonable guest in their late to early 30s.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJill052010
Reviews.Content: All staff were very welcoming and approachable and spoke good English. Location was excellent as it was very handy to the Metro and walking distance to lots of Paris attractions. Close to Hop Off Hop on bus. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of cafes and restaurants were close and less expensive if required. We stayed 4 nights and had no real issues. The room was small but apparently this is typical of Paris and the lift is not big !!!! needed 2 trips to get our luggage up.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice..”
Reviews.Author: Telodigoluego
Reviews.Content: I traveled with two young children and a teenager. We had a junior suite with a view to the inner patio of the hotel. In terms of location the hotel is superb. Very close to Champs Elysee, the Arc de Triomphe and a block and a half away from a metro station (Charles de Gaulle Etoile) with a RER (mid distance train) service. If you are going to Eurodisney, then the location is ideal 'cause the RER A, the one that you would need to take, goes trough that metro station. The neighborhood is okay, a little bit dirty to my taste, but not too bad actually. There is a Macdonald's half a block away and some bakeries and restaurants around the corner, so a snack, a light meal or a full service lunch or dinner is within a 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Breakfast is very good with a nice variety of pastries, cereal, juice and chocolate milk; all deliver with a smile and a nice service. No complaints about the breakfast. Lilly on the front desk is one of a kind. What a wonderful woman. She has a great English and a very good Spanish, so no difficulties in communicating with her whatsoever. She is diligent, courteous, sweet, effective, kind, there is nothing I could say that would do justice to her. I would fall short in every attempt. She is that good! The stay at this hotel is great, some minor issues with the Internet cable (there is no Wi Fi, but the Internet is free) and with the room key cannot dull or overshadow a great service and the very good experience that I had with my stay at this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Friendly Welcome”
Reviews.Author: carrickmcjoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to this hotel in May. Staff were very friendly and helpful, even emailing transport info on getting there, (thanks Yohan). Another nice touch was a bottle of champagne left in our room on arrival as it was our anniversary. Hotel is situated on a side street about 200 yards away from the Arc de Triumphe and is a good base to discover the city. Metro station is also very close which is ideal for those coming in from the airport. Rooms were spotless and comfortable and even on our departure the kind staff were willing to hold our luggage if we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, helpfull staff. Myself and my girlfriend are extremely thankful”
Reviews.Author: ralarco
Reviews.Content: I can not thank you guys enough for the quality and service. Reception staff were exceptional specially Yohan, even after we left the hotel. He was such an amazing help. I really have to give it to the reception staff. Very helpfull and we would recommend the hotel to anyone and everyone visting Paris. The rooms were incredibly clean comparing to other places, very modern and great location to visit the major cites for Paris. Thank you guys for making my stay and my girlfriend's a relaxing one.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and great location”
Reviews.Author: mitrip
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the staff's knowledge and willingness to provide service, especially by Yohan and Lily. The staff patiently assisted us in booking tours, giving directions, their ease with the English language and overall pleasant attitude. Our room was kept spotlessly clean during our stay and the beds were very comfortable. The location was perfect. The metro station was just a few minutes away enabling us to visit the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and many other sites with ease. The smallness of the elevator was a bit of a drawback as we were on the 5th floor. So we used the elevator to go up to our room but would generally walk down to the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: olddrystonewall
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with good quality, quiet decor. Very clean with good facilities. Very good service with a no problem attitude. The location is excellent for metro access and other local transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: DimeStoreSaint
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Paris with my girlfriend where stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for 3 nights. We couldn't have asked for better service or a better location. It's a 2 minute walk to the nearest metro station and the Arc De Triomphe. It's on a nice quiet street in a great neighborhood. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The rooms were perfectly clean and bigger then we thought they would be. I would highly recommend a stay here as it was a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Magda - a hidden gem in a great area and truly a 5 star plus”
Reviews.Author: DorothyCarr
Reviews.Content: The team at the Royal Magda are simply amazing. They are friendly, organized and professional. Most of the staff if not all spoke numerous languages - Johan even spoke Russian, Lilly was as cute as a button, we all just loved her. We travelled with my husbands elderly parents celebrating their 60th year of marriage, we were welcomed very warmly and were looked after beyond our expectations. My in laws were so touched by the champagne delivered to their room and the kindness of the staff. Our rooms were comfy, clean and spacious for Paris. We cannot say enough about this wonderful establishment and the excellant staff that run it. The hotel is located only a block from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees, however, we found great, reasonably priced restaurants and shopping in the opposite direction of that area. We did not have a bad meal while in Paris, would strongly recommend Le Hide only a block from hotel, this restaurant was a lot of fun with great food and our waitress was just wonderful. My husband knows a little french which helped open up great friendships immediately, we always find by giving a little smile and trying to speak a little of the language, the French will go out of their way to help. There was a super little Croissant place around the corner from hotel, a few steps away from the McDonalds (ugh) with fresh squeezed orange juice, sumptous croissants and coffee and the best darn yogurt I've ever tasted. The metro is only a block away right by the Arc. We travelled to both Pere Lachaise Cemetary and Montmarte on line 2, amazingly easy to get around. Area was safe and not noisy - totally loved everything, but this is Paris, what is not to like???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Location, Facilities - not noisy at all!”
Reviews.Author: unsaltedrhino
Reviews.Content: First off I read some reviews of this hotel before staying and a few mentioned that as it was close to the Arc de Triomphe then it was quite noisy. This was not the case at all during our entire stay (Saturday to Monday). We were on the third floor and it was very quiet indeed (almost silent)! Proximity to the Arc also made it easy to get to from Gare du Nord (two RER lines) and all of the tourist spots (20 minute walk to the Tower). Staff and service were excellent and my girlfriend loved the complimentary bottle of champagne, hand written note and breakfast in bed on the morning of her birthday (arranged before arrival by email). Staff were very responsive to my emails prior to staying and also helped to reserve a table at Maison Blanche. I booked the room through Octopus Travel and using the cashback website Quidco managed to secure a nightly rate (including breakfast - no supplement to have it in the room) of £126.31 so was very pleased with the value (especially as we had one of the larger rooms on the floor according to the plan on the back of the door!). Room was very clean (there were a couple of stains in the carpet but nothing to worry about, shower fitting slightly loose but very powerful) and breakfast tasty (choice of meats, cheeses, breads, yoghurts, pastries, juices, cereals and tea & coffee). I would not hesitate in staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Pink0213
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect , good location, clean, good breakfast. Nice people , polite. Helped us a lot about how to walk around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Why look anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Birchyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Magda for 7 nights in mid April after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not let down by that advice. This hotel is a little gem with fantastic staff who are willing to assist you whenever you need. The rooms are of a good size & have wonderful bathrooms attached all well kept & very clean. Bed is comfy & the services the hotel provide are excellent. Lilly was wonderful, contacting us immediately after we booked & welcoming us. All staff were vey pleasant & spoke good English, thankfully. The bar has drinks at far prices however we did not partake in any meals whilst at the hotel as there plenty of excellent restaurants nearby, particuarly the Thai Siam & La Flamme both on Av de Wagram. The hotel is well placed for travel throughout Paris with Metro stations nearby. A 2 minute walk to the Arch de Triumphe & Champs Elysees couldn't have been better. Thanks to all at Hotel Magda.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Parisien Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabell21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent base for exploring Paris. It is small wth no frills but it is clean and the staff are extremely friendly. it is a short walk from the the Air France Bus stop and right beside the Arc de Triomphe. We did not breakfast in the hotel, a bit expensive at 12 euro but there are plenty of places nearby including McDonalds. An excellent metro stop is right beside this hotel (No.6 Charles de Gaulle) and we bought the three day visitor pass for twenty euro. This was brilliant as we got to all the sights by metro. The food in Paris is expensive and disappointing. Check out the Latin quarter and Montmartre for atmosphere. An overall enjoyable stay and a city I would visit over and over again. I would also stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “maybe the best hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: vangel1981
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip in paris.I tried alot to find a hotel and when i read all the reviews my family and i decided to stay to magda etoile.What an EXCELLENT choise.Our rooms 614 and 615 was really big for paris.The hotel is amazing.the place is just a dream..you can go EVERYWHERE the main metro station is about 2 min and champs elysses really 2 min also.I am so excited with his hotel.Breakfast was really delicius and the staff Johan and Lilly you will love them...Dont look other hotels..

Reviews.Title: “Great location--will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ammogirl
Reviews.Content: I brought my two teenage daughters (and one daughter's boyfriend) to Paris for an extended weekend and based off of previous Tripadvisor reviews picked this hotel. We were not disappointed! As other reviewers have noted it is a very clean hotel in a convenient location--right next to the #6 line Metro (Charles de Gaulle-Etoile). The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Room was small but as we spent almost no time in it, not a problem at all. Although we did utilize the Metro on occasion we walked most places (Eiffel Tower, The Louvre etc) and the Arc de Triomphe is one block away (a MUST SEE at night, a simply gorgeous view). Everything was a comfortable walk. There are many eateries around the area, but please be aware that food in Paris is EXTREMELY expensive. When I return to Paris (and I will!) I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more?”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDeHaro
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all my expectations. (although I had no doubt, since their window displayed two awards from Trip Advisor for 2008 & 2010) The staff treated my family like royalty. It is city centered and all transportation is easily accessible. We were in town during a holiday and the staff made sure to verify all attractions were open as we planned. They took time with me to plan my days and ensure I knew exactly how to get where we were going, whether I was traveling by the Metro or walking. On Easter we were surprised with Easter candy. It was such a wonderful touch, since we were on vacation my children didn't get Easter baskets. Breakfast was served daily, always fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the Air France Navette stop as well as from the Etoile subway station, this hotel combines value and location without compromising comfort. The four of us (with suitcases) had no difficulty finding the hotel after getting off the Air France Navette from CDG, with check-in being extremely efficient and our room already ready (despite us arriving at 10am). The suite had a pull out sofa that will fit two slim adults along with a full size bedroom. The view is of the interior courtyard. The bathroom is of a decent size, definitely bigger than other hotels of this price range. The room is clean, and the front desk staff is helpful and gracious. The is a small breakfast area if you choose to eat in, although there are plenty of eateries in the neighborhood. We ate every morning along Champs d'Elysees (5 minute walk) and didn't come back to the hotel until evening time each day in order to get ready for a night out. If you are looking for luxury and pampering, then this is not the hotel for you; if you want to be in front of the Louvre or Place Vendome or even across the street from major shopping areas, then this hotel definitely does not fit the bill. However, if spending less than 250 Euros a night and being in a location with ease of transportation via the subway system is important to you, then this hotel has it all (and without having to sacrifice safety, basic comfort, and friendliness)

Reviews.Title: “Bring a shirt, tie and jacket”
Reviews.Author: charnsi
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with <5 mins walk to taxi stand or metro station, this hotel makes a great location to venture for your Parisian sights. If you would like to dine at Guy Savoy, the hotel has a special arrangement i.e. Euro100 (normal price Euro350) with this Michelin star rated restaurant across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Cozy place, Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: Headed4theBeach
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. As other reviewers mentioned, one very tiny elevator did take us awhile to check in/out, however, due to the size of this hotel, we were just glad they at least had one. We did not find many elevators/escalators or ramps in Paris, and climbed a ton of steps. It is not just the food that keeps them thinner. Rooms are similar to a cruise ship (just the bed, small narrow desk and small bath) however as with a cruise ship, they utilized space well (cut out shelves in wall for remote control, shelves in bathroom, due to pedastal sink). Shower was one the cleanest I have been in. Although smaller, great pressure and removable head, which came in handy to heat massage sore feet. Beds were harder than we are used to in US, but also found that in London. Only issue was no air conditioning. Asked about it at the front desk and they said it was just on heat, due to the time of the year, however, it was too hot with windows closed, so we opened them for awhile prior to going to sleep, then closed due to noise. Hotel offered us a free drink for our special occasion, which we really appreciated. They also called for a taxi that would fit all our bags and 4 of us, since most taxis are the size of mini coopers. We took the metro to it from CDG, however, it was really hard getting in various trains and up many, many stairs with luggage so took their recommendation to take a taxi to the Euro train instead. We were glad we did because the Euro train, is not in the best part of town (beggars, packed with people, etc). We just wish we would have figured that out prior to buying a 5 day metro pass (only option is 3 or 5 days). Taxi was $32 but extra for bags and people. The metro pass is still the best way to go though for unlimited RER (train) and metro. Took RER out to Versailles and loved it. As you exit metro for the hotel, you turn and see the Arch De Triumph with Eiffel Tower in background (spectaculor). Hotel is on a quieter side street. M&M Cafe, just down the road had eggs, ham, bread, juice and hot drink for $9 euro so opted for that over hotel $12 buffet since it looked like a lot of croissants. Front desk gentlemen were very helpful and both spoke english well. We would definitely stay here again, although would consider taking taxi instead of metro with bulky luggage and children.

Reviews.Title: “I do not give 5 star ratings easily!”
Reviews.Author: goatsdaughter
Reviews.Content: However, there was nothing to mark down for this wonderful hotel. Have just returned from a short break in Paris to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary courtesy of our lovey daughter and she could not have chosen a better hotel thanks to Trip Advisor. An upgrade and champagne made our visit so special but every aspect of this hotel was perfect. We enjoyed a large spotlessly clean suite, quiet and with a lovely comfortable bed together with a large, sparkling, well equipped bathroom (why do most hotels fail to be aware of needs such as hooks for clothes and plenty of shelves for toileteries...not this hotel!) The whole hotel was decorated in a tasteful way, traditional without being stuffy and felt warm and welcoming without being too hot...again another failing with most hotels. Tea and coffe in the room was most welome and the continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful. The staff were, without exception, friendly and efficient and the wonderful Lilly was charming and helpful. The position near to the Metro and Arc de Triumph was perfect for us.The metro ride to and from Eurostar at the Gare du Nord was easy and inexpensive. We found that Paris has become very expensive for dining and especially more so for drinks .... American people beware! 50% more expensive than the UK but up to 100% more than in US! The Magda, however, was excellent value for money. All in all thank you so much Lilly and the Magda for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Letiguti
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't post this review, because I don't have much to add to what everyone says about this hotel, but it wouldn't be fair to them (we all like to get compliments, after all!), so here it goes: the location was excellent and so were the room, breakfast and amenities, but what stroke me the most about Royal Magda was the service. Lilly is just outstanding, super friendly and helpful and was never too busy to chat with us and ask about our day, or recommend a restaurant and make reservations for dinner. She also speaks 4 languages, and upon finding out I'm actually Brazilian (I came from the US), she switched to fluent Portuguese, and was even entertained by my husband's poor attempts at speaking the language himself (he's American). The only problem (?) is that the experience set the bar so high that when we encountered what would normally be considered good service on our next stop, Rome, we were slightly disappointed. We really hope to go back some day!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piscesislanddreamer
Reviews.Content: Our extended family chose this hotel for our first trip to Paris and it exceeded expectations in every way. Perfectly located for lesiure strolls to cafes and shops with easy access to metro for all sightseeing. The hotel itself is lovely, with charming French decor. Our room was very clean with comfy bed and extras such as coffee/tea/fridge. We had a wonderful window overlooking the street, which we opened each morning to enjoy the sights of the waking city. The hotel staff, each and everyone, were there for our extended family of 6 (we had 2 rooms) to help us with all questions and needs. They truly made us feel at home. Merci beaucoup Royal Magda.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Fly-n-fish
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful reception staff (thanks again Lilly !).....great location minutes from the Arc and the Metro...our Junior suite fit our family of four (2 teenage girls) perfectly and was modern, clean and comfortable......the whole staff made us feel welcome and at home after our daily explorations of Paris....we would definately stay again and could not be more pleased.....merci'.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: John_Denis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good spot just beside the metro. If you wnt to be riught inthe middle of the action you may prefer to stay inthe Latin Quarter or nearer the Louvre but I thought it was perfect. My girlfriend let the hotel know that we were visiting for my 30th birthday and they had left a half bottle of champagne chilling in the room for your arrival. What a splendid touch. Depsite being near to one of the biggest roundabouts in the world I slept great every night. Staff were unfailingly friendly and unobtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Little Parisian Gem - Genuine Service”
Reviews.Author: punjiti
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Royal Magda for four years in a row now on the original recommendation of TripAdvisor - never been dissappointed. This is truly a hidden gem and one of the reasons why I think TA is so powerful. There are plenty of 'nice' hotels in Paris, and yes, Royal Magda is not full of chandeliers, marble and piped Peruvian love-songs, but it's got ticks in all the right boxes. Location, affordability, transport, food, safety, sights, quiet night's sleep, [patisseries !!!] all ticks. But the real clincher for this hotel is the service. Nothing short of absolutely brilliant, go out of their way, old-fashion care-for-the-customer BRILLIANT. I'm not one for over the top, fake smiles & shakes, but warm hospitality when you're on the road is priceless. Johan is one of those people that money just can't buy. I was most impressed by the curteous, articulate and caring service given by this manager - something the major hotels can only dream of having on their front desk. Nothing was too much of a problem, from advising on transport alternatives, to the local dining, shopping and sights - this is the stuff that the your Westins, Sheratons etc can take a leaf out of and re-write their training guides. Truly Genuine Service is a rare find - this is where I found it (have recommended to countless friends) and I thought it's about time I shared my recommendation and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel-fantastic location and really helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lauram83
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of the reviews on Trip Advisor and I certainly wasn't disappointed! The hotel is really conveniently located just 3 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe! There is a Metro station in the same spot which takes you all over Paris. We booked a Double room with ensuite-the room was on the small side but spotlessly clean and perfectly adequate! It was comfortable and had great double glazing so you don't hear a sound from the street! The hotel has a small lift and is nicely decorated throughout. The staff are fantastic! Yohann at the front desk could not do enough for us! He encouraged my awful attempt to speak French-even teaching me how to say things in French if I asked in English! He made a phone call for us and allowed us print our return boarding cards the day we left. All staff were warm and inviting and so helpful. This hotel is in an excellent location, has great staff and is spotlessly clean. Yes, it is small but you'll be out sightseeing all anyway so it's not an issue! There is a great-but expensive bar near-by where you can stop in for a night cap on the way home and a lovely sandwich bar across the street where you can grab a cheap and cheerful breakfast in the morning. The hotel breakfast is pricey at 12 euros so grab something out and about.The Airport bus, which stops at every terminal, is located about a 2 minute walk away so don't even bother trying to negotiate suitcases on the Metro!! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to everyone! We had a fantastic long weekend in Paris and this hotel was a big part of it! Great value for money in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb service. Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: digitalsausage Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend considering the Royal Magda over a more expensive 4 star option. They have all the same services and amenities without the premium price tag. We live in the UK and if the Royal Magda were here, it would definitely have a 4 star rating and command at least £150 p/night if it was in London. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded (free of charge) and our room actually consisted of 3 rooms - a spacious bathroom (with bath and shower), a living room with mini bar, internet (free) and television, and a separate bedroom with plenty of space and flat screen TV on the wall. Essentially we got upgraded to a suite for nothing! Book in advance and you might also get this opportunity. The service we received was IMPECCABLE throughout our stay. The staff are exceedingly polite, helpful and approachable. We followed the advice of the night staff for dinner on both evenings and were not disappointed. They also assisted us in planning a day trip to Versailles and in buying the right tickets for the Metro. I'm sure they get asked the same questions countless times but you really get the feeling that nothing is too much trouble. On our last day we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel whilst we went out, and they booked us a taxi to Gare du Nord. Impressively, you also have the option to take breakfast in your room at NO EXTRA CHARGE every morning. That includes tea, coffee, orange juice, cheese, bread and croissants & pastries. I'd expect to pay for that luxury at a Hilton or similar. The room was also exceptionally clean and tidy every day. Royal Magda is in a good location; 5 minute walk to Arc de Triomphe and Avenue de Champs Elysees, 5 mins on the Metro to Musée de Louvre, 10 mins on Metro to Eiffel Tower. If we go back to Paris I wouldn't even think about booking a different hotel now - I'd just call Royal Magda direct and not give it a second thought. Our entire stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly, Well worth a stay.”
Reviews.Author: squeak78
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is situated in a great location....but above all the service is first class and always eager to help and please. On the last night my boyfriend got food poisoning (nothing to do with the hotel) and after checking out on the last day we would have had a grizzly 9 hour wait for the euro star. Yohan was an absolute star, finding him a room to use for the rest of the day to rest and recouperate. This service is hard to find and very very much appreciated. Thank you. Flora and Tom

Reviews.Title: “This hotel Ranks High in all of MY Categories!”
Reviews.Author: XMarinCo
Reviews.Content: AAAAHHHH, Is it possible that one can actually receive wonderful service from a hotel in Paris...even before she has arrived! Well, I sure did. Yohan did not miss a beat on all of my requests and when I did arrive, they had followed through on each promise! The Royal Magda was an easy ride from CDG Airport by RER, but I found on my departure day that the Air France Airport Shuttle Bus operates just one block away from this hotel. This means no pulling your luggage up those Metro steps...and it was only a few dollars more than the RER! The hotel ranked very high on my personal checklist. Great location (just around the corner from the L'Arche and the Champs), Clean and quiet rooms, super safe hood, consistently kind service, feeling of really "living" in Paris and some yummy restaurants within 5 mins. walk (try Chez Clement!)! I travelled solo this trip, but I am looking forward to bringing the whole family back with me (hubby and 3 kids!). Consider traveling off season and pay just 100 euros per night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: KingLaudrup
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel at the end of a 3-week tour. It was a great base for exploring Paris, and I would heartily recommend it to anyone visiting the city. So much so, my wife and I are going back this year. It was relatively inexpensive, with courteous staff, clean rooms and off a very quiet street - isn't that all you really need? I don't quite understand some of the negative reviews saying that it's out of the way. It's 5 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and the nearest RER station is barely 3 minutes away. Believe me, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location and a great service”
Reviews.Author: shinyork
Reviews.Content: Pros: Super clean hotel that looks new or recently fully renovated. Bathroom and shower: North American standards (i.e. functional, clean and fully working), which was great. Great service and the lady and gentleman at the Reception are always helpful. Great location a few minutes walk from the Champs-Elysees. Free internet (they give you an Ethernet cable to use their high-speed network). Noise from the neighbours: extremely well isolated; we heard basically no noise! Great price overall. Cons: The room was small, but this was not an issue given the location and facilities. Breakfast at the hotel is 12 euros per person, but you can always go out if you want. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fry720
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break at the Magda Etoile. Thanks to the excellent directions in other Tripadvisor reviews, we arrived at the Magda within one hour of touching down in CDG airport - it literally is just a couple of minutes from the Metro. The location was spot on - very close to the Metro and the connections it offered around Paris. The neighbourhood felt clean and safe, even though the hotel was down a side street. The room is exactly as others have described it - very small, but spotlessly clean and comfortable. We had some noisy neighbours, which we could hear from the landing. However, once inside our room (behind 2 closed doors) we could not hear a thing. The room was very warm, which was a perfect retreat from the bitterly cold Paris streets. The service from reception was perfect. They were welcoming, helpful and spoke perfect English. They helped us make a cabaret reservation and gave us some excellent tips for going out and about. Paris was very expensive, so we made great use of MacDonalds at the end of the street for reasonably priced hot drinks. We also enjoyed the bakery at the other end of the street. We saw a great deal of Paris by taking part in the Fat Tire Bike Tour and the free walking tour of Paris - both recommended on the the TripAdvisor website. Overall, a highly enjoyable trip to Paris, made more enjoyable by the recommendations found on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Lilly tried hard!”
Reviews.Author: pswWoking_England
Reviews.Content: "Lilly (think that was her name!), the receptionist/manager(?) was very pleasant and was most apologetic when one family of young neighbouring guests were a bit raucous between 10.30pm-midnight on our first night. Nothing particularly anti social but the walls are thin!We rang reception at 10.30pm and a male receptionist rang our neighbours who were quiet for a while and then started to get noisy again. I rang reception again and was told to bang on the wall!! They again stopped the noise so I guess he must have rung them again. Lilly was most apologetic in the morning and offered to move us to a quieter location. The new room was much bigger and we were given a complimentary bottle of champagne. That was a nice touch and much appreciated. (the only other negative was that the beds were a bit hard..although we have had worse!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: GingerandTommy
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in Paris (first visit) and stayed here. Excellent choice. Safe and perfect location. Most of the staff speak English very well, they are courteous, patient and knowledgeable about area and customer service. Room clean and we were upgraded on arrival as it was our anniversary and received a bottle of champagne. Bathroom clean, shower worked very well. Room decent size. We had breakfast for 12 euros each and thought it was money well spent. Coffee/Tea/Juice, cereals, breads, jam, cheeses, milk, dates, prunes. You can fill up on what was available. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION, CLEAN, and SPACIOUS! What more would you want?”
Reviews.Author: crystalite729
Reviews.Content: My husband, our best friends (another couple), and I went to Paris in Nov. 2009. I researched hotels for literally 2 months before taking a chance on this one. I researched: location, cost, space, location to tourist areas, cleanliness, etc. I relied heavily on people's reviews and satellite maps off of google before making my decision. This hotel was perfect! It was in our price range and close to train stations. We took the train from the CDG airport straight to the hotel and from the hotel straight to the Eurostar. It was not a hassle (just had to manage our luggage on the train and avoid crowding spaces as best as we could). The hotel is VERY CLEAN (one of the things I worried about due to not being able to see it in person before booking online). We stayed in the family suite. It had a very spacious bathroom, bed, and separate living area that had a sofabed. Sofabed was VERY comfortable. It did not have a bar stabbing you in the middle of your back like sofabeds in the USA. Front desk staff spoke English and were helpful in answering any questions. Elevator is abnormally small (fits literally 1 person at a time). But who cares when you're saving money! Take the stairs lol! It is a 2 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph; 20 minute walk to the Louvre (5 min by train); 20 min walk to Eiffel Tower; 20 min walk to Musee Orsay; 5 min walk to Champ Elysses. We went to all the regular tourist spots. Make sure you add Sacre Coeur and St. Michel to your stops. They are must sees at dusk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gratitude2
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Paris and visited many many times and this hotel was the nicest, mid priced hotel I have stayed in. The hotel was perfectly clean - including the reception and the rooms. The rooms were also a decent size (for Paris). The location was very good because it is just a block to a major Metro/RER station. It was easy to get to Versailles, Eiffle Tower, The Louvre, etc.The hotel was pretty quiet because it is located in a small alley. We slept very well. The staff was helpful and the breakfast was delicious. I would return to this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: doddyksw
Reviews.Content: Wow. Brilliant location. It is a really nice hotel. Small rooms, but clean and everything you would expect from a good Paris hotel. We booked through hotels.com. The staff were friendly and the view from our room overlooked a nice little cobbled street. You cannot beat the location. 5 minutes to the champs elysees and arc de triomphe. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Paris?”
Reviews.Author: TexasBornRaised
Reviews.Content: This could possibly be the best value hotel in Paris, but I must admit that I haven't stayed in that many Paris hotels. That said, I have stayed in a lot of other hotels around the world, and this one ranks very highly against all of them in terms of value for money. Don't let the term "value" throw you off, this is still an elegant and immaculate boutique hotel, just not with the boutique price tag, and admittedly, not all the boutique little extras. I spent four nights on a combination of business (in La Defense) and leisure (with wife and baby) and it met all of my needs and much more. Pros: Some of the best staff I have ever encountered. Great sidestreet location in Etoile, just two blocks from Arc de Triomphe and Metro Line 1 which leads to central Paris Very clean and well-equipped room Building with lots of character and original features, but completely modernized. Cons (very minor): Rooms are smallish, but pretty sure you wouldn't get bigger and same quality for the same price anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paristraveller62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the deluxe suite of Royal Magda Etoile in the end of January 2010, and we certainly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was very quite. The rooms and the bathroom were very spacious (more than adequate for 3 adults). Everything was clean and comfortable. There was really high speed internet connection in the room. The personnel were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was complete. The hotel is only 1 min walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro station. The taxi from and to the airport (ChDG) cost about 40-45 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: ZetaKing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located to walk to most destinations and ideally suited to get the metro or taxis. The hotel is small, with a very tiny elevator, and the rooms are also small but contain everything you require. During our stay the temperature was around -4 degrees outside, but the room was very well heated and extremely comfortable. We went to celebrate our wedding anniversary and the hotel left us a complimentary bottle of cahampagne on arrival. Overall, the staff spoke both English and Spanish and were extremely helpful with information on restaurants, places to go etc.. For the price of hotels in in this part of Paris, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, clean and very friendly hotel. Totally recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend this January. The location is really good, close to the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is small but very cosy. Very clean (which is incredibly important for us). The rooms are cosy (not to big but just right). The staff is extremely friendly. The concierge knows his job. He totally knows what he is talking about. We wanted to make reservations in a restaurant and immediatly he told us in a very polite way that the service in that particular restaurant was not the best. We asked him if he could recommend us something and during the day he took his time, called us in the afternoon on our cell to let us know that he had found us a really nice table in the Café de L'Homme (restaurant of Musée de L'Homme) overlooking the Eiffel tower. Really nice, great atmosphere,... perfect for us! The breackfast buffet is really yummy and a good choice of breads, cheese, ... In other words, you can't go wrong here, price vs quality is really really good!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: niamh6426
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris on 11th December 2009 with my partner for a short break before Christmas. After reading the previous reviews I know we were in for a treat. Myself and my partner were celebrating our anniversary. I emailed the hotel before traveling and informed them of our special occasion. They advised that we would get an upgraded room if there was one available on our arrival - which to my delight there was. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning - about 10am and we got to check in straight away, we got shown to our room and upon arrival we were greeted by a bottle of champagne and some nibbles - exactly what I needed after my Ryanair flight!!!!! I drank the champers as my boyf is not keen and we walked to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel. It is only a 10 minute walk along beautiful tree lined streets. The Arc De Triomphe is a mere 3 minute walk from the hotel with a metro located there. The metro is very easily navigated. I must commend the staff in the hotel, they were at all times friendly, curtious and helpful. The room in the hotel was a good size - granted it was an upgrade, I have a feeling that the 'normal' rooms may have been a little tight but it is a city centre hotel in fairness. The shower was good however the WC was in a separate room to the WHB and bath/shower but it did not bother us. On the Friday night we went for food and drinks and when we got back to the hotel the concierge offered us a night cap - must appreciated!! He was very friendly, gave us advise on the best things to do in the city and when I forgot my coat, he brought it straight up to my room. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and when I return to Paris, I will certainly be staying here again and I would highly recommend it to any of my friends that are going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Staff, Highest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: BerthaB
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 13 year old, 10 year old) stayed here fr three nights over the New Year holiday. It is a great hotel in every way. Perfect location. The suite was big enough for the 4 of us, and had a huge bathroom with a great shower. It was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast was modest in terms of variety but had enough choices for everyone and was fresh and cheerful. Free internet, New Year's chocolates, and many other touches.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel and warm friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sally101Scotland
Reviews.Content: Arrived by shuttle on the 29th from Charles de Gaulle Airport. Found this hotel through tripadvisor and it didn't disapoint! Stayed 4 night in a standard double room, which was we thought was great. The location is amazing right in the center, yet on a quiet street. The staff are very friendly and helpfull and even left us chocolates in our room and an invitation to a free bottle of champagne on hogmanay which was a great touch. I would recommend this hotel to anybody wishing to stay in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanPLondon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place - very friendly staff, great location, clean room. If any slight niggle, it was just that rooms were on the small side (which we were expecting, from a city centre hotel) which meant that bed was positioned against a wall so I had to clamber over my pregnant wife to get to the bathroom...But no gripes apart from that, had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: shawming
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access, the air france bus stop was just around the corner and the metro was within short walking distance. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. They speak well in English. So dont have to learn how to speak france before coming to Paris. The internet connection was free in the room. This made the video calls to my kids so convenient and easy. The breakfast was good though not much of choices. I love my trip to Paris. It was so wonderfull. The only bad experience during the trip was the departure from CDG airport. The airport was very very inefficient!!! It was really an anticlimax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door we knew this hotel was right for us. The front desk staff was warm, friendly and best of all for us they spoke English. Our room was on the sixth floor and was easy to access via the elevator, room was small but very comfortable for our needs. We had requested a King bed so of course it took up more space, the bed was very comfortable, there was an extra blanket and pillows in the closet so we didn't have to request them. A mini bar and safe was also there for our convenience. The entire hotel was very clean and the house keeping staff were all smiles everytime we saw them. The bath was cleaned and refreshed daily including the amenities (shampoo, soap, bath saltz). A convenient hairdryer was also provided. The optional breakfast was 12.00 Euro per person and to expensive for us, we only wanted coffee and a pastry so we went around the corner to the bakery. It was a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees (less than 5 min). We would definately stay at this hotel and also tell friends about it. I worked in the travel industry for over 20 years and have experienced many hotels. The price was exceptionaly good for Paris and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff & VERY Clean”
Reviews.Author: madamelem_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites from 16th November 2009 for 3 nights. The bedroom was ample big enough with a flat screen TV and comfy bed. The living area had a desk, TV and sofa bed in. Ideal for a quick chill out between day and night-time exploration of the city. Not sure if it goes throughout the hotel but we had free Wi-Fi access in the room. The rooms were wonderfully clean and the hotel oozes original Parisien features - so much nicer than staying in a sterile chain hotel. The staff are great - were very helpful in guiding us to buy museum passes, show bookings etc. Their English is excellent but they did indulge us as we tried to speak French. I had forewarned them that I had booked as a surprise for my husband's birthday and on arrival there was a complimentary bottle of Champagne in the room, a really lovely gesture. And they even wished him happy birthday as we set out for an evening out. We didn't have breakfast there. It's 12 euros each for continental and there are LOTS of small cafes and croissanteries within a 100 yard radius where you can enjoy the same for half the price whilst watching the world (and crazy traffic) go by. The location is brilliant - it's a 2 minute walk to the Metro (Charles de Gaulle de Etoile) and the Arc de Triomphe. You can see the Eiffel Tower from the top of the street. We were there when France and Algeria got through their stages at the football - the Arc was crazy with hundreds, if not thousands, of fans singing, letting off fireworks etc. and the traffic was grid-locked. We made an early retreat from the city that night and enjoyed a bottle of wine in the room. The double glazing is superb - once the windows were closed you wouldn't have known what was going on a hundred yards away. A couple of money-saving tips - at the top of the street on the opposite side of Ave Wagram is a wine shop - lots of choice starting at 3 euros a bottle so if you're on a budget or don't want to shell out hotel/ bar prices (20-30 euros for run of the mill wine) then pay a visit here. Check out the "Formules" at the restaurants and bars, especially at lunchtime. You can get a 2 or 3 course meal for 10-20 euros per person. Don't bother with taxis or transfer coaches - you can buy a ticket for the train & metro to get you to the hotel for 8.5 euros. The ticket machines at the airports take cards and are easy to use or you can queue for the ticket office. Take the train from CDG on RER B (blue line), change at Chatelet for the metro and the hotel is 2 minutes from the metro station, exit 4 - Av. Wagram Looking at the traffic, especially around the Arc & Champs-Ellyses it's probably much quicker too. if you're going to check out more than 3 or 4 main sights then consider getting a museum pass which can be bought in the FNAC department store- the hotel staff will give you directions. It gives you access to most of the main monuments and museums (louvre, musee d'orsay, musee de rodin, arc de triomphe, notre dame crypts, egouts de paris etc.) and stops you having to queue for tickets at most places. We loved our short stay in Paris and have vowed to return - we will definitely choose the Royal Magda again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jocla
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on trip advisor, and we were not disappointed. Great central location near the Arc de Triomphe and Metro Charles de Gaulle. Room and bathroom are compact but clean and efficient ( great shower) The major bonus is getting breakfast. Paris is pricey and it just sets you up for the morning - tea/coffee/juice/fruit/cereal/breads/cheeses etc. The staff are lovely; very friendly and helpful and speak english ( and other languages I'm sure) There's a great cafe if you are in the area at lunchtime - exit the hotel and turn left . Its at the end of the road . Fantastic selection of salads/quiches/lasagnes/cakes. Aimed at the offices workers so real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “what a location!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayskeepmesane
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel just down a sidestreet from the Arc d'Triumph. The metro station is a 2 minute walk away. It was cold when we visited in November but the Hotel was soo cosy and its so funky too! The staff were so very helpfull and gave us directions, helped us book shows and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel has a lovely cosy little breakfast rrom and breakfast was available right through til 12 midday!!! never known that before. It was a buffet style breakfast with fresh french bread and pastries, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit etc etc... spolit for choice. The rooms were small but that wasn't a problem, there was always hot water and the shower was really powerfull. The only thing I wouldn't recommend would be the room service.. don't bother its a bit rubbish and really expensive, oh and it took almost 2 hours to arrive?

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this hotel for everyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: KoningHeerjansdam
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very frendly employees. The services is good. The room was clean en compleet with everything you 'll need. Also the quality of the bed was fine. We realy liked the breakfast (free for children). The central place of the hotel, near by station Charles de Gaulle-Etoile (with 4 metro/RER-lines) and 3 minutes from the Arc the Triomphe, makes this the perfect place to stay, when you want to discover Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Roland_Jurmala
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, fantastic staff, very good location looking to the map - close to underground with direct line to Disneyland, a lot of restaurants (our favorite was Italian :), only one minus - located in small street, which is a little bit dirty...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TLL2008
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days in the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel and would stay in this hotel again. The room was clean and well-appointed, and the location near the Arc du Triumph was ideal. However, overall, it was the hotel's staff that make this a great choice. They were knowledgeable and friendly and encouraged my husband's attempts to use his high school french. We had a wonderful stay there!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, small hotel in a great location with easy airport access”
Reviews.Author: travellerkarel
Reviews.Content: excellent location with metro, airport access. Staff very pleasant. Breakfast overpriced but given Paris prices, not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: alejandro023
Reviews.Content: Excellent price, good location, amazing staff. Lovely weekend with my wife i will definately repeat in the future. excellent option for a very good weekend in an amazing city with excellent value for money. The price obtained was extraordinary when compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A haven within Paris”
Reviews.Author: JCMenke2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a total of four nights at the Royal Magda, and it was always a pleasure to return after a busy day with touring or business conferences. Yohan and Lilly were completely charming, knowledgeable and accommodating of our questions and our lodging needs. We could not have been happier with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Magda Etoile Hotel for few nights in September 2009. Small hotel, close to metro, Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe - great location. Many restaurants around. Room was very small, but clean. Bathroom refurbished, tiny. We were facing the street- Rue Troyon- could be quite noisy at night with private clubs close by.Free Wi Fi. Overall charming Parisian Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Fussy89
Reviews.Content: We knew that hotel rooms in Paris could be small and "hit and miss" and so did quite a lot of research to find something clean, conveniently located that would accommodate all four of us. This hotel ticked all the boxes. My hair band fell down the back of the television and as I moved the unit to retrieve it, dreaded what I would find lurking behing. I was so surprised to find not a speck of dust or dirt; it was as clean and spotless as the rest of the room. We would definitely go back to this hotel. We had a great time in Paris and this hotel helped make our trip one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “C'est bon!”
Reviews.Author: becksb
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Royal Magdal! It is a beautiful hotel tucked in the beginning pinwheel off the grand Arc de Triomphe. It is so easy to walk to the Arc and the Eiffel Tower and the Champs-Elysees. We arrived to Paris by night train from Munich to Gare de l’Est. We walked to Sacre Coeur and then got a taxi to the hotel. We got there about 1pm and our room was ready for us – thankfully! We took showers and refreshed ourselves and then headed out to see the city! We saw and went up in the Arc. Then we walked down the Champs to the Louvre. We then headed to Ile de la Cite and saw Sainte Chappell and Notre Dame. And we walked back up to the hotel for a quick break before heading out to dinner. We had awesome weather! And the restaurants are great around the hotel. We also went on a day trip to Normandy from Paris one day and walked from the hotel to Gare Saint-Lazare. We would recommend a taxi for that one – long walk! But a wonderful trip. The reception was extremely nice and accommodating. I practiced my French with the afternoon staff and they spoke English very well and were very sweet. We came in late one night and asked the night staff about the train to Normandy and even though he didn’t speak a lot of English, we found out what we needed easily. He was very nice. The room itself was wonderful. Simple, charming décor and very clean. The bathroom was great. I even took a soak in the tub (bath salts were provided) one day when I was achy from all the walking. You could hear a little bit from the neighbors but that wasn’t a big deal. We were, however, bothered by the noise at night from the bar right down the street. We were warm in our room (and couldn’t turn the AC on) so we had the gorgeous window open and heard lots of noise every night. One night a couple was arguing very loudly until 5am. But that’s not the hotel’s fault – it is a big, active city. Just something to keep in mind. The minibar was awesome for those “gotta have it” moments. Overall we loved Paris and this hotel and would recommend it. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place, perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: BaciUAE
Reviews.Content: A small independant hotel that made you feel welcome. Like everyone says, it is well located and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miri_Miriam
Reviews.Content: Very good location; polite stuff; clean rooms; breakfast is not very rich, however due to convenient location there are a lot of opportunities to eat in restaurants and numerous coffee-houses which are located near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED OUR STAY AT THE ROYAL MADGA ETOILE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: JanetG
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda is in a great location right by the Arc de Triomphe on a small quiet street named Troyon. It was very easy to get all around Paris from the local metro stop - Charles de Gaulle-Etoile. The hotel was a small, very Parisian building dating around the 1860s. It was recently refurbished and had a beautiful staircase in the center. The public rooms were quite nice and everything in the hotel was extremely clean. Our room was small but nicely furnished and everything worked. The bathroom was wonderful (great water pressure on the 6th floor). The very best thing about the hotel was the staff! Everyone was very friendly and helpful beyond the ordinary. English was spoken by all. It was our wedding anniversary and a beautiful silver tray with a bottle of champagne, glasses, and snacks was left in our room with a note wishing us a happy anniversary! All in all, we just loved our stay at the Royal Magda!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCW2009
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel for my short overnight trip to Paris. I booked the hotel online and upon arrival I was handed the key within minutes while being informed that I had been upgraded (for free) from a standard double to a junior suite. The hotel was top notch, the room very comfortable and spacey. The hotel's decorations were fresh making it look like new and not showing any signs of age (I have no idea how old it is). Service was also very good with the staff being very friendly and helpful, answering our questions about touring Paris. They also ordered me a taxi which arrived on time. I had family staying at the Hotel Neva (not bad) and Hotel Mac Mahon (awful) and my hotel was in a different league. The location was also very good - easy to find and only a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: Vaakku
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and quiet little hotel. Excellent location close to metro station and Champs Elysee. Very friendly and helpful staff with good english language ability.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location for families with children”
Reviews.Author: keshacole
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and was able to direct us to all major spots using the subway, and made good recommendations for eating locations. 2 blocks from Champs Elysee and you can see and access the Arc de Triomphe under 5 minutes. Would stay again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TigerLillieWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda for a weekend. Great location, friendly staff and really clean. The hotel is situated in a side street and has a metro station just around the corner. There are numerous bars and restaurants close by. The hotel is kept very clean and the rooms are immaculate. It would have been nice to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the room. When we go back to Paris we will definitely stay at the Royal Magda again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families, good location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: isabelarcher80
Reviews.Content: My husband had to attend a worskshop in Paris, and we decided to spend the weekend there with all the family even if our younger son is only 3 months (our elder is 2). Finding a hotel room hosting two children is quite difficult in Paris, as most hotels limit the number of occupants to 2 adults or 2 adults and 1 child. The Royal Magda Hotel is a great choice for families. Our room had a queen bed and a sofa bed suitable for an adult or two children. We also asked for a crib for our younger child. The room was very large and luminous, and we never felt crowded despite the extra beds. Everything was spotless clean. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but the neighbourhood is full of brasseries and boulangeries where you can choose beween several kinds of breakfast menus. The location is great, just a couple of minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elisee. The RER station is just two blocks away, and it has an elevator entry for strollers (just a few stations have stroller accessibility, but people are always ready to help). We had visited Paris many times but never stayed in this part of the city. The Royal Magda Hotel was a happy discovery, and we will certainly stay there in the future. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: IvanD
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this fantastic 3 star hotel which has 5 star service. Thank you for being part of our perfect weekend in Paris

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SuzeQFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights based on reviews we read on this website. It was delightful! The location is unbeatable - you are in the heart of Paris and can walk to the Arch de Triomphe, the Champs Elysees, etc. The young man behind the desk is so pleasant and helpful - the last day he saw us having difficulty communicating with the cab driver outside and he came running out to translate! The hotel is very small and the rooms are typical of a city - small, also. But, the bathroom is first rate and the hotel is spotless. We didn't have the breakfast - it was pricey - but there are tons of local bakeries, restaurants, etc. in the area. I was worried it would be noisy, but it was very quiet and located on a small, quiet street. They do have an elevator (not all old hotels do) and we had many laughs trying to get us and the luggage in at the same time - it is very small. The room was very reasonable by Paris standards and we would stay here again if we're fortunate enough to return to this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: dimitri40
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location and cleanliness of this hotel. although the room was a bit small it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “It was our weekend holiday voyage”
Reviews.Author: VladimirNora
Reviews.Content: We spent only three days in Paris but had the feeling of being away from home much longer. Our pleasent impressions about the city simply can not be separated from those about Magda Etoile. Lovely small cosy hotel located just in the heart of the French capital 5minutes walk from Champs -Elysees. Very easy to get from Air France bus stop. The staff is really kind and ready to help on any occasion. We were simply touched when we saw in our room a bottle of Champaine and a card congratulating my wife on the occasion of her birthday... As far as specific French small sizes are concerned we think neither lift nor the room itself can not be an argument while evaluating this hotel. We will definitely come back again. Vladimir

Reviews.Title: “friendly service right in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: LMPMittagong
Reviews.Content: we were travelling with young children 4 & 6 and my parents. We could not have asked for a better location for visiting disneyland and versaille (direct trains from the hotel). The breakfast was delicious and very good value. The rooms were spotless and quite spacious. The reception staff at the front desk went out of their way to assist us and all requests for help were met with genuine hospitality. there were many great restaurants within easy walking distance to the hotel and the area was quiet at night given it's proximity to the arc de triomph. Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gesoire
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through tripadvisor after a lot of research. ive been to paris before but only ever stayed in 5 star hotels, so i was a bit nervous about this hotel. When we arrived we couldnt believe our luck. My friends actually asked me if we were in the right place because it looked like a little fancy boutique hotel. The staff were the friendliest ive ever seen in a hotel. I was surprised that there was no need to fill out any papers at check in and even the check out was quick and professional. We booked one of the suites for the three of us and it was perfect. The room was simple but very clean and quiet facing to the back of the hotel. The only thing to criticize might be the tiny elevator but we didnt mind walking. I read a few reviews about the noisiness.The second night a family checked into the room above and we could hear everything but we didnt really mind. This hotel was charming and good value and better than most fancy 5 star hotels i stayed in. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: PeteM01
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff make this hotel stand out but it is also in a perfect location for quick trips to Paris - very handy for the CdG bus as well as many of the sights. Downsides are the size of the standard rooms and the price although these are pretty much what you would expect in Paris. Other areas are probably better served by reasonably-priced restaurants and bars but it is handy for Guy Savoy, if you have a few hundred Euro to burn.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculately clean, fantastic location, first rate service. This hotel has it all.”
Reviews.Author: ABTraveller60
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4-day stay at this hotel based on TripAdvisor and other reviews. We were in Paris for the first time to celebrate our 25th Anniversary. If you are looking for a clean, friendly, ideally located hotel with phenomenal customer service and excellent value, look no further. We arrived from CDG early on a Monday morning using the Air France bus (an excellent way to get into the city from the airport). Our room was not yet ready (it was 11 a.m.) but the exceptionally courteous front desk receptionist stored our luggage and suggested we return in an hour or so. When we came back, our bags had been taken up to our room, with the exception of our two golf club travel cases, which they stored for us during our stay (we weren't golfing while in Paris). The front desk staff were exceptionally friendly, the hotel is 3 minutes' walk from the Arc de Triomphe and a major Metro hub, and the cost is very reasonable by Parisian standards. One note--the rooms are small and there is very limited space to unpack your clothes, so if you're a clothes horse, you may want to book a bigger room. But you're in Paris, so why spend time in your room anyway? We received an outstanding recommendation for a romantic French restaurant to celebrate our anniversary (Le Petit Columbier, merci, Yohan), and the overall level of service during our stay was wonderful. Don't look any further, just book this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff, perfect location... excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: European81
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Paris and were very glad we chose the Royal Magda Hotel. The room was large (suite deluxe) with a separate living room with tv, decent sized bathroom and then bedroom with its own tv. It was also very clean, can't fault it as it was spotless. The staff were really nice and helpful; special mention needed for the reception staff Yohan and Lily, who speaks perfect Spanish. They made a great effort to make our trip unforgettable.
