The location could not be better, just two corners away from the Arc de Triomphe, where there is a Metro station that connects many lines and lets you go straight to many of the attractions. Besides, and this is just what we did, when leaving the hotel in the morning or coming back in the evening you can have a walk on the Champs Elysees and enjoy a coffee or a cocktail there, which adds some more charm to your day. All in all, excellent experience. Royal Magda offers everything you need for a pleasant trip in Paris. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AzureUn
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is clean and nice. First we arr there,we decided to take a train to the Hotel, becoz its seem easy as they mention on the reservations paper. but we a bit confuse about the road name, and with all many luggage... when we check out from Hotel, we decide to take a taxi, its better., hahah/// I really love the room... small and cute. and clean. theres no problem in the room that i stay at all. Thats Great, , if we visit Paris again, we would love to come back to your Hotel._ Ab-So_Lute_Definately!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shipscaptain
Reviews.Content: Booked on the strength of comments on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. Ideally located for sightseeing, this is a very clean and compact hotel. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms tastefully decorated and arranged. We travelled to celebrate my father-in-law's 80th birthday and the hotel provided him with a bottle of champagne - a nice touch and much appreciated. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hits the Mark”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the winter for the weekend. The location is great - Arc de Triomphe is just around the corner and, if you're feeling flush, Restaurant Guy Savoy is literally opposite the hotel. Breakfast was tasty. If you are travelling on a euro-budget but would like a couple of nice touches this is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location, friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonholiday0
Reviews.Content: We have to agree with the majority of the views about this hotel. It is perfectly situated 2 minutes walk from the Arc De Triumph. The receptionist was very helpful and very witty. He recommended two restaurants, in which we ate, and they were very nice - Bambou chinese across the raod and Cesars at the end of the street. The hotel was very clean and we got a free upgrade because it was my birthday. Our room 516 was huge with a setee, seperate WC and bathroom. On returning to the room on Sunday afternoon there was complimentary champagne left in the room from the staff. A really nice gesture. Breakfast was typically french continental. My wife and I will stay in this hotel the next time we visit Paris without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Magda Etoile is tres perfection”
Reviews.Author: marlasue13
Reviews.Content: The Magda Etoile hotel is a perfect hotel in a perfect location. The hotel is small and personable. Yohann and others helped our stay from my first email (and there were many) through our last au revoir. They made calls, booked restaurants, cancelled reservations, helped book airport transportation, helped with a trip to Normandy and private night tour for an anniversary couple. They gave us maps, helped us plan an itinerary and found us a dr. when one of our party was sick. No request was too large or too small. The rooms are small but clean and the bathroom was also small but immaculate. The breakfast room was warm and the food was your European breakfast with coffee and a smile. The location 1/2 block from the Metro line #1 was also perfect. The Metro is very user friendly and we were all over the city without a problem. The hotel is 1/2 block from the Arc d'Triomphe and 1 1/2 blocks from the Champs Elysee. The hotel made our stay memorable and I would go back in a heartbeat. Merci Magda Etoile!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: K8EHokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda for our honeymoon. Their staff was knowledgable and friendly - they helped us with directions, phone calls, and anything we asked about! Rooms were cleaned every day, and the breakfast was a nice, simple start to our day. It's extremely close to the Arc and a metro station is a block away. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: judybo
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at this hotel, first time with daughter, this time with husband. I would not stay anywhere else in Paris,Tthe hotel is ideally situated near to Arc de Triomphe, Metro and restaurants. It is a very clean hotel and the staff are really friendly, yes the rooms are not huge, but you don't go to Paris to stay in your room. Breakfast is expensive but is a good continental buffet Will always recommend this hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0125003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were only in Paris for one day and one night so we were on a tight schedule. The hotel is located right around the corner from the Metro stop at the Arch de Triumph. We had no trouble at all walking straight to the hotel. We were allowed to check in around 11am and the front desk held our bags in a secure room the next day while we toured around before leaving Paris. The hotel will provide an iron and ironing board if requested. This was an important detail for me :-) Out of all of the hotels my husband and I visited throughout Europe the staff at the Roya Magda Etoile were the friendliest and most willing to help in any way possible. I'll definitely book there the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... the service is what saves this hotel from being below average!”
Reviews.Author: chitopher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just like every other little hotel in Paris... It has a great location right by the Arc De Triumph/Avenue des Champs-Élysées. Except the service is outstanding!! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful at all times. Rooms are small, but that is Paris. Most importantly the rooms are clean... not all in Paris are!! I would definitly go back if I wanted to stay in that area again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed through Bastille day....fantastic hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: andrewand
Reviews.Content: As it was a Bank-holiday for the the French and being incredibly busy throughout Paris, the hotel was pleasent, quiet and clean. Perfect location for numerous bars and for the Metro. Recommed to anyone

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an excellent value and in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: cjb11711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel on June 21-25, 2009. It was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again. It was very inexpensive by Paris standards and you cannot beat the location. (Right around the corner from the Arc du Triomphe.) The hotel is very clean and the service was excellent. Naturally, the hotel room is a bit small, but that is not surprising given that it is located in Paris. It was very quiet, although there was a road crew doing some work on Rue Troyon while we were there. The road work was a temporary thing, however, and it should not deter anyone from staying there. The bathrooms in the room were very modern and completely up to date, and also very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Peetabeera
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you read about here and more. Perfectly located, my husband and I spent two days walking everywhere. Arc de Triomph (less than 5 minutes away), up and down the Champs Elysees, to the Eiffel Tower etc. Staff are exceptionally helpful. Found a doc around the corner for me when I ended up with Strep throat and translated the prescription directions for me when I got back. Prepared tea for me late one night when I was desperate for warmth on my throat. The room was small but space was used efficiently and there was a small terrace off our room which was lovely to sit out on. Bathroom appeared newly renovated and water pressure was good. Very comfortable bed. Lots of great places to eat nearby. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvlchick11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in June. The hotel's location was great, just a block from a very convenient metro stop. Very close to the Arc de Triomphe, and a leisurely half an hour stroll to the Eiffel tower. The rooms were very clean. The rooms were a bit small, but I'd say they were average based on European standards. The bathroom was nice, clean and a good size, but I was staying in a suite. I found the bathroom in the regular room my friends were staying in to be a bit small. The staff was very friendly and very helpful whenever we asked for advice. The elevator was small and slow. I generally used the stairs because it was much faster. When a bunch of us were trying to check out at the same time with loads of luggage it took about 10 minutes for us all to get down to the lobby since only about 2 suitcases and 1 person could fit in the elevator at a time. Not a big deal, but I imagine it could get annoying if you were staying on the top floor. Only other minor complaint was that the walls were a little thin and it was easy to hear other guests. The hotel offered free internet access, which is always useful. Wifi was available only in the lobby level. In your room, you need to get a cord from the front desk if you want to connect to the internet. I picked this hotel because it offered more reasonable prices than many other hotels in Paris and had good reviews on trip advisor. I was not disappointed at all. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small centrally based hotel”
Reviews.Author: FionaMcC
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly hotel that is centrally located by the Arc De Triomphe. The bedroms are very small but comfortable. The breakfast is lovely and plentiful. The staff were very helpful and on hand to give advice and directions. I would definately recommend this hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mrs_hermes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Royal Magda Etoile very much. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Prior to my arrival at this hotel, I've been communicating with them via email and they've been very responsive all the time. Upon our arrival, the staffs helped us with reservations, directions and other specific needs. Though the room was a bit small, it was very tidy and clean (in particular, the bathroom). The hotel's location also saved us some travelling time as it was near the Arc, the Champs Elysees and the metro/RER station. We would definitely stay with RME should we visit Paris again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: JFM9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our grown daughter stayed in a "junior suite" in this hotel for four nights this June, with our daughter sleeping on a comfortable, thick-mattressed sofa bed in a room twice the size of our triple room in Rome. We found it to be a lovely, quaint hotel of about 6 rooms per floor, almost in the shadow of the Arc de Triomphe. We were on the 4th of 6 floors, with 78 steps to walk up, with a small lift, which accommodates two people with luggage at a time, as an alternative. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and most spoke excellent English. It was very clean and quiet, and we never heard neighboring guests through the walls. A variety of choices for a light breakfast were available near the lobby for an additional charge of 12 euros per person. I also enjoyed reading complimentary copies of THE INTERNATIONAL HERALD TRIBUNE and EL PAIS, available in the lobby, along with other choices. The location was excellent, with nearby money exchanges, pharmacies, an internet cafe and good restaurants, of which our favorite, discovered unfortunately on our last night, was Le Hide, a small French establishment virtually around the corner. One day we had a delightful stroll all the way down the Champs Elysees from the Arc de Triomphe to the Louvre and beyond to Notre Dame Cathedral, and we found all of Paris to be easily accessible from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, friendly,comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLeah
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris and this hotel was perfect. Located two minutes from the Arc d'Triomphe, Metro and the Champs Elysee, it gave us a central location from which to navigate this spectacular city. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were more than pleased with the advice they gave and found their helpfulness made it possible to see as much of the city as we could, given the short length of our stay. The hotel was very clean and the only complaint I have was that the room was very small compared to what we're used to in the US. The free WiFi and extremely comfortable bed more than made up for that. Breakfast is available for 12euro each. It is Paris is an expensive city and the cost of the room wasn't out of sync with the general cost of being a tourist, but be prepared to spend some money while in Paris. However, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Beautiul Staff.”
Reviews.Author: missd81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda for a short visit in Paris, it was such a great close location to everything including the metro. We had a great stay & the friendly staff happily helped us with all of our needs. We had a 1&1/2 yr old baby with us so we are always going to need things such as a cot, milk 4 bottles etc.. they were great. It is true that you can hear everything through the walls, but it wasn't really a problem for us. We had a large junior suite & a standard room. Can't fault this place. Oh no tea & coffee facilities, bumma.

Reviews.Title: “Great,Value for Money Hotel in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: chegmasterfunk
Reviews.Content: The club room was great value @ 160 Euros per night.Staff were very helpful with a good grasp of english.Location was 5 minutes from Arc de Triumph with main Metro station nearby which was fantastic for getting around Paris. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magnificence”
Reviews.Author: EdithVermont
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris. I had envisioned making this trip ever since I was a teenager. However, as a woman traveling solo, I was a bit nervous and apprehensive. I made my reservations online, and was able to get a sense of what my stay might be like from viewing the photos of the rooms and the hotel in general. I felt satisfied and confident with my choice. I arrived at the Royal Magda Etoile on Saturday May 2nd for a 12-night stay. And from that moment, all my experiences far exceeded any and all expectations. The hotel lobby was warm and welcoming, yet safe and secure, and I was greeted immediately by two of the extremely friendly and professional staff members. My cozy "mansard" room was on the 6th floor overlooking street (Troyon); but never was street noise an issue for me. My single bed was very comfortable and I enjoyed a good night's sleep --except when my feet ached from too much sightseeing. The shower was a bit small but I quickly got used to it, especially because the bathroom itself was very clean, comfortable and newly remodeled, with a built-in hairdryer, razor good plumbing and good water-pressure. There was also a safe and mini-bar in the room and other members of the polite and professional Magda staff made up the room daily ,as well as serving the wonderful "petit dejeuner" in the dining room. Located only minutes from the metro, the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees, the hotel is also very conveniently located, making sightseeing trips, shopping and restaurant visits very managable. And the very capable and professional staff members were more than willing to help with reservations and/or directions whenever necessary. Thanks to everyone at the Royal Magda Etoile, my first trip to Paris was something very special...Magnificent in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Castelldefels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, till yesterday morning, because a friend of mine stayed here last year and recommended it to me, and I'm really glad!! Location is perfect, less than 5 minutes to Etoile metro (different lines and RER) station and less than 5 minutes to Air France Bus stop from Charles de Gaulle Airport. Full of shops and restaurants near. At the citiy centre but in a quiet and safe street. Lovely people at the reception. Small but comfortable room and bathroom. Tiny but sunny balcony. Comfortable bed. Everything clean and nice. What else can you ask for!!! I'll recomend it to all my friends who go to Paris and I'll definitely stay there again when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: horseshoebay
Reviews.Content: A small delightful hotel. Friendly staff. Good size rooms. Recently remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they say is true!”
Reviews.Author: Skimeup
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, the location is great, the rooms are terrific, and the breakfast is OK - not great but I only had one night and I didn't want to mess with finding a restaurant outside the hotel. There is so much to be said for proximity to the Champs and to the metro stations - this is a gem of a hotel. I stayed in Paris at a different hotel the week before I got there and they allowed me to leave a daypack there to pick up on my way back through. The staff was kind and helpful with lost luggage from the airport. There is an Air France bus that will take you to either Orly or CDG just around the corner (you don't have to be flying Air France) which is VERY handy though it was pretty easy via the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: lilybutt52
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda Etoile hotel is located two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe (CDG metro stop) and two blocks from the Air France bus stop. We rode the Air France bus to and from the airport and this was the best transfer into Paris we've ever had! This is our fifth trip to Paris and I will never stay anywhere else, but this hotel! The rooms were kept immaculately, however, we never saw any noisy or intruding housekeeping staff. The rooms were a bit small, but we didn't feel cramped, either. The bathrooms were very modern with good water pressure and amenities. We had made all our entertainment arrangements before we left, so we didn't need advice from the hotel staff. They were always very happy when we did visit with them and kept our keys safely in their care while we were away from the hotel. There is a McDonalds on the corner, the Chinese restaurant across the street was very good and if you really want to splurge ($300-$1600) for dinner, the Guy Savoy is just down the street!! We walked to nearly everything from the Champ d'Elysses to the Eiffel Tower. The city is beautiful and the French people are friendly and helpful. We loved our trip!! Thanks, Royal Magda!!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2travel101
Reviews.Content: Felt we made a good choice based upon the reviews of other Trip Advisor users. Very clean, cozy boutique hotel in a great location in Paris. Excellent value. Went to Paris to celebrate my 50th B-Day and the hotel had a nice card and champagne waiting for us on arrival. They made our reservations for our Eifel Tower dinner and we had a marvelous table. Rooms are small but that is not unusual for Paris Hotels (or so I'm told). Would stay there again anytime. Only down side would be noise from inside the hotel (hallways/ajoining rooms) and a really small bathtub (if you're over 5 foot tall).

Reviews.Title: “first rate all around”
Reviews.Author: george4209
Reviews.Content: location, location, location..but that is not all; friendly and helpful staff, clean room...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing crew!”
Reviews.Author: Alonym
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel on our honeymoon. On arrival the crew gave us a present, a cool champagne waiting in the room. The room was extremely clean every day. There was almost no noise from the street outside once we closed the windows. The location is so convenient, close to the metro, ans a walk distance from a lot of great places. And finely, every one on the crew was so nice to us. They answered all of our questions and helped us with every thing we needed! Thank you for having us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel, just too noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyngeorge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - right beside Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and CDG etoile metro. The hotel cannot be faulted for cleanliness and customer service. We arrived late on a Saturday and were given a room on the first floor facing the street. There are many bars and restaurants in the area and the the noise from outside was just too loud for me, I didn't sleep a wink that night. We asked for another room the following morning and were given a room on the sixth floor which was much appreciated. All we had to do was pack our luggage and they moved it for us when the room was ready. It was a slightly bigger room and I got a full night sleep. For any other light sleepers I would highly recommend requesting a room on the 4th-6th floor. The metro/train system is the best way to get around the city. It is very easy to manage once you have a tourist map with the city streets and metro lines. Buy an all day ticket for €8.80 and use to your hearts content! There are a couple of lovely Italian restaurants on the Champs Elysees that are reasonably priced and I would highly recommend a steak house called the Hippopotamus which is a two minute walk from the hotel. Cross the road at McDonalds and just walk down the street ( away from the Arc De Triomphe ) and its on the corner, you can't miss it. The profiterole dessert is heaven!!! I would recommend the hotel for location and price, but only if you get a room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda Staff and location ~ a very pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: artgyrlsacramento
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel, seconds from the Arc d'Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. Yohan and Kais were fabulous and so very helpful with directions, taxi calls and restaurant suggestions. The hotel is very quiet considering the location to major sites. Would definitely recommend this hotel! Merci, Merci Royal Magda staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Fab Find”
Reviews.Author: LVuitton09
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel!!! After staying in major "chain" hotels in Paris the last couple of times I went to Paris, I found the Hotel Royal Madga to be a great value with friendly staff and a great location. While the rooms are not huge and it can be a bit noisy, the Junior Suite we had comfortably accommodated 3 and was larger than expected. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel also has a special with Restaurant Guy Savoy that is not advertised so ask them about it. Great times!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Really Clean...Helpful Staff...just a little bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: neilcal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while we toook part in the Paris Marathon. We were impressed by the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. They are both tiny, but this is no more than I would expect from a Paris hotel, particularly one so close to the Arc. The soundproofing from street noise is great, and even though there is a restaurant and club in the street you don't hear any noise. There is very little soundproofing in the rooms though, you could hear other guests moving around and even snoring, and even...but again, pretty standard for Parisian hotels. Breakfast was pretty basic, but on the day of the race they got up early and did a special runners' breakfast that was great. The location is perfect, a very short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee, and the Metro is on a good line for all the main sites and other connections. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby and a little supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: clifford_david
Reviews.Content: A whole group of us were recommended this hotel as an ideal base for the Paris Marathon and it certainly lived up to its reputation. The rooms facing onto the small courtyard were very quiet and the bathrooms were clean and airy. The real pluses were: - the location was ideal; literally a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe and with good restarants and bars a short walk away; - the staff were so friendly, polite and helpful; small touches like printing out the times from the marathon for individual runners and offering specific food requests for the very early breakfast on the day of the marathon. This shows an attention to detail and understanding what their customers want and conducted in a friendly and pleasant manner. A smile goes a long way... I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda is still a great value”
Reviews.Author: RBB-7
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days at the Royal Magda Etiole. Our last stay was in 2007. We are happy to report that the place is still spotlessly clean and the staff is still great. We stayed 4 nights in a junior suite and one in a double. Both rooms were fine. We preferred the junior suite because there was more room and the bath was a bit bigger (50 euros more). Those that need a super quiet night should request an interior room (all junior suites face the interior away from the street). Our double room faced the street and we actually liked being able to look down at the activity. We didn't find it noisy but there are cafes and pubs nearby that might bother some with a low tolerance for Paris street noise. We like the area because it is safe and very close to a taxi stand. Our flight came in at 6AM and we were in the hotel (exhausted) by 7:30. The staff jumped through hoops to get us in a room as soon as they could. We were comfortably in by 9:30. That doesn't happen in other hotels very often. It is a good little comfortable hotel that we love. When we were ready to leave they helped us contact our airline and printed out our boarding passes - very nice. Don't be afraid to book the room yourself. Call and ask to speak with Yohan. You will get the best price. We'll stay again and hopefully it will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, charming place”
Reviews.Author: MrKNewYork
Reviews.Content: A quick anecdote that might work better than a review: my wife and I stayed two nights, then went to Burgundy and returned again for another three night stay. During the first stay, our bed was beautiful and comfortable. The second stay, the gave us a different room, with a mattress hard as a rock. I went down to the front desk and asked them to change the whole bed. To my amazement, they did just that. That's 5 star service at a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: kasra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and guys trust me when I say it was the best hotel ever.Very friendly staff and very clean rooms.well ofcourse the rooms are not big with huge space but get real it's paris.but with the money you pay it you will get what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rhu-dBoy
Reviews.Content: Fanastic Hotel - stayed here for Valentines weekend, and it was ideal. Service was very friendly. Room was great - we booked a superior/club double but were upgraded to a junior suite, which was very spacious, clean, quiet and very comfortable. The hotel is located close to the Metro Station, and within a couple of minutes walk of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, no doubts, but slightly overrated”
Reviews.Author: laserkid
Reviews.Content: I have spent two nights in this hotel in February. I have booked the single standard rooms, which were, as usualy in Paris very small and unfortunately slightly noisy as well./ elevator /. The location is realy perfect. It is difficult even to dream about better one. 200 meters to the metro station and to the Etoille. On the Troyon street there is light traffic, which improves also the comfort of staying there. Buffet breakfast is quite good, like for the French standards and, what is exceptional - good English speaking staff, friendly and helpfull. Summarizing, the decent 3 stars hotel, where you feel well. Because of excellent location, you can accept even not the lowest internet price for single standard - around 120 €.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSFBOSTON
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for three nights in a junior suite with my husband and daughter. The hotel was incredibly clean and the staff most helpful. It is in a great location and we took the Metro or walked to most places. The room was small but the bathroom was large and modern. We did not have the breakfast in the hotel but had breakfast at the corner bakery where the croissants were delicious. I highly recommend this hotel and would surely go back. My daughter is a student at the Hotel School at Cornell University and usually asks for the linens to be changed whenever we travel...but at this hotel she went right to sleep! No problem! And that is from a "hotelie"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2148
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a stay at the Royal Magda, I felt compelled to write a review straight away. The location, as others have commented, was excellent. 3 minutes from front door to the metro station at Arc de Triomphe, easy walking distance to Champs elysees. We also walked to Les Invalides, Eiffel tower, Concorde, the Louvre and Notre Dame as the weather was so good. There are many eating places nearby - a little place for croissants/coffee in the mornings on Ave Wagram (Croissanerie or something similar...); and especially a cheap (for Paris) buffet restaurant at the end of the street (Monte Carlo I think) which did starter or dessert; main meal/potatoes/veg and a (canned) drink for 10.20 euros. If you sit in the window area you can even see the Eiffel tower lit up! We also tried the chinese (opposite the hotel) which was very good - thou quiet -and the "Indiana" which did half price drinks for "happy hour" from 5pm til 8pm. (down Ave Wagram and turn right) The hotel staff were unfailingly helpful and the room kept clean. The hotel breakfast was plentiful, but we only ate there once as we went out instead for croissant/large coffee for 3 euros. You could also get similar on the Champs Elysees for similar price. Many thanks yet again to "tripadvisor" for helping us find such a lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: shorenj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris and had a great stay at the Royal Magda Etoile hotel. We are a family with 2 small children and booked the Suite Deluxe. The room looked exactly like the pictures online and was nice and clean. Maybe not the fanciest room, but it had everything we needed and was a real Paris experience!! You can't beat the location near l'Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Easy metro stop just a block away. The staff speaks excellent English and was very helpful during our stay. Great choice for a budget friendly Paris hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want central and clean and friendly you wont beat this”
Reviews.Author: PAULKILI
Reviews.Content: Like every one else I'd read the reviews and wasn't quite sure what to expect. What we got was a hotel right in the heart of paris and if you don't know Paris this is definatly the area you want to be in, cleaner and more affluent area. The hotel staff were more than friendly and helpful. Yes the rooms are small but lets be honest you only sleep there as you should be out exploring every day. The hotel does get a little noisy in the mornings but it is merely people coming and going from their rooms, you make the same noise yourself. If your in a lazy mod go out the front doorturn right and go to the 1st chinese on the opposite side of the street, it aint flash but the food is gorgous

Reviews.Title: “The right choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 14-year-old daughter and I have just come back from a week-long trip to Paris. We stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile, which I picked based on reviews I had read on tripadvisor.com. I am so glad I picked this hotel. The Royal Magda Etoile is the hotel for the traveler who demands a clean, comfortable, reasonably-priced no frills boutique hotel conveniently located in a charming, quiet neighborhood in the 17th arrondissment, within a five-minute walk to a Metro station, the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs E'lysees. The Royal Madga's staff is friendly and helpful, and they speak perfect English. My family and I had been to Paris a couple of times before this most recent trip, and we stayed then at chain hotels, which were okay, but they did not provide the authentic European experience that the Royal Magda Etoile offers. I say spend your money on expensive, luxurious French restaurants, trendy Parisian fashion, and the enjoyable Moulin Rouge, but save money by staying at the Royal Magda Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: mayomayomayo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our valentines weekend and were very happy with the hotel. The breakfast was continental but still very nice, fresh and the food was plentiful! It is very near to the metro which was great and practically right beside the arc de triomphe. The room was fine it looked exactly as it was shown on the site which does not normally happen! bathroom and shower were perfect. The staff were the best thing about our stay as they helped us a great deal. We found it very difficult to get any help or directions from the natives with the language barrier but every member of the staff helped us with directions, places to eat etc... which was such a relief! I would recommend to anyone to stay here as it is important to be happy where you are staying in order to enjoy your trip... and it was not expensive. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very nice location.”
Reviews.Author: tulanian
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Royal Magda Etoile. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the small side, but this is pretty common in our experience with European hotels. The bathroom was very roomy, though, and the water pressure was fantastic. The bed was a bit hard for our taste, but nice and flat and not lumpy. Everything was clean, especially the bathroom. We ordered the €12/person breakfast in our room one morning and it was typically continental but high quality. There's a croissant shop about 2 minutes away, so acquiring breakfast is no problem. The hotel is across the street from one of the best restaurants in the world, the 3-Michelin-star Guy Savoy. We dined there and it was an amazing experience. The location is very convenient to the Metro, the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees. Overall, a very nice hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would return here”
Reviews.Author: magda09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Magda for weekend break in January. Hotel itself was lovely and very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Got upgraded on arrival which was great. Lift was really SMALL but funny! Nearest metro stop was Charles de Gaulle Etoile which was a very central stop to get around anywhere. A McDonalds was on corner of street - very handy for take out coffee. Access to hotel was supposed to be open all night but on first night we got back really late and took a while to get answer from night porter - (must have been asleep) I don't think he was too impressed with us - then again we were really late!! It is very easy to get to from the airport with a range of options. I would stay here again and definately have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandDawson
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Rooms are very clean (we were upgraded on arrival to a suite). Check in staff very friendly and helpful. Check out time slightly later than normal at 12:00 and breakfast avail from 07:00 to 12:00. Continental breakfast again a high standard and good choice avail. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location less than 200 metres from Arc de Triumphe”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights including New Year's Eve 2008. This is a typical Parisian hotel with compact rooms (and even more compact lift!) but what made the difference for us was the staff were always prepared to help. We hadn't booked a restaurant to eat at on 1 January and the staff found out an excellent local restaurant for our final meal in Paris. On New Year's Eve the restaurant kindly provided a box of chocolates for each room! We had a standard double room on one of the upper floors which consisted of a double bed, small wardrobe, small desk and a flat screen TV. The compact bathroom had a shower (no bath which didn't bother us) and was very clean. The only downside I had with the hotel was the soundproofing between the rooms wasn't great. If we were to go back to Paris we would definately stay here again due it's excellent location and good value for money. If anyone is thinking of going to Paris at New Year it is a great city at this time of year but be warned that all the sights are as busy as ever and book your restaurant for New Year's well in advance! We had an absolutely fantastic New Year's in Findi restaurant on Avenue George V which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuskerton
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a good location, at a good price. The room clean and well maintained, but wasn't too big, though was what I expected for a place a this price in central Paris. The staff members were always friendly and spoke English, which was a big plus, and we were close to the metro and the Air France Bus to and from CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: kevafc1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my girlfriend, on the recommendations of the trip advisor website and was not dissapointed. We were delighted to find on arrival we had been up-graded to a Junior Suite, and were extremley pleased with the spacious room. Having worked in the hospitality industry I am always overly critical of hotels (to the annoyance of my girldfirend) but the standards of cleanliness in the room were faultless. The staff were extremley friendly, with the reciptionist booking a table at a local restaurant as they did not speak English. The breakfast was also top notch, providing a non-fuss high quality buffett. Location was also extremly convient, as it was away from the more central hustle and bustle of Paris city centre so quiet at nights and being within walking distance of the metro which provided easy access to the Effiel Tower and Louvre. I would fully recomend this hotel to couples looking for a quiet get-away. I would like to thank all the staff and management for their hospitality during our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Jaypsea
Reviews.Content: Unless you're blessed with an exceptionally large wallet you shouldn't go to Paris and expect very large, modern and quiet hotel rooms in the 'right area'. The Royal Magda is no exception to this rule, however, it's very clean with pleasant atmosphere, but most importantly, it is a 5 minute walk from the Air France airport shuttle bus stop and even less from the Arc and Charles de Gaulle Etoile, the get you any where Metro and RER station at the top of the Champs Elysees. For the money you can't go wrong. Even breakfast at €12 per head is good value by Parisian standards and if you take your time and enjoy a long breakfast you'll last until you savour the delights of the latin quarter in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: Shintybhoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Royal Magda in June and was more than happy with our choice. Checking in was quick, easy and very friendly. Our room was on the fist floor facing the front and was spotless with a great ensuite shower room. Had no problems at all with noise from within the hotel, the only night we were distrurbed was on the Friday with people on the street, could have happened anywhere. The location of the hotel is brilliant, close to the Metro and the bus back to the airport. All the major tourist attractions were within walking distance is you like a good walk like us, its a good way to get a feel of the city. Would definately recommend this hotel, we went to celebrate a 40th birthday and was a bit unsure due to the low star rating. Having read the TripAdvisor reports we took the chance and are very very happy that we did! Hard to believe you were not in a 5 * Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SenicGorge
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda Etoile Hotel was a perfect gem of a spot to stay for a trip to Paris. This was our first trip abroad and could not have had a better experience. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. We had a junior suite for a family of 3 and it was a bit smaller than anticipated but very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect due to its access to the Metro and RER line. We absolutely loved it and will stay there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “More Than A 3 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capital06
Reviews.Content: It was a restful holiday for me and my family. Very charming hotel, excellent location, sparkling, well service, friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel Magda Royal has cared every details to comfort the guests. For example drying line on the bath tube, polishing footwear tissue, many plug contacts and lightnings in the room, maybe minor details but important. So very convenient hotel. Balance of cost-quality is good. Very easy to access metro, RER, bus, taxi and Air France Coaches. And you can find many tasty French foods, famed cafes and Michelin star's restaurants. Etoile is a little bit expensive area but it deserves. I recommend all the people who likes quality and colorful areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: garethellis36
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed 3 nights at the Royal Magda Etoile this past weekend, and it was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had - possible *the* best. Upon arrival into the beautifully appointed lobby area, we were greeted by a charming and friendly receptionist. This theme continued throughout our stay, and the male receptionist who was on late at night was especially helpful - he helped us find a restaurant and then checked us in for our flight home on his computer. What service! Our room was small and cosy, but we were not in Paris to sit around in a hotel anyway, so it was ideal. The decor was modern, the room clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was a decent size, and was also very clean. The shower was worth particulate mention, as it was very powerful and the water was very hot. Breakfast was expensive at €12 for a simple buffet, so we didn't sample that - there are plenty of cafes and other places to get a bite nearby. The location in general is excellent, being just a short walk from the Charles de Gaulle-Etoile Metro & RER station, which is under the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is down a quiet side street off Ave de Wagram, so there is little road noise and what little noise there is outside is kept out by the double-glazed windows. One local tip we would give is to try the bistro "Le Hide" (www.lehide.fr) just around the corner on Rue du General Lanrezac. We had 2 courses each and 50cl of vin blanc for €66, and it was one of the best meals we've had. Like the hotel, the bistro is something of a hidden gem. In summary, we would not hesitate to recommend this charming little hotel to anyone who is looking for a good base for a break in Paris. We are very happy customers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: WanderingClown
Reviews.Content: Booking a hotel in Paris for me, my daughter (8), my Father and his son (11) was almost overwhelming - we could have stayed at something more expensive but might have missed the charm of Paris. What we were looking for was something reasonably priced, but as we were only there from Friday to Monday was ideally located for the sights, open top tour bus stop, easy eats, and offered a straightforward way of getting to Disneyland Paris and Gare du Nord. This hotel ticked all the boxes. Just a hundred or so yards from an exit of Charles de Gaulles Etoile station this provided us with a minimum of fuss at the start and end of our days. (Buy a Paris Visite ticket before you go to give you full access to central Paris transport). Booking directly with the hotel via e-mail was so easy - immediate replies to questions and to the booking. When we arrived it was obvious why - there was always a member of staff around the reception desk ready to say hello or to wish you a nice day, or to answer any questions you might have. One thing stuck in my mind - a small thing perhaps, but underlined the care that the staff of this small hotel takes. All tables were busy for breakfast one morning, so we waited around the corner in the reception area. Every couple of minutes the receptionist popped round to check if a table had become free, until shortly they showed us to a free table. This attention really makes a difference - we felt welcome throughout our stay. The hotel is situated near the Champs Elysees and a couple of hundred yards away from the Arc de Triomphe. Walk 50 yards up the street and you can see the Arc and the Eiffel Tower sits in the distance. Open top bus tours (we went for L'Open Tour and weren't disappointed) stop within a few hundred yards. Disneyland Paris is 45 minutes away on the RER that runs directly from Charles de Gaulle Etoile station, so catch that 1 hour before park opening and you'll be knocking on the door of the park at just the right time. Be aware that you will need to ensure you have tickets for the right zones to get to Disney. We bought 1-3 Paris Visite tickets and separate tickets to get to Disney. (We used www.allofrance.co.uk for our tickets so that we didn't waste time when we got there). The rooms we stayed in were small but clean. I was particularly pleased with the bathroom. During our stay I didn't once find anything I could fault regarding the cleanliness. Breakfast, as already mentioned, was simple and at €12 a little expensive but spend a little time over your muesli and yoghurt, croissants, bread, cheese and meats, fruit and coffees while deciding on your plan for the day and it was wholly worthwhile. Across the side street was a sandwich shop that made sandwiches and salads to order, and McDonalds was 50 yards away from the hotel - one night we took it back to our room as we didn't have the energy to dine out. The Italian restaurant at the end of the road and across the street was very good, and because of the location there were many other eateries to choose from. All in all, I left with the satisfaction that I had managed to pick out a winning hotel from the many, many hotels on offer in Paris. Suffice to say that a similar trip in years to come will be much easier as I'll simply book again! And if friends want to visit Paris, I'll be confident in recommending this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For?”
Reviews.Author: Baldy72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days in October 2008 to celebrate our Golden Wedding and it was the best experience, hotel-wise, we have ever had. When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite as we were there for our honeymoon (couldn't afford one 50 years ago) and when we arrived in our suite the hotel management had put red roses and champagne there for us, at their own expense. The location of this hotel is second to none with a 2 minute (and I really do mean 2 minutes) walk to the Arc de Triomphe, metro station, shops, restaurants etc. Every member of staff we encountered during our stay was very helpful and went out of their way to help us. I couldn't recommend this establishment enough and, god willing, we will be back to visit Paris and wouldnt consider staying anywhere other than the Royal Magda. Absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “A secret I would like to keep to myself”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaLima
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magda for 8 nights last October with my husband and two daughters (9 and 4). We booked a Suite and it was very comfortable, with two separate rooms and one bathroom. The hotel was simply everything I’ve been reading around here: absolutely clean, renovated rooms, friendly staff and very convenient location. But there were some other small surprises. 1) They didn’t charge our kids breakfast - thank you! 2) The maid really cleaned the room, because she was always leaving lost toys on our beds. 3) We didn’t hear any noise (maybe because our room faced the internal area). I would love to go back to Royal Magda Etoile any time. Around the hotel: Monoprix(supermarket) – 25, av des Ternes (between Mac-Mahon and rue Poncelet). The supermarket is downstairs, inside the store. Rue Poncelet and rue Bayen(food stores) – there are plenty of cheese, wine and bread small stores just three minutes from the hotel. We loved buying picnic supplies there. Cesar (Italian restaurant) – av de Wagran. Great food. Not to be missed. Chez Clement (traditional French) – 47, av de Wagran. Great food. Children menu for €8,50. Hippopotamus (steak) – 46, av de Wagran. Good. Children menu for €7,90.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about Royal Magda!!”
Reviews.Author: joey315
Reviews.Content: My sister, her husband and myself stayed in Paris for 4 nights from 13th July. We had a triple room at this wonderful Hotel. The room was big enough for us. It was comfortable, clean, and the staff very friendly and accomodating. Location could not have been better!! 2minute walk to Arc de Triumph, Metro same distance and champs elysees. Paris was a great city to explore, and after an exhausting day sightseeing, the Royal Magda Etoile was the perfect place to rest and revive. I sent numerous emails prior to arrival requesting info on various things,and requests to organise dinner reservations. ALL emails were answered quickly and eficiently, and nothing was too much effort!!! Congratulations to all staff. Thank you for helping make our visit to your city of paris a happy and memorable one. Charlotte

Reviews.Title: “Wee gem!”
Reviews.Author: theneills
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris several times and this hotel is a real discovery. It's in a perfect position, 3 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe, Metro/RER (Etoile) and the express bus from Charles de Gaulle Airport. It's also only a short walk from the Porte de Maillot where the bus from Beauvais Airport (Ryanair Wizz etc) gets in to Paris. The hotel is beautifully decorated, absolutely spotless and very quiet (open the windows to appreciate how good they are at sound-deadening). The price is extremely reasonable for the position: it isn't cheap compared to some hotels but the latter will be out of the centre and perhaps in what might appear to be an unsafe area. All things considered, the Magda Etoile is a real bargain. But we've left the best until last: the staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful. We had no problems with anything therefore had relatively few dealings with them, but they were always extremely friendly and welcoming. Breakfast isn't included in the room price but serves the best cup of tea in Paris (and believe us we've had some horrors in other hotels). Criticisms? The lift is small and the rooms are smaller than USA size, but you need to remember that you're in a renovated old building in the centre of Paris so rooms can't be enormous if they are to have an en-suite. They are perfectly adequate and the beds are large and comfortable. The wall-mounted flat-screen TV is good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: It was a no-problem stay at the Magda Etoile. The room is not huge but I didn't mind it. The staff is especially helpful and friendly. One big drawback is that the walls are very thin, so you can basically hear everything from within the hotel and corridor. The road the hotel is in looks very quiet so at least there is no road traffic you can hear. Conveniently located 5 minutes walk from the Charles de Gaulle Etoile station, it was one of the best priced hotels still being within reasonable distance from central Paris. There's a closeby shuttle bus service to reach Orly and Charles de Gaulle airports (14 euro one way), stopping in fron of the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Anniversary_Tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile in late September 2008 with my husband and 4 y.o. daughter. Everything was absolutely perfect, and I could not speak more highly of this charming hotel with the friendly staff who went out of their way to help us when our stroller was lost en route .. by finding us another one so that we were not "hotel bound" when we had a fairly exhaustive tour of Paris mapped out and really needed the wheels to be able to do it. They assisted with trains and timetables and were just so lovely. We were absolutely delighted with the lovely room, spacious, clean and quiet. Absolutely the best!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jdbeckers
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Royal Magda last minute after looking for many hotels that were booked, and we were happy to just get a decent hotel. We were surprised when we walked in at how chic everything was! When we walked into our room we were very impressed at how clean and fresh everything was. The Royal Magda is located in the heart of Paris, just a couple of blocks from the Arch of Triumph, Metro, Restaurants, and the best shopping! The hotel staff is very friendly and speaks good English so communication was no problem. Check out time was at 12:00pm but that was no problem. The reception gladly held our luggage for us until we were ready to come pick it up later in the day so we could make the most out of our time in Paris without having to carry our backpacks around. I highly recommend this hotel, I have stayed in several hotels in Paris and this was just the best ever! It definitely deserves the high ratings it's getting! **The Royal Magda Etoile also has another hotel called 'Acacias Etoile' and the desk clerk told me that it was the same style and class as this one, so if the Magda is booked maybe give that one a try.

Reviews.Title: “lovely with great location”
Reviews.Author: susanmarieelizabeth
Reviews.Content: wonderful location, felt safe with my teenage daughter, quiet, clean, comfortable bed. Lili at front desk was wonderful as were all the gentlemen at the desk. lots of little places to eat near.

Reviews.Title: “Grfeat Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bos2677
Reviews.Content: Great location only steps from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. Being 3 people we took the junior suite which was a large room with a queen bed and a full size sofa sleeper. The bathroom was large and unique, with the commode in a separate small room which was convenient. The room was very clean and made up every day. They also had real plush terry towels in the bath which we liked. They provided free wired high-speed internet access in the room which worked great. The breakfast was not included and was 12 Euros per person but if you go outside you will not find a better breakfast cheaper. I commend the hotel on their honesty. We went out one day and accidentally left the in-room-safe unlocked. When we returned we had a note of the new code programmed by the staff and everything was in order. The front desk was very helpful with recommendations of eating places and ways to get where we wanted to go. I can easily recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelbwilts
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this excellent small hotel. Located an easy 3 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe. The room & bathroom were on the small side but adequate. The staff were very helpful and polite with good knowledge of the locality & Paris in general. As we could not find a Post Office to buy stamps I left them with money for stamps & our postcards which they very kindly posted for us. The breakfasts in the room although not cheap were very good. Standard of decor & cleanliness second to none. We would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdnm8183
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of our trip and since we were flying out of Paris again decided to rebook when we returned we loved it so much. The location of the hotel is wonderful just near the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. That being said the hotel itself is in a quite street that does not have a lot of traffic that could cause noise. The staff were lovely and were always very helpful. We arrived and upgraded both times, so the room we had was on the 5th floor and amazing. There was so much space, very clean and well planned out. We thought the hotel was just wonderful and were very happy to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: imrobyn
Reviews.Content: I always use trip advisor now due to the honesty and different points of view, and this hotel is an example of how this has worked for me. The details that others gave about the location were not exaggerated. It was located close to major attractions, the metro, taxi stops and the red bus tour stop. There were also many places to eat and shop close by. The best part of this hotel, however, was the customer service. The front desk personnel just couldn’t be friendlier or more helpful. They made us feel welcome and when we ran in from the rain they were always there to hand us our room key with a warm greeting and ask about our day. (I normally don’t mind if the desk people are super friendly or not, but in a foreign country it always feels good to have someone greet you warmly in any language.) The hotel was old-fashioned, but extremely well maintained with modern necessities. Every need we had was met. Something important to me, which was a nice surprise, was the fact that the bedroom had a door separating it from the front room (which had a comfy fold out queen bed). I was able to relax and watch CNN while my teenagers relaxed and watched what they wanted in their room as we unwound after a day of sight-seeing. The bathroom was also extremely upgraded and large. The breakfast was typical continental fare (yummy variety of cheeses and baguettes), which they gave the option to have as room service if we wanted. I would stay here because of the hotel alone, but the customer service was a bonus, and it helped to make our stay even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MiniMimi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a great location in Paris! 2 min walk to Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and the metro which will take you anywhere in the city. Helpful and friendly staff. Small, but very nice decorated rooms. 12 euro optional breakfast didn't have the widest selection, but it was all fresh and more than enough to give you a good start on the day. A good value hotel and highly recommendable! If you get tired of entrecote, fries and rude french waiters - the Cesar restaurant in Wagram Av. is a great choice. They served great italian food for reasonable prices with a smile :)

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kimd186
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended that I use Trip Advisor to search online for hotels and I'm so glad I did.My original booking for a Paris hotel showed a dismal rating so when this gem of a hotel showed up I booked it straight away. The hotel was so clean,comfortable and quiet and I would definitely stay there again if I visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Neanne
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Not fancy, but neat, clean and very well located, with a pleasant English-speaking staff, located about 2 1/2 blocks from the Avenue de Wagram exit at L’Etoile. Well located for Metro access. There is a lift, room safe, comfortable beds, telephones, mini bar and TV (though actually we had two TV’s since we’d opted for a junior suite which offered an extremely comfortable sofa bed in a separate room.) A bit plain wrap with regard to décor, also not terribly generous with regard to drawer or wardrobe space this is nonetheless a pleasant, quiet and very comfortable headquarters for touring this fair city. Though a daily buffet breakfast is offered for an additional 12 euros per person, there is a good bakery about a block and a half from the hotel and a market as well, so you can enjoy a freshly baked croissant, juice and yogurt for a fraction of the cost. Taxi to Charles DeGaulle was less than 40 euros; hotel is easily accessed via metro from Montparnasse Station via Line 6 in the direction of Charles deGaulle-Etoile, exit 4 (Ave Wagram ) or by taxi we’re told it’s about 15 euros. Next time we're in Paris, I know where we'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chucklers
Reviews.Content: I had previously booked the Magda for my Mother & Father's 40th anniversary the year before. Their stay was a joy! I had also recommended it to a work colleague who stayed there in July 07 and had a great time. Therefore it wasn't difficult to work out where the Chucklers were staying on their Paris trip!!! We got the bus from the airport which dropped off at the 'Arc' - a few minutes walk and we were at the hotel. A very pleasant check in and we were in our room, which was right beside reception on the ground floor. Plenty of space and well decorated - we didn't hear a peep from outside! We chose to eat breakfast out every morning so cannot offer any comment on it. The staff at reception were extremely pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. Soukri was an absolute star - he looked after us big time throughout our stay - a total gentleman! There are plenty of places to eat nearby - the Chinese restaurant across the street was excellent! Paris has so much to offer and the metro is so close to the hotel!!Use it! All in all, a great stay - would thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask For More”
Reviews.Author: lynsayk
Reviews.Content: I took my daughters to Paris and we were lucky enough to stay at the Royal Magda Hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were very pleasant and helpful. We couldn't have asked for more. They organised a birthday cake (at my request) and decorated our room with balloons as a surprise for my daughters 16th birthday.. Our room was spotless. It was an adequate size for us. This hotel is a 2 minute walk, and I really do mean a 2 minute walk, from the Arc de Triomphe and is ideally situated for restaurants and other amenities. My only regret is that we only had 2 days in Paris and it's not long enough to spend in this magnificent city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Supratik
Reviews.Content: I always pay more attention to comments from fellow travellers rather than the "guide books" and I am glad to say that this time also I did not regret my decision. Direct booking was easy, e-mails answered promptly. Stayed in room 311, an apartment suite with two adjoining rooms (one with a sofabed) with plenty of room for my daughters (8 & 3 years) to jump around. Separate TV for them as well !! Rooms smallish by North American standard but excellent by Paris standard !! Furnishing simple but adequate. Bed very comfortable. Nice spacious bathroom with good water pressure. No tea/coffee in room but they provided us with a kettle. Minibar expensive as usual. We kept milk in the fridge for our children and no one objected. Location is superb. It took us 20 minutes and 13 euros by taxi from Gare-du-Nord, travelling on a Saturday afternoon. CDG Etoile is 5 minutes walk. 47 minutes to Disneyland by RER. Jardin d'Acclimatation was just 20 minutes walk and we had much more fun there compared to the sugar coated commercialism of Disneyland. Strongly recommended if you have young children. Breakfast slightly pricey and we ate for first two days only. Plenty of eateries within easy reach including McDonald, Quick and Hippopotamus . There is a branch of Monoprix supermarket very close for grocery and other stuff. All the staff were very friendly with special thanks to Aurelle and Yohann. My only gripe is that soundproofing is less than satisfactory and on the first night my sleep was badly affected by 2 little girls running in the corridoor between 2 rooms. This restarted again next night around midnight and this time I had to speak to their guardians politely but firmly and thankfully it stopped. The familes moved away subsequently and I had reasonably peaceful nights afterwards although we could hear our upstairs neighbours from time to time. On the whole a very satisfying experience and I won't hesitate to recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough to be happy in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dianadMontreal
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet, well located hotel to stay in Paris. The staff was very professional. We would go back there any time. Our best regards to all in Royal Magda Etoile Hotel Diana and Jerzy from Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Enjoyed our stay at Royal Magda Etoile Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: td1208
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for our Paris vacation, based on tripadvisor reviews. We were very pleased with our 6-night stay at Royal Magda Etoile Hotel during the last week of June. Sidebar: We took the Air France bus shuttle from Charles de Gaulle Airport to Arc de Triomphe. Extremely rough baggage handling by Air France shuttle bus staff, resulted in the zipper of our suitcase being badly damaged, despite the suitcase being in perfect condition after overnight travel from Toronto, Canada, to Paris, with stopovers in Montreal, Munich and Rome, on various airlines. This damage rendered the suitcase not being able to be properly closed, as the slider was completely removed from the teeth of zipper. While this may not seem like the end of the world to readers, this was not a good start to our trip, given that we were traveling elsewhere in Europe, the week following. The hotel is a very short walk from Air France bus shuttle stop. We were greeted at reception desk by Yohan, who was very helpful. Upon learning about our misfortune, he summoned help to repair the zipper on our suitcase. Sassy (hotel maintenance) immediately repaired the zipper, in the area right beside the lobby. One would never have known that it was ever broken. When offered a small token of our appreciation, Sassy very graciously declined, saying it was his pleasure to help. The hotel’s owner, Mr. Destouches, happened to be in the lobby at the time, so we made sure that Sassy’s service was duly recognized. Upon our insistence, Sassy very reluctantly accepted our envelope. As well, I had brought my laptop on our trip. Without hesitation, Yohan offered to lend an Internet cable and voltage converter for our entire stay. From the time of our arrival at the hotel, to after check-in, the staff at this hotel, turned our unfortunate start (though not related to the hotel whatsoever), into a positive. For this, we were thankful. Other staff (Juliet, head housekeeper) was helpful. Soukri, at reception in evening, always welcomed us with a warm smile and conversation at the end of our busy day. The location of this hotel is ideal. Everything is within a very short walking distance - Metro station, from which one can travel virtually everywhere in Paris; Arc de Triomphe; restaurants; cafés; retail, convenience and grocery stores; and coin laundry (thanks for the local map and directions, Yohan). Our room was small (which we knew beforehand from reading reviews), but a great value. It was tastefully decorated and modern, in very good condition, very clean, and air conditioning worked. Our bed was comfortable. The desk allowed for use of our laptop, and free in-room Internet connection worked perfectly. We bought an international phone card externally, and used the in room phone, which worked well to make calls to Canada. We made good use of in-room safe, as well. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to those traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just as we expected”
Reviews.Author: travelerLondonON
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 (2 grandparents, 2 adults, 2 children) stayed here in early July for 5 nights. We had 2 rooms. One was a "club" room for 2, and the second room was a "Suite" for 4, which had a separate bedroom and a livingroom with a pull out sofa. The suite had less streat noise. I believe that all the suites face the rear courtyard which is quiter. The hotel and rooms were very clean and nicely renovated. The bathrooms were very nice. There is a small elevator to bring up the suitcases when checking in or checking out. Otherwise we used the stairs. As is common to most Paris hotels in this category, the walls are thin. We expected this and came prepared with earplugs. Without earplugs, we were able to hear people talking in other rooms and doors opening and closing in the hallways late into the night. With earplugs it was no problem at all. We definitely recommend bringing earplugs. The front desk staff were all very helpful and pleasant. They all spoke excellent english, and did not seem to mind speaking english instead of french. "Lily" was especially nice to us, and made us feel very welcome. She gave us good information regarding which restaurants in the area were good with children, and the location of grocery stores. She provided us with a kettle, cups, plates, and some utensils, so we were able to make instant coffee and tea in the rooms, and prepare snacks for the kids. They allowed us to use the fridge to hold our own drinks and food, rather than using it as a minibar. This made the hotel much more functional for us. We were able to bring in breakfast and save a lot of money. Instead we spent money on eating out for dinner. The location of the hotel was very good. It was a very close walk to Arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro Station (Wagram exit). It was also a very short walk to the Air France shuttle stop on Ave Carnot, which took us to CDG Airport at the end of our stay. You can take this shuttle irrespective of what airline you are flying with. The streets in the area seem pretty safe, although it is important to use common sense. We did see some homeless people on Ave de Wagram, as well as youth hanging out into the night. Pickpockets are present in most tourist areas, so consider using a money belt and avoid taking out your wallet on streets and metro. Overall, we were quite pleased with this hotel for our vacation in Paris. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: moebill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May of 2008 for 3 nights. It is an excellent location to metro, RER, and Air France bus stop from and to the airport. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. Good quality and value in rooms and very clean. We would definitely recommended this hotel and would stay here on a future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal visit!”
Reviews.Author: travel4free
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my family in one of their suites. Loved it! Great location- steps from the Arc de Triumph and metro, great service, nice size rooms, plus the air conditioned worked. 'Kais 'the night porter reconfirmed my airport shuttle and recommended some great restuarants. Our room was ready at 10 am. The service was amazing. 4 star service in a 3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: speed99
Reviews.Content: Got it on Tripadvisor. We opted for the larger room and it was worth it. We were in Paris in January. Great location. Clean rooms and bathroom. Our room had a good size room for Paris standards. We took the €12 breakfast. It was adequate and you could take as long as you liked and browse the english language newspapers. I rate it a superior type of B&B rather than a hotel. Good restaurants nearby and the metro station is about 100 metres away. But it it very quiet, which is great when you need to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, We were Happy.”
Reviews.Author: gtpatton
Reviews.Content: Our family of four; with one 15 year old daughter and one 11 year old daughter stayed for two nights. Of course rooms were small [Paris, city typical]. We had suite #411, 4th floor which consisted of two rooms and bathroom. The first living room was small and when couch folded out to bed it took up whole room, and bathroom was directly off this room, so noise could be heard from bathroom to people sleeping here. Also, hotel has "hard wired LAN connection in room" and "wireless" in lobby. So I could not get up early to surf internet/ do work as small desk where LAN was located was on side of daughters bed. Had to go to lobby. Breakfast was 12 euros extra, but McDonalds 50 meters away... but McDonalds does not open until 7:30 AM which is really 7:45 AM as workers move slowly here. To sum up room, although not spacious, it was clean and modern. The bathroom was modern. This is what we really wanted and we got- clean and modern. Yes the elevator only fits one person, so use the stairs. The biggest bonus is location! We were very happy with location. When I booked, I thought I would have to take my family to Latin quarter to show off cafe's, patisseries, and French street character... but no, the neighborhoods around Magda are great. One block from Arc-de-Triumph and can catch Metro anywhere from here. But one block in the other direction are trendy streets with cafe's and shops. My 15 year old was in and out of all, looking for a certain type of gladiator sandal that she saw all the girls wearing. For two nights, avoiding the big brand name hotels, this boutique hotel was just fine. Again, clean and modernized which we think are most important.

Reviews.Title: “Not as I had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: nevaway
Reviews.Content: After reading all the review of this hotel on Trip Advisor we decided to book. There were 9 of us in all. I was expecing more that we got. The hotel staff was pleasant and tried to be helpful. My room was on the 6th floor, and the bed was against the wall. My husband kept hitting his head getting in and out of bed. The room was also very hot. I ask if we could move, and the hotel did move us to the 1st floor. What a mistake. The last night we were there, a disco next door was playing music so loud I felt like I was sleeping in the middle of the club. Needless to say, I did not sleep at all. Having to get up and leave very early in the morning to catch a train to Bordeaux left me totally exhausted. They should not use that room!! It was a nightmare!! I left my camera in the room. I tried to contact the hotel to see if they found it, but have heard nothing back. I would call this a mediocre hotel at the most. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ClareVancouver
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed was the great location of this hotel. As mentioned in the other reviews, only a couple of minutes from the Arc De Triumphe. It is also a very short walk to the Metro which, in my opinion, is the fastest and most convenient way to get around Paris. The hotel itself is very tastefully decorated. As previously mentioned by other reviewers, the lift is tiny and a bit claustrophobic so only one person at once with the cases. I don't usually like to mention size of rooms, but this room was particularly small. Literally, just little big bigger than the bed and not much room for our two cases. As we were on the fifth floor, we had also had a balcony. The room and bathroom were very tasteful and clean. We also found the staff on reception to be very friendly and helpful with any requests we had. The breakfast was good if you go down to the foyer level to eat (it is buffet style). On one of the mornings, we ordered breakfast to the room and got a very small amount for the 12 Euros (same price as buffet). I would highy recommend this hotel for couples going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful:)”
Reviews.Author: kathrynat
Reviews.Content: My husband and extended family (12 ppl - 5 rooms total) stayed at the Royal Magda May 27-29th. We had 3 different types of rooms. The one that my husband and one of our 3 children (and the one that my mother and our other 2 children) stayed in was a really nice size room. I think it was a Jr. Suite. We didn't have a balcony but that was ok, the windows still opened up and was really "french":) The hotel is super clean. The staff was lovely:) I have to say I was getting worried because for some reason the ratings on here began to slip as we got closer to the date of our stay. I can't imagine anyone having a bad stay. It was in such a great location, the staff was wonderful and the room we stayed in was spacious and sooooo clean:) One of the nights we ate dinner at Chez Clement. Very very good place to eat and it wasn't far from our hotel at all. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. My husband went out on the mornings and got croissants and coffee for us at Paul's. Mmmmmmmm!!!! Yum:) Would definitely stay there again. We loved Paris. We were sad that our stay wasn't longer.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TommyJoan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely stay at the Royal Magda Etoile. Plus Points Location - superb, 2 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the same distance from the CDG Etoile Metro/RER station. Service - staff were very friendly without exception and happy to help with any queries or emergencies (lent us a large umberella for the tennis at Roland Garros!) Hotel - small but very clean, quality fixtures and fittings throughout. A relaxed, comfortable atmosphere. Room - despite concerns in other reviews, we found our room to be ideal in size. We paid slightly more for a Club room and were lucky to get one of the rooftop 'Mansard' rooms (only 2 and worth requesting) - plenty of room for two people of any size!! . Very Minor Negatives Noise - typically thin walls. When our next room neighbours Skyped back home to their Australian family/friends at 7am, we got the full story as well! Special Mention - we had lunch twice at a little cafe just off the Champs Elysees - less than 10 mins walk from the hotel. It was called Cafe Week-End (Rue de Washington). Well worth visiting, great food and service - a busy, lively little place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good”
Reviews.Author: j32063
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Royal Magda from May 8th-14th and was satisfied with my experience. As other reviews here state, it is a clean, modern, well-run place with cheerful, helpful staff.
