The location is good, with the Air France shuttles and Metro right around the corner, as well as several cafes nearby. The hotel is a good choice as long as you understand that in Paris, price tends to be determined by size. Your first clue to the dimensions of your room should be the elevator, which is big enough for one person plus a suitcase OR 2 people. There were 2 of us in our room...a standard double with shower...and we had to do some serious organizing of our things in order to have floor space to walk. Everything in the room is fine; the bed was decent, the bathroom was tiny but modern and clean, and there was a flat-screen TV and even a mini-bar. However, for most Americans, the size of the room is about what you would expect from a walk-in closet, so if you are a large person you may be in for some severe claustrophobia. I would consider staying here again, although it might be more interesting to try something else within the price range. I have been able to afford better in the past, but frankly for about twice the price I only got about 25% more space and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved the Hotel . Excellent !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jbrito
Reviews.Content: Jayme - Monaco Lovely Hotel , good location, excellent rooms and service. Very clean, good rooms and bathrooms. Very good taste on the decoration of rooms and lobby. Personell very friendly and helpfull. Great breakfast. A must in Paris if you an excellent hotel , with good location , good rooms, service with a good price. Jayme

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and tidy”
Reviews.Author: cmelBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the summer of 2007 with my girlfriend. Although, i'm mostly confirming what everyone else says in their reviews I thought i would add my comments. The location is excellent and although i'd read the reviews I was still pleasantly surprised at just how close it is to the L'Arc De Triomphe. It literally is 2 minutes walk, and thats if you take your time. The staff mostly stayed out of our way and although you could say they werent terribly helpful, when approached for advice or service they were actually very pleasant, and as with most parts of Paris, all I spoke to had very good English. Our room was nicely decorated and because it was on the top floor it was an odd shape with ceilings etc but still a nice size and very tidy. Take note that the location of the hotel means there are essentially no views of the city as its surrounded by buildings the same size. I give it a solid 4star review as its reasonable price and excellent location mean its brilliant for short stays like our city break.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds not too good......”
Reviews.Author: emceeManchester
Reviews.Content: As always I did my homework & read lots of reviews on TripAdvisor before I booked. To be fair I was not too disappointed. The location is great. The staff always polite & very helpful. The room clean & bathroom well appointed. However I was let down by two points. Firstly the air conditioning for the overall hotel was not switched on. The room was stuffy & a little uncomfortable at night. The manager was most apologetic & offered compensation. It was eventually working by the third (& last night). If this is an issue for you, before you book check with the hotel that the air conditioning is fully operational. The second point is more concerning. I was travelling with my two children (aged 14 & 8 years) & we were therefore in bed by 10.30pm. However most other residents were getting ready to go out at that time & were returning to the hotel between midnight & 3am. I know because I could hear every last noise they made. The hotel does not appear to have considered sound insulation whilst refurbishing the property. Consequently you hear every door being slammed shut & double-locked, footsteps above you sound like a herd of elephants and- believe me- you can hear just about everything when an adjacent bathroom is being used.......& I mean everything!!! Had I been travelling with a partner and staying up late then perhaps this would not have been so off-putting. But considering the biggest part of your stay in a hotel is sleeping, then perhaps this requires some attention by the management. If you're a heavy sleeper or such noises don't bother you then this truly is a fantastic base from which to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Beware the French ;-)”
Reviews.Author: 1stCEB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this hotel during a recent weekend. The previous reviews are accurate = good service & great location (to Metro, Air France Shuttle, Champ Elysees). We arrived early and had to leave our bags, while we explored the area. When we came back they had already placed our bags into our room (nice touch). The elavator is SUPER tiny, so get ready to make several trips. We would recommend a Suite, as the rooms are very tiny. With the Junior Suite we were able to fit our bags, no problem. Room was somewhat clean - some dirt near door, which was odd - but the bathroom was very clean. Our phone was a Pulse phone, versus a Tone, so had to use my cell phone for checking voice-mails, etc.... Front desk receptionists were very helpful and polite. No need to rent a car, the Metro will get you everywhere, BUT beware of people trying to squeeze behind you when you pass through the Metro gates (turnstiles). My wife and I got a serious scare when a guy tried to force his way through, almost glued to my wife, with her ticket. He then cursed my wife and spit on the ground in front of us, when we confronted him! As if we were doing something wrong! Furthermore, beware the taxi drivers - they try to charge you 1 Euro per Suitcase - even though this isn't written anywhere. You really don't need a taxi with the Metro being so convenient. We REFUSED to use a taxi after this woman taxi driver tried to rip us off, stating that "this is Paris and this is the way it is!" I guess the taxi meters don't mean anything then. So, bottom-line, great hotel and location, but beware the "locals" as they try to take advantage of you. Keep your guard up please!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 stars hotel - Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Vraiebrune
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel through Tripadvisor. I was there for a conference in the Palais des Congres. This is a 3 stars hotel in the center of Paris, 2 min walk from the magnificent Arc de Triomphe and 10 min walk (15 min if you take your time) to the Palais des Congres. Metro station at Arc de Triomphe, AirFrance coaches stops there too (direct to airport, even if you havnt booked an plane ticket with AirFrance). The hotel itself is perfectly run. Staff cant do more to please you, very welcoming and professional. The room (club - had a special rate on the hotel website - club room for the price of a standard room) is of good proportion, clean, extremely quiet. (see posted photos). The bathroom is sparkling clean. Facilities in room are a flat TV on the wall, a desk, free internet connection (need a cable). There is unfortunately no tea/coffee but it might not be expected in the 3 stars hotel. It would make this place perfect (if you are like me and need a coffee to even do anything in the morning). Breakfast is a buffet but I didnt go as the first morning I preferred a cafe/croissant in a sunny terrasse in one of the numerous cafes around the hotel. The 2nd morning I ordered breakfast in my room (same price 12€) and everything was delicious. There is a little bar and few seats. Better to order your drink and bring it upstairs I think. The lift is typical of these tiny lift of the old buildings in Paris. All renovated but the dimensions have not been changed and you can hardly fit more than 2 people. But this is a very minor detail. At least there is a lift. Overall I loved it. I'll definitely come back here next time in Paris. It's easy and convenient, no bad surprises, very nice staff and good value for money in this area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: carmelDublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay in the Royal Magda Hotel in Paris. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and the hotel made our stay even more special. The charm, friendliness and efficiency of the staff was second to none and nothing was too much trouble. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival and the rooms were more than adequate. The location of the hotel was super with the Arc de Triomphe, Metro station and Champ all within minutes. We will certainly return to the Royal Magda when we go back to Paris and will recommend it to any friends travelling there.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: WineLover77
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Used to stay at Ecole Centrale, in Marais area. Same price range. Magda is more comfortable, better located and with better service (the people at the reception are very correct, "almost nice".

Reviews.Title: “great front of house, boutique at 3 star prices”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel based on tripadvisor revues and were not disappointed. the lasting memory will be the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. the woman on front desk was exceptional. we were traveling with our two young girls (3 + 6) and stayed in one of the deluxe suites, which was small but ok for paris at this price. the second bed folded away to a sofa, which was handy for watching cartoon network before bed (they should rename it the tom and jerry channel!) the sofa bed was narrower than the main bed but very comfortable. location was just round the corner from the arc de triomphe, handy for the metro and the eiffel tower but a bit away from the centre. several kid friendly decent restaurants were within easy walking distance. free wifi in the lounge area but not in the bedrooms. would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it for young families. top tip - if you can't make berthillon ice cream on ille de cite there is a chocolatier on the champs elysee (102) that sells it too (15 mins walk from the hotel). expensive, but without a doubt the best vanilla icecream you will ever taste, let alone the mango, strawberry, mandarine, chocolate... need i continue?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Rock Hard Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location (2 mins walk from arc de triomphe) and it is very clean. Staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good. Overall we enjoyed our stay here. The only bad thing was that the bed was very uncomfortable. Other people might like a bed that resembles sleeping on the floor (it was rock hard) but its not for me! Watch out for the smallest lift in the world aswell!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nadiasmyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Easter week-end and let me just tell you what a fantastic time we had. We flew from Shannon to Paris Beauvais airport, shuttle bus dropped us at the Port Maillot, which is only 2 stops away by Metro from the hotel, but we decided to have a little walk and less than 10 min later we were in the welcoming lobby of the Royal Magda Etoile. Check in was so quick and efficient that in no time we were going up in the tiny elevator to our room on the 6th floor. As mentioned before – rooms are small but have everything you need, bed is extremely comfortable and bathroom is full size with a bathtub with a very good water pressure in the shower. Our room no 611 had a lot of windows which made our room feel very bright even on the dull, rainy day (yes, the weather was very bad all week-end). We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel, but it smelled lovely every morning in the lobby. Location of the hotel is fantastic; you are 2 min walk from the Arc de Triomph, Champs Elysee and metro station. You are only few minutes away from great selection of restaurant, bars, shops and etc. And this good location means a lot, especially if the weather is so bad and rain is just pouring non-stop, we could run to restaurants, metro and even La Duree (for some macaroons) without getting soaked wet :) Check out was as quick as check in and took less than 5 min, giving us time for a cup of coffee before our bus trip to Beauvais airport. Despite the bad weather we had an amazing week-end in Paris and we would like to thank all the fantasticl staff for making our stay so pleasant. For the price you pay for this hotel I would rate Royal Magda Etoile as a hidden gem of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: saharaomeara
Reviews.Content: Having read all the glorious reviews on trip advisor, I can now confirm that the Royal Magda Etoile lives up to its reputation. The location was wonderful - right beside the Metro line and only a stone's throw from the Arc de triomphe and the Champs-Elysées. That was especially good as we used to take a stroll down the Champs-Elysées after our dinner and browse in some of the shops (that opened till all hours) or go for dessert to Laduree. Instead of using the mini bar facillities, we went to monoprix on Avenue des Ternes and stocked up on water and Champagne (well, we were in Paris). Whilst on Avenue des Terres I found a wonderful street which was down the side of the Naf Naf shop. The street was full of the most amazing produce and speciality food shops and is definitely worth a visit - just to pick up a non touristy flavour of Paris. We were thrilled with our room, which was on the 5th floor and had a little balcony and whilst the rooms are small, they are perfectly formed. The place was spotless and the staff were very helpful and I can't wrap up my review without mentioning the marvellous leopard print carpet on the stairs and landing.......... just an added bonus when staying in my favourite hotel in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: HoustonRichie
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenaged daughters just got back from a week stay in Paris at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel. Everything from the staff (front desk, breakfast room, maids), to the rooms (clean, modern), to the location (literally 2 min. walk to the Arc d'Triomphe) was great. Flor and the other two girls at the front desk were extremely helpful in making suggestions/reservations for dinner. For the price, one just cannot go wrong by staying at this beautiful little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel - right in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: r4reilly
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, perfect location, great staff - ideal location for airport shuttle bus - definately stay again. No negatives

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel - some street noise”
Reviews.Author: STN74
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very pleasant staff. Breakfast € 12 p.p is a little pricy and not very well stocked. Rooms aren't to small. All rooms have seen recent redecorating and the standard rooms do have the same decor as shown on the hotel website photos. There is relatively little traffic noise although the hotel is situated just a short stroll from the Wagram avenue and the Arch de Triomph. As there is a couple of bars and a night club in the right next to the hotel, you will experience some noise during the night, especially friday through monday nights. Plenty of restaurants in the neighboorhood. Short walk to metro stop: Charles de Gaulle Etoile The Yellow metro line will take you directly to the city centre in minutes. The metro stop is also trafficated by the RER A-line witch connects to the RER B-line at Chatelet Les Halles, which takes you to either Charles de Gaulle or Orly airports. Fare: approx € 16 p.p. Otherwise taxi takes about 20 minutes from Orly and costs approx. €40. Traffic depending. Rooms have no air-conditioning, and I suppose that you will most likely miss this during mid-summer. (Another tip: if you go to Paris during early spring be sure to bring warm clothing)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jirkac
Reviews.Content: Just two words: absolutely excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katebar
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Royal Magda because we needed a reasonably priced hotel, and it was conveniently located near the Arch de Triomphe and was rated highly in TripAdvisor. I was a little nervous about what I would find, but this turned out to be a great choice. Beautiful, clean, small boutique hotel, near the Metro, tour buses, etc. Easy to find. Room was typically small, but very clean and comfortable. Even a new flat screen tv. Bathroom small but seemed newly renovated and very clean. Nice little touches. The staff was EXCELLENT! Two very wonderful girls manned the desk during the days and they were so eager to please and helpful, we could not have hoped for better. The gentlemen on duty overnight (the front desk is staffed 24 hrs. a day) was also very accommodating and pleasant. This hotel was a joy and we were so pleased with the choice. Thank you to the Royal Magda for a great stay in Paris! Given the chance, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: annagoo
Reviews.Content: A small but perfectly formed hotel a two minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The staff were brilliant, friendly and welcoming and the rooms were spotlessly clean. It is a great base for exploring Paris, with many things within walking distance, but if the legs get tired there's a taxi station at the top of the road and the metro two minutes away. I would definitely recommend this hotel, as would the rest of my family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Magda78
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect place for weekend away with the girls. The room was good size and very clean, staff extremely helpful and lovely. Location is superb, only a short walk from Champs Elysee. Would recommend it to anyone and I am definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, tremendous value”
Reviews.Author: cws05champs
Reviews.Content: Rogal Magda is an excellent boutique hotel. Very clean with excellent service and a tremendous value. Steps from the Arc de Triomphe, metro, and Champs Elysees. Very easy to book directly with hotel, everything completed easily through email with very quick responses. The only "con" is that the rooms are small, but the quality and cleanliness is all that matters. Eat at Brasserie Lorraine, worth the price for excellent service and "3 star Michelin" food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: carugo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris after staying a long week-end at the Royal Magda with our 8 and 6 year old. We had a deluxe suite which is basically 2 rooms divided by an arch with a king size in one and a made up sofa bed in the other. Both rooms had a tv and the bathroom was lovely - sparkling clean - as was the rest of the hotel. We had good bathroom toiletries and the shower was excellent. The staff were very accommodating. We were very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. As other guests have stated, all transport was just at the end of the street too. All in all the location was great. We ate at Hippopotamus which was lovely and good for children, we also ate at Bistro Romain on Champs Elysees (top floor - good view of Champs at night). We had a one breakfast at Cafe de Flore on Boulevard Sain-Germain which was wonderful and worth the visit (one of the oldest cafes in Paris), and we had a lovely breakfast at the hotel one day. All in all a lovely trip!

Reviews.Title: “C'est fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Mozwhite
Reviews.Content: This is the way Trip Advisor is supposed to work. My wife and I were looking for a good deal at a smaller hotel so we pulled up TA and, at the time, the Magda was #1 or #2 and it had a number of glowing reviews. We took other travelers' advice and it was exactly what we expected. Yohann (and the others at the front desk) was extremely helpful and made some outstanding recommendations for dinners and nightlife. If you are like us and would rather spend more money on actiivties and great meals than you would on the hotel, but still need a clean, safe place to sleep, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: loreleo
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda Etoile Hotel in Paris is one of the best deals in Paris. I have been at the Royal Magda Etoile twice during the last 6 months, and each time I received an outstanding treatment from the great staff. The rooms were always very clean, comfortable, and quiet. During the last visit (Febr 2008), I was upgraded to a large suite at no charge. The position of the Hotel is excellent, just in front of the Arc de Triomphe, minutes away from several Metro stations and the RER (train) station. In addition, the Hotel is minutes away from the Bus stop of the Air France shuttles that provide the fastest connection to both Airports in Paris (CGD and Orly). The only weakness of the Magda is probably the breakfast, but there are plenty of Cafes around to get fresh croissants. I strongly recommend the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel to business travelers (Paris Congress Center is only minutes away), to tourists and to everybody that want to enjoy Paris at an affordable price range.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !”
Reviews.Author: Yully
Reviews.Content: What I can expect better tha this hotel in Paris? Best location - near Metro station and easy access to any place in guide book. nice pople - very helpful receptionists and stuffs. Surprisingly, room keepers can speak in English well. I immediately felt so nice when I have entered a room since I have smelt very nice from the room. Bath room is quite big if you compare than any hotel in Paris. I felt this hotels hospitality from complementary Bath salt. This bath room is extremely clean and tidy. Yes, the lift is tiny but this is nothing matter if you know what is really small lift in Paris. My husband must have been stepped up by himself when I had kept suitcases in lift. We have stayed here over the year 2007/2008, and the hotel gave us a box of chocolate (Leonidas!) and glass of Champaine at bar next reception. That was good night!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and cozy hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: DennisChung
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in the hotel for our honeymoon when we were in Paris, and it was a very nice experience. The people serve in the hotel are polite and willing to help. The room is clean, comfortable and warm enough. The bath room is quite large in the room we stayed. In addition, every guest room has different style of key ring, which makes you feel unique. The location of the hotel is very convenient, you can easily reach the sub-way and find a restaurant in that area. The breakfast (buffet) in the hotel is also good compare to its price. Highly recommend "Royal Magda Etoile Hotel" when you visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in many ways!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaasiBusch
Reviews.Content: With our family of seven we stayed two nights in Hotel magda Etoile. It was an excellent stay. Very kind and helpful easy going staff. Perfect room on the grounfloor for our son in a wheelchair. Regarding location/price/service this couldn't have been any better! One minute l'Arc de Triomph. And we were so lucky to even park our cars in front of the hotel! Thank you so much everyone at Magda´s, you are our Triumph!!! `Brady bunch` from Rotterdam, netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: c2cfan
Reviews.Content: I will say that this hotel is a perfect place to stay for a romantic getaway in Paris. The localtion is excellent with just a short stroll to the Arch of Triumh and Charles de Gaulle metro station. The staff were helpful, the breakfast was good, and the rooms were of good quality standard. A bit small, as I'm used to Norwegian hotels which has great sized rooms. But overal a splendid, good quality and safe place to stay in Paris without using a lot of money. Value for money and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: JoolsDarlington
Reviews.Content: This hotel compares very favourably with others that we've stayed in in Paris. It was a little more expensive than our usual, but as my husband and I said, it was a treat to be in a room that was better than OK: Not a single bad-taste plastic-framed picture on the wall or a mildewed tile in the bathroom. Instead, everything was spick and span - lovely new tiles, pristine clean floor, piles of fluffy white towels, towelling dressing gown. We asked and were given extra pillows, and the chamber-maid greeted us with a smile every morning. The reception staff were unvariably charming and pleasant. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel. As everyone else has said, the location was perfect. The area is totally unthreatening, even at night-time, with handy small shops nearby for water, bread and fruit. Our children (4 and 2) both love the Hippopotamus restaurant at Place des Ternes (5 mins on foot) and Bistro du 17ieme on Avenue de Villiers (15 mins on foot) was really great for an all inclusive Sunday lunch (I think it was about 36 Euros each including wine, aperitif and 3 courses - don't expect a children's menu, but waiters were very accommodating about half portions, children's portions etc). The Parc Monceau is handy for children to let off steam (hundreds of joggers at the weekend!) and the children's play area at Jardin de Luxembourg is brilliant, though you have to pay for access to it. The hotel was perfectly placed for so many activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bariblak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to Paris with my wife and young daughters. I booked the Royal Magda after reading the reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. We booked a Deluxe Suite, which is basically a bedroom and a lounge that contains a sofa bed. This was fine for us, but I would suggest the sofa is only big enough for 1 adult or 2 small children. The hotel was in excellent decorative condition and the staff we all exceptionally helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at the hotel because it was convenient but, at 12 euros a head, this was a mistake particularly as the kids were only having a croissant and hot chocolate. Better to turn left out of the hotel and find a patisserie or creperie. The breakfast area was very quiet each morning, so I suspect most people had elected to eat out. The location was excellent. Turn right out of the hotel, walk 20-30 metres, and you are looking at the Arc de Triomphe. Considering we were so central, the hotel was exceptionally quiet. Overall you will not be diappointed with this hotel. Keep an eye on the rates though, because they do offer substantially discounted rates occasionally . If you are unable to get a booking here, i noticed a number of similar hotels in the immediate area which are probably worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bedfordians
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Royal Magda Etoile (2 adults and 2 teenagers). The location is great - very near the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elycees, metro and restaurants. The rooms are slightly small but very well equipped, clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast provided a good range of food and it could be had in the bedroom which suited our teenagers. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: dublinemma27
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute due to overbooking at our other accom in Paris and was very impressed, the room was a little small but still plenty of room for two. Everything was spotless, the check in and out very speedy. The guy on reception was very very helpful. overall I would have no problem recommending this great little hotel in an excellant location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: iamdianne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of previous reviews on Trip Advisor. We contacted the hotel directly to book and to request a non smoking room away from the elevator. They said they would try to accomodate us. We were so pleased when we checked in to find that the room did not smell like smoke at all. We were placed on the floor we wanted and the room (512) was as far away from the elevator as possible. Although that isn't very far since the fifth floor only has 6 rooms. Nevertheless, we did not hear any noise from the elevator. The room was immaculate. We did experience some noise from the room above when they were getting ready in the mornings but that seemed understandable in a building of this age. The bathroom was very modern. Everyone seemed extremely friendly. And of course the location was great. It was our first time to Paris and we were pleased with the ease of using the nearby RER/metro. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in every respect”
Reviews.Author: PPK2008
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews we read on various websites. The bit of research was definitely worth it as we made an excellent choice. The hotel is in a great location only a couple of minutes stroll from the Arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaule Etoile station which is the perfect hub from which to explore Paris by metro. Our ensuite double room was very pleasant - tastefully decorated and very clean with a fully stocked mini bar. The staff at reception, all of whom spoke good English, were extremely helpful and polite. The hotel was very good value by Parisien standards and I'd have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Just&Rach
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife, and our two good friends stayed here for two nights at the end of January. We booked the hotel via Hotels . com with help from Trip Advisor based on previous reviews. Most hotels are quite pricey in the centre of Paris, however this one is definitely value for money. Only a 15 euro, 15 minute, cab journey from the Gare Du Nord, it is also easily reachable from the nearest metro stop apprx 200 yards away. In advance of our stay, I emailed the hotel to check a few things, and like some of the other reviewers, found Yohan to be extremely helpful and very prompt in his replies. It is the little touches like this that make all the difference. The hotel, although quite small, was immaculate, and the rooms were spotless. All the staff were friendly and were always there to assist if needs be. The location was even better than we were led to believe, with the Arc De Triomphe on the doorstep along with all manner of shops, bars and restaurants. We also spent a day at Disney, and were very fortunate to also find that the metro stop by the hotel is a direct line to the park (about 40 minutes) but makes it extremely easy to get there and back if you are heading up that way. Paris is a great city to walk round, and the Eiffel Tower is around 35/40 minutes walk away, and the Louvre around 50 minutes straight down the Champs D'elysees. All in all, we can thoroughly recommended this hotel and would definitely stay there when we next venture into Paris. Although eating and drinking is often very expensive in the city, the Eurostar return trip via Ebbsfleet only cost £59 per couple with a promotion, so there is really no excuse not to explore this great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!! Great Paris Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LifeboatJim
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay at the Magda. Firstly the Air France shuttle which anyone can use stops within a 5 minute case drag of the hotel (20 Euros Return from T1 or T2 CDG). The Arc is only a 5 minute (if that) walk away as is a Metro station. The Louvre is within walking distance (30 - 45min), there are many good quality restaurants nearby as well as budget ones. MacDonalds is also at the end of the street if you fancy avoiding the 6 Euro coffees around Paris. Also at the end of the road is a self service restaurant (Monte Carlo), 2 courses for 11 Euros. Worth a go as food v good considering the cost. The night before paid over 100 Euros for 2. Found the staff very friendly and helpful at the hotel. Room was very clean and a good size for Paris. Breakfast was good, many people complain in reviews about the 12 Euro charge. I regularly pay 15GBP in the UK so found it good value for money. The street outside can get a little noisy at night but nothing clsoing the window doesn't sort. After all Paris is a cosmopolitan city so unlike many places people aren't in bed for 10pm. Recommend the Magda and Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: muffingem
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Magda over Epiphany. This was our third trip to Paris and the best hotel yet. It is literally two or three minutes to the Arc du Triumphe and Metro, the room was neat and clean and the staff bent over backward to make sure we were happy. Johan even arranged two dinner reservations and a driver for Champagne and attended the meeting with that driver to make sure all the details were taken care of. The best hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “As good as all the reviews state”
Reviews.Author: Spydr
Reviews.Content: I can only add to all the great reviews about this hotel. We stayed in a Junior Suite with our two young daughters and, although smallish, the room was big and comfortable enough for the four of us. Aurelie and Yohann at reception were great and really went out of their way to assist us. The location is excellent (one block from the Arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro station) and the reception desk even gave us their own hand drawn map of useful places around the hotel, such as supermarkets, forex and banks, tourist bus stops etc. On New Year's Eve we were invited to champagne and snacks in the lobby and found a complimentary box of delicious chocolates in our room, as well as a chocolate hamper for each of our children. The hotel is good value for money and their service is excellent. We can certainly recommend the hotel, also for families.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, central, and clean”
Reviews.Author: northgong
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Magda Etoile and have to say we were very impressed by a number of points. The position is within 2 minutes walk of the Arch. The staff are absolutely helpful and friendly and the rooms are not as small as we thought they would be with a quaint little balcony. Interiors were very clean and the bathroom excellent. Didnt have breakfast there, so cant really comment. All in all I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another good pick”
Reviews.Author: Marc07
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel from 27 till 29 dec (room 514) and we were very pleased with our pick. After some research on Tripadvior we decided to go for this hotel becease of the location near the arc and ofcourse the price, which is very reasonable. While we were staying here for three full days we noticed that the staff is exceptionally friendly and the rooms are exceptionally clean. All things you can expect in a three star hotel is present. The only negative aspect was the wall thickness, because of this you can sometimes hear other hotel guests talking in their room, this was only in the evening hours. We ve read a lot of reviews about this hotel and we can agree more with most of them... that it is great. Note its is great because of the location and the price you pay. Dont expect a 5 star hotel for a price rate of a 3 star. Its just good value for money. If you find the breakfast expensive just walk to the corner and take a petit dejeuner at Mac Donalds its not too bad for just 5 euro. We would recommend this hotel and certainly would go back again. If we can make a recommendation to the hotel owners ( i know they read the reviews on this site) just charge 10 euro's more for a hotelroom and charge less or nothing for breakfast, its more balanced that way.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: azuresky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magda Etoile over Christmas for 4 nights and I honestly don't think we could have made a better choice. For the pros; this place has got one of the BEST locations. Really easy to get to all the usual touristy sites (Eiffel tower, Louvre, Notre Dame, Sacre Coeur etc) by metro. The closest station is Charles de Gaulle which has about 3 lines running through it, and just around the corner is the Champs Elysees. Rooms were spotless, especially the bathroom which was great and linens were changed everyday. They even left us a box of divine Leonidas choccies on Christmas day! There are lots of wonderful brasseries close by and the staff are very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. We were a bit worried by some of the reviews regarding staff; but we encounted no such problems during our stay. As for the cons: The rooms and the bathroom are pretty tight (we stayed in a standard room) but perfectly adequate. Also, you can occassionally get the waft of smoke in your room as other patrons may be smokers but this generally dissapates quite quickly. There is no breakfast included in the room rate; but not really a problem as there are lots of great cafes nearby. Finally, this is not really a con but just something to note: there is supposed to be a 24hr reception, but we came home after midnight mass on Christmas Eve (around 2am) and found the door locked. We rang the doorbell, and it was answered straightaway so there was no problem but just something to be aware of if you are planning any late nights out.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not faultless”
Reviews.Author: Russpo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, fantastic location for Arc and Metro connection to all the main places of interest. Staff were very helpful. I've seen negative comments on this site about a young guy. If it's the same one we had dealings with then he must have "pulled his socks up" because he was very attentive and polite to us. The young lady was extremely helpful and almost as beautiful as Paris itself! Finally the hotel left chocolates for us on Christmas Day - a lovely touch. Now the bad bits - the street on which the hotel resides smells pretty awful but once inside this is not detectable. At night there is some noise through the rather thin walls/ceilings. Finally, as mentioned by others, there was a slight smell of smoke in our room, presumably left by previous occupants. Overall, I was impressed and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “An overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: I read reviews and am fairly adept at determing when people are overly complimentary or negative. Wow...did I miss it here. It was merely an adequate boutique hotel in a fabulous location. We have stayed in Paris several times and were specifically looking for a hotel near the Arch D'Triumphe. I e-mailed with the hotel and was assured that our upgraded room would be "large"...we could barely put our luggage in the room and no room to move around. We upgrade to a junior suite that was laughable. The furniture appeared to have been bought at a yard sale. There are numerous 3* hotels in all the surrounding streets to select from. The breakfast was expensive, 12euro per person for a continental breakfast. Yohan who seems to have his own fan club is typically officious French. We had fun trying to get him to smile. He did provide some suggestions but it was a challenge! If you want the same area and rating, I would check out the Princess Caroline next door.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Deborah
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home from Paris and my stay at the Royal Magda Etoile I booked this hotel based on the outstanding reviews on tripadvisor - especially in regard to service and location. The hotel was as expected - it is a 'boutique' hotel so you can't expect all amenities. I liked my room on the sixth floor (attic rooms) - it had a comfortable double bed, plenty of room for me and satisfactory bathroom. Though I could imagine the room could be a bit cozy for two people. The rooms were very clean - but unfortunately no view except into the inner courtyard. The downside for me was - as for a recent reviewer - was the young man at the desk. I arrived early one weekend morning and had expected (from tripadvisor reviews) a warm welcome. The young man couldn't have been more unfriendly. If he ever smiled I was never to see it during my stay - and he certainly made a guest feel that they were a nuisance. I had hoped he was just working weekends but my heart sank when I saw his face at the desk. He was most unhelpful about nice bistros in the area and you could feel his impatience in having to answer questions. Fortunately, he was joined a few days later by Eualie (I hope I got her name right she deserves it) who is extremely friendly and helpful. Her colleagues at night were also lovely and friendly - one man from Morocco (who was on most of my stay) and the other from Algiers. They wre happy to chat and be helpful. The location of the hotel is fantastic but even at such reasonable prices I would hesitate to stay here again as your hotel is your home away from home and I don't like to feel like I am being a nuisance 'at home'.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PT77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Royal Magda was very comfortable. We had no complaints what so ever. Excellent location, safe, close to the METRO/ RER (if you are travelling with a lot of luggage taking the Air France shuttle is NOT a good idea), Courteous and helpful staff. The staff also made our reservations for LIMO pick up and drop off. On the day of departure there was a strike in Paris- the staff made sure our commute to the airport was taken care of. Clean rooms , good fixtures in bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows. The room was small but yet met our requirements. We did not have breakfast in the hotel. Qwickys and MC Donalds are just around the corner from the hotel. Also, try out the Thai restaurant near by.

Reviews.Title: “Good rather than great”
Reviews.Author: peainpod
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we booked the hotel on the strength of the excellent reviews and rating from this site. While we weren't disappointed with our choice, in all honesty, I felt that the hotel didn't merit such a high ranking. Some of the good points mentioned in other reviews are certainly valid: great location (near CDG-Etoile station, 2 streets away from Air France drop-off) and good value for money (we paid $149 euros per night in early Dec). And our room was even somewhat larger than we had expected. That said, there were a number of less than satisfactory things as well. First off, our room had a lingering smoked-in smell that lasted for the first 2-3 days of our week-long stay. Hotel staff were inconsistent in service attitude and certainly not as friendly as one might expect in such an intimate setting. One dark-haired youth veered on rude in his attitude, even though we were just asking about the most mundane question (directions for this one restaurant) and the encounter was unpleasant enough that I studiously avoided him for the rest of the stay. My advice is to only ask reception questions when there was either a girl on duty (she was super friendly and that *almost* but not quite made up for the insolent rude young guy) and a middle-aged gentlemen. On the whole, we were still not disappointed with our choice and would even probably choose it again - but just thought that a more balanced review would help to warn future guests from having too high expectations and becoming disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good – simply as that”
Reviews.Author: infolondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Staff were friendly, room was small, but a fair size considering its central Paris location. The hotel is very near Metro/RER station and the Arc de Triomphe. In room breakfast was good, although probably not worth the cost. In-room bar, again was expensive, but nothing which surprised me. I had a poor view, of the inner courtyard, but this wasn’t much of a problem. The lift is slightly small, two people in the lift and it is full, but again this never posed a problem. In summary it is hard to fault this hotel, generally excellent. However, there was nothing exceptional about this place. But if you are looking for good quality accommodation in central Paris, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: NYorkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magda Etoile for three nights this November. We booked it after reading the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor, thinking it would be an impeccable experience. The many 5.0 ratings are convincing, yet a bit misleading. First off, the location is truly terrific. Having been to Paris many times, I can attest to the fact that the Magda Etoile is in a great location to see the city. It is around the corner form the 1 line, which crosses Paris horizontally and takes you pretty much everywhere. The stop is called Charles de Gaulle-Etoile. From the hotel it's about a minute on foot. Now for the buts... The hotel is small, one could say intimate, and rooms are not very large. They are very very clean, but our room had clearly been smoked in. The smoke smell was quite intense and if you're very sensitive, you'd be mad, I guarantee it. The bath towels we used after showering, upon arrival, smelled strongly of smoke. I called reception and we received new ones, but I will admit that it skeeved us out that we had the previous guests bath towels on the shelf... he/she didn't use them, but still... Then, the front desk. The girls were great, helpful and pleasant. But one scraggly, skinny dude we asked to make a reservation for us couldn't have been more arrogant. When we asked him to call a well-known restaurant to see if we could get a table, he insisted it was a "chain" and that there was another one nearby, which we should just walk to. I knew for a fact that wasn't the case, so when I asked him to find the one I meant in St. Germain, he asked if I had the telephone number...like as in "call them yourself". I said i could look it up online, but that I was hoping he could make the call, since my French is rudimentary and sometimes it helps when a hotel calls. He sighed...he made me wait...then he said he would call back...and didn't. When my husband went downstairs and asked him, he seemed put out and said he hadn't had "time yet" to find the number, along with the roll of the eye. In short, he was a jerk. It kind of colored our view of the rest of the staff, perhaps unfairly. The breakfast was ok, but at 12 euros per person not exactly good. Some croissants, some baguette, wrapped cheese, jam...coffee..oh well. So all in all it's not a total disappointment, it's an adequate hotel, but we won't give it a 5.0. We decided not to drink the Kool-Aid..;-)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: helzbells
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in November 2007 and would definitely stay again. The room looked like it'd been recently redecorated and was stylish and immaculately clean (as was the bathroom and from what we saw, so was the rest of the hotel). Location wise, it couldn't be beaten - it's literally a minute away from the Metro and the Arc D'Triomphe and there are lots of shops and cafes locally.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: riskyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four days at the Royal Magda Hotel. What can I say? It's a perfect hotel. The location is excellent. The rooms are very clean, the bathroom is large and the towels were in perfect conditions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I have no complaints with this hotel. For the price, the deal is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: EuroReisen
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Royal Magda and had a wonderful time. The hotel is well-situated just off the CDG Etoile and is very near the Metro stop of the same name and also the AIr France airport bus stop. I arrived early in the afternoon and was able to check in right away, and from the very beginning the staff were warm, friendly and welcoming. My single room included a double bed, bathroom with shower, LCD TV, free broadband internet, and a desk. Everything was spotlessly clean and the bathroom had huge, fluffy towels. Breakfast was not included in the room price and was offered as either a buffet in the lobby or a tray delivered to the room. As the charge was the same for either option (12 Euros), I had a tray in my room and it was the perfect way to start my day: cafe au lait, fresh squeezed orange juice, yogurt, baguette, croissant, pain au chocolat, cheese, butter, and jam. I decided to order breakfast at the last minute and it was brought up less than 10 minutes after I called. It's also available until noon should you want to really sleep in. The only thing less than perfect was the soundproofing of the room. I could hear every word spoken by the couple in the next room, and whenever they would leave or return, it sounded like they were opening and closing my door. And, although perfectly adequate, an upgrade in the bedding wouldn't be a bad idea. For the location, price and service quality, though, the Royal Magda is a gem. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SKIpal
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. We had a tiny balcony which looked over the street. We were close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: rosenbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the Magda and had a great stay. The location was perfect - right near the Arc de Triomphe and the train station, so we could get everywhere we needed to go easily. There were plenty of eateries nearby, plus the staff were happy to point us in the direction of an internet cafe and supermarket. The room and bathroom were pretty tiny, but very well furnished and clean. We found the daily cleaning always seemed to be fairly late in the day, so coming back for an afternoon siesta was out of the question, but there's so much to do in Paris that wasn't a huge issue! We checked out fairly early one morning, and the man at the desk was more than happy to book us a taxi and help us carry out our luggage when it arrived. The Magda has a great, friendly atmosphere - highly recommended. Our tip - try the onion soup at the "English" pub around the corner. It's the best!

Reviews.Title: “NIce and friendly”
Reviews.Author: htango
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris, a honeymoontrip, and this hotel helped to make it unforgettable. We had a nice nice room, with balcony and street view, that wasn't that small, we could even do our Yoga practice. Very friendly and helpful frontdesk people, and great location, one block from the Triumph Arc and Metro station, lots of cafes and brasseries around. Very small elevator, but they deliver your lugagge after you get in your room, so you don't have to squeeze-in the elevator with your bags. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on at the Magda”
Reviews.Author: Y-Alpha
Reviews.Content: The reviews on trip advisor were spot on - a great placed hotel, perfectly adequate for our needs. Breakfast was money well spent in the expensive area that it is. I would advise going for the junior suite or double with bath though as the shower rooms are rather cramped - but if all you are going to do is sleep then perfect! Staff were lovely, and no hassle checking in. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent disabled room”
Reviews.Author: CBFOUR
Reviews.Content: We booked the disabled room, which is located besides the reception and we stayed five nights in the hotel. The room had enough space for the two wheelchairs of my wife (one for normal use and one to be connected to a electric powered wheel). While I was having business meetings she could go where she wanted go through entire Paris autonomously, because most sidewalks are lowered down to street level at the corners. The room was very clean and very quiet! Especially the latter is rare in noisy Paris! There are some good restaurants in the vicinity. The entrance of the hotel is also rather good for wheelchairs. From the sidewalk only a little step of 2 - 4 cm has to be taken. Most wheel chair drivers can manage that. When ever you have a problem, the people at the reception are very friendly and helpful. In my view this room is very adequeate for people in a wheelchair. Some positive suggestions for the management: 1. In the bathroom there is no screen or curtain to prevent water splashing on the ground surface. It was no problem for my disabled wife when she took a bath, but when I took a shower, standing upright, I could not prevent that a lot of water came on the ground surface. 2. Also the flexible water supply is too short for a normal person taking a shower. Holding the shower head just above my head it sqeezed off the water supply. 3. Further, the place to put your bath room stuff (shaving kit, make up and other things) is far to small. Twice, I moved my hair comb on the one side and at the other side of the glass plank the glass fell into the sink. It was broken both times (sorry manager...). Anyhow, the next time that we will come to Paris, we will again go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Royal Magda Etoile”
Reviews.Author: AttitudeAdjuster
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the Royal Magda Etoile during the Rugby World Cup. It's location is excellent with the airport bus stopping a couple of minutes away and the Metro/RER also just minutes away. The rooms were lovely, well apppointed and comfortable. The reception staff were extremely helpful, and spoke very good English and helped with my not so good French. The Hotel has an excellent location by the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. we paid about £100 a night for our rooms and were very impressed. We also recommend the Bistro Niell which is an easy walk away and Chez Clement in the Rue Marbeuf. If only England had won, the weekend would have been perfect!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: gem02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend &I stayed at the Royal Magda for 3nights &really enjoyed our stay. The room was small in comparison to many other European hotels we have stayed in but was clean &the location was excellent. Close to Air France shuttle drop off &the metro. In walking distance of many of the main sites. The reception staff were very helpful & friendly. Only complaint would be that the beds were not very comfy & the rooms very not at all soundproof, making it quite noisy in the mornings. Over all though this is a fairly good hotel to stay in during a trip to Paris if your just looking for a bed to sleep in after a busy day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel, conveniently located near the Metro”
Reviews.Author: PickyGuy
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here 1 night in October of 2007. We were well pleased. The rooms were small but clean and the prices were low - we only paid 129 Euros. I gave them 5 stars in consideration of the value of this hotel. Located on a usually quiet (and typically trash-strewn) Parisian street and only 2-3 blocks from the Charles De Gaulle-Etoile Metro stop where the #1, #2 and #6 subways go. Lots of expensive shopping nearby. Breakfast is only 12 euros (which ain't bad for Paris). There is free internet in the hotel and that is a rarity in Europe. The elevator is really small and this adds to the charm of the hotel. The staff was very friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: osubarry
Reviews.Content: This was a classy little hotel. The people at the front desk were helpful and always smiling. The room as mentioned before was small, but very clean. Close to many restaurants as well as the Arc de Triomphe and Metro stop. The Air France bus to the airport is also nearby. We walked to the Louvre as well as the Eiffel Tower. We would stay here again if we ever visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancy_siesta_key
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Royal Magda hotel and for the price, we were extememely pleased. The rooms were small but clean, same with the bathroom. Since we didn't come to Paris to stay in the room, it was perfect. The location was within walking distance to the Champes Elysee and the subway was a block away. Everyone at the hotel was polite and helpful. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: LindySD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite at the Royal Magda the first week of October. The room was clean and spacious. Nice to put your feet up after a day of touring. The staff were very helpful and also answered a few questions over the internet before we arrived. The location was excellent. Close to the metro (3 lines) and 1-1/2 blocks to the Champs de Elysees. If we return, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: jhbboy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at quite a few hotels this year, choosing only from the top 10 listing on Tripadvisor for each city, The Royal Magda Etoile in Paris has to be the greatest find of 2007!!! Value for money this hotel cant be beat, from a perfect location, big, clean and comfortable rooms, clean large bathrooms, flat screen TV (although no in house movies, and only 1 English channel), to the fastest internet connection I have experienced anywhwere in the world (free just bring your own CAT5 Cable). The area is safe and pleasant to walk around with lovely restaurants on every corner, distance to the arc is about 150m. We travelled in and out of Paris by train and the distance from both stations meant we paid a bout 10Euros for taxi to and from the hotel. Yes the lift is small, 2 of us in the group are large and fitted with one 'normal' sized adult no problem. We never ate at the hotel, and in Paris you are so spoiled with choice for food I wouldnt recommend eating in! Good Tip, unlike everywhere else the minibar was really cheap, a coke was half the price of stores in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennisniese
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. The metro is right around the corner so getting to locations all over Paris is very easy. There are also great restaurants in the few blocks sounding the hotel. Guy Savoy is located right across the street! The hotel is very clean and the staff was friendly and all spoke english very well. We had the breakfast which was $12 a piece but it had a nice selection of cereals, fruits, yogurt, bagettes etc.. It was nice to just sit and plan our day with our maps at the hotel before heading out. We also had them book us a private car from and to the airport which was very nice. Great driver and a nice luxury when arriving in Paris. For a wonderful hotel in a great location with a fair price stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: gmogrady
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! While the room was a bit smaller than we are used to, it was spotlessly clean. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Best of all was the location. What more could you ask for in being 1/2 block from the Arc and the same from the metro? We felt very safe and could find all we needed within a few minutes walk. Nothing luxurious but still a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem, great location”
Reviews.Author: dinas64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda for 4 nights of our 10 day trip to France. We booked a junior suite and it was perfect for 2 people or 2 with a child. It was a large room with a small sofa that converts to a bed. The room was spotless every day. The room faced the back of the hotel, so we couldn't hear the noise from the club next door, except for the night that France beat Ireland in World Cup rugby. Our only complaint about the room was that the bed was rather hard. The staff was great. They were very helpful in making dinner reservations, including one for our 20th wedding anniversary. Location was hard to beat, just steps to the Metro and a block from the Air France shuttle from the airport. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: romavisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Magda Etoile for a weekend in September. Fantastic location- few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was lovely. 6 of us travelled together- all happy with rooms. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The reception staff could not have been more helpful. They recommended and booked a restaurant for us in advance, contacted the Moulin Rouge to confirm our reservation number and organised airport transfers. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel w Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: sj_traveler_ca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in this hotel and found it perfect: friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean, charming and quiet. Johahn spoke English and was -- best of all -- courteous and helpful. The hotel is in a convenient area that worked well for us, although it is 2.7 miles from the Louvre. We had a room on the sixth floor that was cozy and comfortable after we requested a move from the first floor room directly off the reception area. Should you want to be on the first floor, that room works but otherwise I'd avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great fiind”
Reviews.Author: Marigot1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magda Etoile for 2 nights last week on our way home from Provence. This was our 6th trip to Paris, and we have stayed in many different hotels. The Magda Etoile was an excellent bargain for the location and accomodations. We had a 2 room "suite"- with a queen size bed. Our room faced the rear of the building, (not streetside) and was very quiet. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable. What made this hotel special was the location (right near the Arc D'Triumphe and Metro stop) and the kindness of the front desk staff. We had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival with some restaurants that we wanted to book . They went over and above to secure reservations, even when one of the restaurants was completely booked. They were also ready to give detailed directions to a restaurant or information as to which terminal we need for check in at Charles De Gaulle . FInally, one of the front desk staff assisted us in taking our bags to the nearby Airfrance bus to go back to the airport. We booked through the website and while there were made aware that there were some far less expensive rooms-- albeit smaller and facing the street (with attendant noice from the bar next door). In all, this hotel was a great find, and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in all of paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: MojoQueensland
Reviews.Content: Royal Magda equals prefection. Their amazing, helpful and friendly staff who are the heart and soul of this incredible hotel and Parisian chic ambience were just some of the reasons that make this hotel the best hotel in all of Paris. The immaculate rooms, (not one thing out place ,everything sparkled), beautifully kept hotel, happy and atmosphere, delicious morning croissants and home made hot chocolate breakfasts, exceptionally ideal and safe location, and the warm welcome and the helpful team (that was willing to pick up food for their guest who had a cold when it was raining who helped with local maps, directions and metro times and who always had a smile which brightened our day every morning and every night) who are the icing on the cake of this astounding hotel! You will love it! You are not going to find a more prefect place to come back to at the end of the day in this amazing city. Royal Magda is in a class of its own, a treasure that the city of Paris should be proud of. Thank you for the time of our lives, we will be back. Love J. Siracusa and J. Thompson Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frogwoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The location was right by the Arc de Truimph and a metro stop. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms were nice. There was construction in the lobby, but didn't mind it too much. The airline lost our luggage and we didn't have any idea where it was. The staff spent the last two days tracking it down for us and calling the airport. They were extremely helpful in getting our luggage. Without them I would have probably given up-- kudos to them. would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: itchingfeet
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have the tightest lifts I've ever been in and isn't showy but if you want a central base in Paris that is clean, well organised, and staffed by friendly, helpful people the Royal Magda Etoile is a good bet. I stayed in a single room that made the best use of its size, was quiet and basically had everything to make my trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and stay :D”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2783
Reviews.Content: Due to injury, we had to cancel our trip to the south of France and stay in Paris unexpectedly. Our accommodation we were in was booked to somebody else so I scoured the internet for a hotel and found the Royal Magda for 99 euro a night! We arrived at the Royal Magda at 10am, not expecting to be able to check in but to our surprise, they had our room ready in fifteen minutes and upgraded us to a junior suite! The room was beautiful and so clean and spacious. Throughout our stay the staff provided us with bags and bags of ice (for the injured ankle) and also plenty of excellent advice regarding shopping and eating. I'm sure we were driving them mad but we would never have known! Definitely the best hotel stay I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem.”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel during a recent business/pleasure trip to Paris. It has the perfect location, close to everything, including great cafes, restaurants, shopping and city landmarks. The hotel is VERY clean, with what appears as newly renovated rooms. The bathroom was very modern with every convenience, even a hair dryer and bathrobes. The staff at the front desk were friendly and spoke English happily for us. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED the Royal Magda!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerDetroit_Mi
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have ever stayed at (I have traveled to Europe, Asia, America), this was one of the two hotels where I felt like home. The reasons being: 1. First and foremost, this is by far the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at anywhere in Europe! Everything sparkles/shines. 2. The location cannot be beat. Less then five minutes leisurely walk to the Metro (4 Main lines), The Arc, in a beautiful neighborhood - many restaurants, shops, but still on a quite street. 3. The people are the most friendly I've ever met in a European hotel - everyone speaks English very well and they genuinely care and helped us with our questions about where to go during our visit, etc. 4. The price - We got the continental breakfast included, and it was a great choice! The food was amazing and very varied! It's not just a few bagels and milk. It's cheese, meat, hot-out-of the oven bread, honey, and so on. We had a flat-screen TV, small balcony to the street, and bar. It was excellent!! I had a wonderful time here, and know I will return to this hotel next time I'm in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more !”
Reviews.Author: Ninjatania
Reviews.Content: We arrived back last night from Paris after an excellent stay at the Royal Magda! I booked the trip as a surprise for my husband as he has never been to Paris before based on the trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. After booking I liased with Flore who advised me on things to do and at what cost they would be and what type of establishment. On deciding where to go Flore made all the bookings and secured us great tables. We enjoyed a great night out at the Bound Bar on the Trendy Champs Elysees and a champagne dinner at the Eiffel tower, which were perfect ways to end a romantic stroll around Paris. I cannot recommend The Royal Magda enough from the perfect position close to all the sites, great safe location, clean and fresh decoration and superb staff. I am going to Paris with my Mum in March and will definitely go back to The Royal Magda. If you are flying with Easi Jet from Luton Airport check before you go on the road works and travel situation as it took us over an hour to get from just outside the airport to the gate at 4am and we missed check in, the Easi Jet team were not helpful in this situation! It would have been helpful if Easi Jet could notify there customers of any possible travel problems involving the airport prior to travel seeing as they have a policy “If you are late we won’t wait”!!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel and the people who work there.”
Reviews.Author: Emil2007
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home two hours ago and this is one of the first things I wanted to do. Me and my wife had a wonderfull time at this hotel. I've been to many places around the world but I was very impressed with a few things about this hotel: 1)Service is excellent. Flore and Johahn in particular but everybody was very very nice and they went extra mile to make sure our stay was pleasant. (I still can't believe Johahn tried for 6 hours to Email me a 700Mb file with pictures). 2)Rooms and bathrooms are very clean. 3)Size of the rooms and bathrooms are relatively large for a hotel located in the heart of Paris 4)Location is excellent: Just a few steps to Chap's Elysee and the most important thing very close to the metro station with 4 different lines available. 5)Breackfast is more than enough and the coffee is fresh; 6)Price is very good for what you get. 7)Did I say that the service was excellent? I will reccomend this hotel to all my friends travelling to Paris. If there is somedody that doesn't like this hotel, that person doesn't like anything.

Reviews.Title: “Top Level Perfection”
Reviews.Author: CABeachBrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Royal Magda previously, and have come to expect a level of service second to none, and we were not disappointed this time, either. The rooms are large, lots of windows, there's a separate area for relaxing, room service was delivered hot and fresh to our door within 5 minutes of placing our order. The staff is professional, polished, not too familiar, perfect! I highly recommend this hotel to families, couples, and folks traveling solo. I shared experiences with several other guests, including a family and a single woman travelling alone, and they raved as much as I did. My husband and I will be back for our anniversary next year!! Do yourself a favor - if you want to simply enjoy Paris and not worry about your accomodation, book a room at this lovely hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Charming, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: melindubai
Reviews.Content: We had a brillant stay at this delightful hotel. The staff are extremely helpful and patient with our basic french!! The location is absolutely perfect...a quick walk to the metro station, the arc de triomphe and the Champs Elysees. There is a gorgeous bakery on the corner where we ate breakfast each morning....french pastries are delicious. The room was small but well appointed and furnished to a high standard. Highly recommended family or couple's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizziepbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum for three nights towards the end of July. We were put into room 112, which was cramped and I wonder if this was because we booked from the UK? The hotel was spotless, a great breakfast was served, and the staff we had dealings with were all very helpful. The location could not be better - a stone's throw from the Arc De Triomphe, a short walk to the metro and a 'nice' area. As two women we felt very comfortable walking around the streets near the hotel, although we didn't venture out late at night - we were too tired from all the sightseeing! I would definitely come back here, but would ask for a different, larger room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda did the job!”
Reviews.Author: shame510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon in France. This hotel was excellent. The room was a little small but it had a balcony and it was nice to sit out there. The bed was extremely comfortable, it called us every afternoon to take a nap. The hotel was very clean and I loved the updated decor. The staff were the most polite and friendly staff we encountered during our whole 2 week trip. The location is very close to the Arch de Triomphe. There are also many metro stops close by. I preferred the first hotel we stayed at (Hotel De Varenne) only because the location was better and it was easier to walk to many attractions. We did not have breakfast because like many other hotels, it was a bit pricey and it's better and cheaper to grab something on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Flore is the best !!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamW
Reviews.Content: Flore took care of our reservations and of our needs at the Magda Hotel and she is the best ! We just came back from spending 5 nights there and enjoyed it very much.The location was excellent ,and the service was superb. i would recommend this hotel to anyone !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Magda Etoile”
Reviews.Author: marcie5295
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for the location and the hotel itself. It is just a few short blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, which is a direct line to all of the other beautiful sights of Paris. It is also close to restaurants, cafes and neighborhood shops. The hotel itself was clean, very comfortable, and the staff was very helpful and courteous. We have stayed at other hotels in Paris, but the Royal Magda was the best experience of all. The rooms were modern, quiet, and the beds were comfortable. What more could you ask for? Oh yes, the price was also very reasonable, especially for Europe. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bookieboo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a night's stay at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel. The hotel is in a great location, as it is no more than two minutes walk from the Arc de Triumph and the nearest Metro station. We were lucky to be upgraded to a suite, which was very clean and comfortable, though maybe small by Western standards. The hotel was great value and exactly what we wanted for a weekend's stay in Paris. We would definitely use it again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Hotel Magda!”
Reviews.Author: PENNYTHEBEAST
Reviews.Content: I had confidence about this hotel from the reviews. There are many boutique hotels in the same area, most of them three star, all look inviting and lovely. However, I can only tell you about "Royal Magda" as that's where we slept for four nights. Traveling with two children we had a room/studio with a sofa bed for the kiddies and a queen bed for us. The rooms could however be completely closed off, if privacy was needed. The studio was lovely, very, very clean, inviting, perfect. Studio had mini bar, both rooms had TV's.........however, apart from CNN and BBC news, all the channels were French, no option to order movies. Where the Magda excelled (and we've stayed in some of the very best hotels in the world) was the concierge and service. Firstly, breakfast continued till noon, and without any extra cost you can have it served in your room. Its a continental breakfast, pastries, cold meats, cheeses, juices and hot drinks, very fresh, very yummy. Location, location, location, five mins to Champs Elysee and the Arch de Triomph. two mins to a McDonalds.........and the very delicious McFlurries (sorry). Across the street, there was a very unassuming Chinese restaurant. After eating lunch at The Jules Verne (Eiffel Tower) we popped in here for an "easy" dinner, it was in fact one of our best meals we had in all our travels (ouch!), a very good Chinese. The ladies and gentlemen at reception, all very helpful and professional. All very sweet to our girls. A calming influence on the whole hotel. The most amazing thing that I was delighted with, after being to Paris a handful of times prior. The Magda was quiet at night. Silent. One night some teenagers left there window open and were chatting......the noise did travel, but they were soon told to close their window and make good use of the A/C. I rated this hotel with the full five stars, because I found absolutely no fault in it. I thought it was a steal at the cost, a terrific find (thanks to Trip advisor), a perfect solution to enjoying Paris to it fullest! Bravo Hotel Magda.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LanceScotland
Reviews.Content: We've just returned today (30th July) from a 4 night break. We loved this hotel. Booked it up from trip advisor reviews and were pleased with the results. We had a club room on front of street, Paris rooms and lifts to floors are compact so do not expect lots of space, for us it was perfect. Very close by to Air France bus which we used from CDG airport which took around 45 mins. Lots of bistros, etc all around and easy walking distance to metros. Staff very helpful - just tell them what you're looking for and they'll help (even before your stay by e-mail)! We asked for a room on the front and yes it can be a bit noiser at weekends but soundproofing is good and actually we loved it, we felt very much part of it! Well worth a visit to this modern and perfectly formed small hotel. PS: breakfast is not included and is 12 euros per person - we actually just got breakfast out at local bakeries which cost us half the price, also bistros are cheaper to eat in than restaurants and try the specials of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: politetraveller21
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending 3 nights at Royal Magda ,I cannot help wondering if I stayed in the same hotel as some of the other reviewers! I booked this hotel because of all the positive reviews I read on Tripadvisor but my experience has left me somewh\t perplexed! Yes the hotel is spotlessly clean and the location is perfect but the Reception Staff ( Flore in particular) could not have been more unfriendly and unhelpful. The cleaning staff and breakfast staff were very friendly and polite and the gentleman on the reception desk at night was very helpful and obliging. The first problem arose when I asked Flore if she could suggest a restauramnt in the Pont Neuf area as we were gong on the Seine Cruise that evening and it departed from that area. I was amazed when her answer was "no" she did not know any restaurants in that area! Normally we would check out the net for restaurants but because I was led to believe that she was so helpful to other guests I decided to ask her. We eventually found our own restautant on the net! When we returned that evening I asked Flore if I could take a jug of iced water up to our room. She replied by asking me if I knew there was water in the minibar. Yes I did know but it was a jug of fresh water that I wanted and not bottled water as we had been drinking fresh water in the restaurants since we arrive. She returned with a litre bottle of water and said she would put it on our bill! She kept to her word and we were charged 3Euro on check out!
