The following evening I asked the night porter for the same jug of iced water and he duly obliged without hesitation! We are not loud or demanding customers and therefore I could not understand the indifference which we experienced. I have never felt so unwelcome in a hotel before and unfortunately although Paris was wonderful this experience has somewhat spoilt the memory. I was very angry when I returned home to discover my daughters were equally upset at our experience as they had arranged the trip for us to celebrate our wedding anniversary and had emailed the hotel to tell them this and to ask them if they could ensure that the trip was a good one. They recieved a reply from Yohan stating that they looked forward to welcoming us and would do their best to make our stay a pleasent one!!!!!! I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone in the future and when I return to Paris I am positive I will find an equally clean hotel with an equally good location but with a welcome! Just a few suggestions for anyone travelling to Paris. If you are taking a Seine Cruise the Vedettes du Pont Neuf are excellent and very good value. Two really good restaurants are Chez Clement (a chain of about 12 restaurants in various areas in Paris. We went twice to the one on the Champs Elysses and found excellend value and great food and if using the open top bus the Bus Rouge is great but the Open Bus (yellow one) is a bit dearer but stops in more places of interest to let passengers off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tfitzp
Reviews.Content: Like most other people on this site, we booked this hotel on the strength of the comments made by previous travellers - and like them were very happy with the choice we made. We spent 4 nights here at the beginning of July and without doubt one of it's great advantages is it's location - a few minutes walk from a Metro station and the Champs Elysees. We found all the staff very helpful and although the room was small, it was spotless. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the Rue Troyon, and the only negative we had was that it was a bit noisy due to late night music from one of the nearby buildings - not sure which one. Apart from that we would definately stay there again - but would ask for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnPAncaster
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Spotlessly clean; can't emphasize that enough. Good internet, which meant that we could keep in touch with our kids at camp in Canada... Elevator was small, as was our room and wc, but we slept in EVERY DAY, which my husband and I never do, and July sales were splendid and close, as was the Metro/RER, which was terrific--don't be afraid of the Metro...you won't believe how convenient it is!! Stayed 5 days here, and 5 at another (Guidebook-recommended, Latin Quarter) hotel, and missed the Royal Magda, and, in particular, the air conditioning, which many hotels in Paris do not have (if not advertised, it's not there!) There's a great cigar club just a few blocks away, with live music, and Rue Ternne has shopping (off the tourist radar) and patisseries not to be missed. --A. and P. from Ancaster, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lovely small Parisien hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ETolan
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great hotel - as others have said, the location was perfect and we only had one metro change on our way from Charles de Gaulle airport which left us almost on the corner of the street that the hotel was on - a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe. Check-in went smoothly, and the room was spotlessly clean and had all the comforts you would expect - mini bar, cable tv, spacious bathroom etc. The staff were friendly and able to give recommendations for nearby restaurants, and there were no problems leaving our bags after we had checked out, as our flight was in the evening. Breakfast was........ok. I just thought that E24 each was a bit steep for what you got. I know - its Paris and everything is expensive - but really, cereal/toast/croissants? I wasn't convinced it was good value. We tried it the first morning, but the second morning we went to one of the nearby cafes and had coffees and croissants while watching the world go by which is what being in Paris is all about! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely book again the next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: GranbyMike
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and to say that we were pleased is an understatement. It is a small property with small but spotless rooms. The beds were a little hard but comfortable. The elevator is tiny but that added to the charm of the place. Make sure breakfast is included in your rate. Their breakfast was perfect for beginning a day of touring. They had the requisite croissants and pastries (incredibly fresh and flaky), cold meats and cheeses, outstanding granola and juice and fruit along with tea and coffee. For location, you would be hard pressed to do better. It is on a side street only 2 blocks from the Arc De Triomphe and 3 blocks from Champs Elysses. It is surrounded by too many cafes to count and any amenity from ATM's to small markets you would need. And the staff was very friendly and helpful with special kudos to Flore who was a delight. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: taylormo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for walking or taking the metro, just a hop skip and jump from the Arc de Triumph! The staff was quite helpful and their English was good. The room was adequate in size, but smaller than Americans are used to. We had a balconly with a typcial Parisian view. We had free internet access, and later discovered that this is rare in other parts of Europe. The only negative was the tiny elevator, where you had to go up first, and then the staff sends your luggage! However, it was worth it to have a convenient, pleasant room. Our room fee did not include breakfast, and that was unusual as well, but there are many breakfast places nearby to get a baguette or roll as you are on your way. We very much enjoyed this hotel and hope to get to go back again some day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people,tiny everything”
Reviews.Author: doctorrod
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel which I booked based on the high reviews by Tripadvisor.The best thing going for this hotel is the location and front desk staff.The staff ( Yohan and Flo) are very nice and accomodating. They helped us with tour reservations, restaurants, etc. They also upgraded us one of the 3 nights we were there to a siute when I complained about the double room I had.The double room was basically a twin bed for 2.This I was supposed to share with a 14 year old teenager. Not a pretty site.This takes me to my main complaint: everything is tiny at this hotel. The rooms, the bathrooms, the elevator (no elevator to the 2nd floor) are all extremely small.If you are handicapped or extremely obese do not go here.As for me, I will look somewhre else next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: joy4me2travel
Reviews.Content: I made this booking based on TripAdvisor comments, and was not disappointed. The location cannot be beat - a quick walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro located beneath it. We were able to get anywhere in the city without a lot of transfers. Our room was large enough to manage our three adults (jr. suite) and we had absolutely no noice issues as we were located on the courtyard. I slept on the fold-out couch and didn't have any sleeping issues (except oversleeping twice and getting late starts). The bathrooms were seperated - toilet in one, and shower/sink in other. The front desk staff was helpful - especially Flor, who guided us to great dining, shops and attractions. She was quick to offer me coffee while I relaxed in the lobby, and even gave me an ice cream bar from her personal stash while helping my girls (both 18) find great deals on clothing and accessories. If you are looking for fancy, try somewhere else. If you are looking for value, location and comfort - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sgd73
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda is a charming little hotel just a few hundred metres from the Arc D'Triomphe and very close to the Charles De Gaulle Etoile Metro (and RER) station. Whilst the rooms (on the 3rd floor) are small, they are clean and nicely appointed, with modern bathrooms. The front desk staff are excellent; very friendly and helpful and the breakfast (continental) is quite good. Bear in mind if you have large suitcases that the lift is absolutely tiny, so a few trips might be necessary to get more than one person to the room:) In terms of close amenities, there is a little supermarket around the corner where you can buy cheap bottled water etc.. whilst the Restaurant (En Flamme) on Rue Wagram (across the street at the end of Rue Troyon) is exceptional! (Try the Roast Chicken or, for a real treat, the Steak Tartare). Whilst it's a fairly long (but enjoyable) walk along the Champ Elysees to other landmarks (The Louvre, The Seine, various Bridges, Notre Dame, Le Conciergerie etc..) the close Metro and RER station make travelling a breeze. We found that catching the train to Chatalet Metro station was the most convenient stop close to major landmarks. Overall, can definitely recommend the Royal Magda as a charming, boutique hotel which is easily accessible by foot or train to a lot that Paris has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “greatly overated”
Reviews.Author: kevincanada
Reviews.Content: This place was OK, the room was very small, but Im sure most are. the location was good, close to the Arc, but next time we will stay somewhere by Avenue St Germain, much more going on and a livlier atmosphere. The people at the hotel were no where near as friendly or helpful as some people on this site have claimed. They wouldnt call us a taxi to take us to the airport, we needed a replacement credit card sent to the hotel but when the company called they told them we didnt have a reservation, we obviously did and had to re order the card and got it on the last day, thanks guys for being on the ball! they charged us for a breakfast we didnt have. Very over rated, not sure why this so many people think this place is so great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but loud neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut-SanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and booked it based on TripAdvisor reviews. We loved the location. Very convenient to just about anything you want to do in Paris. The rooms are clean and the hotel itself is nice. I agree with some of the users regarding how loud the hotel is. Anytime anyone flushed a toilet on a floor above us, we could hear the water rushing through the pipes in our room and anyone walking or talking in the hall could be heard very clearly. Noise in any hotel is to be expected but why I rated this hotel so low is the loud neighbors. There is some sort of private club next door and every night between 12:00-1:00am there was incredibly loud music and cheering. Not fun to be startled out of a sound sleep every night. Ear plugs would not even keep out that kind of noise. Our experience might have been better if we had not been in a room sharing the same wall with the club next door. If you do stay here, ask for a room in the middle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Perplexing Front Staff”
Reviews.Author: jtimhall
Reviews.Content: Our family, (wife and I, both 50 yrs old), and our 3 adult daughters (24, 21 &20) just returned from Paris today, 7/07/2007 after a wonderful week's visit. We stayed at the Magda Etoile based upon Tripadvisor reviews. We have been to Paris two other times, staying at the Relais Christine, and the Lutetia. I must say right off that I was a little disappointed after the 'rave' reviews on Tripadvisor. The Royal Magda is indeed a very nice Hotel, but it is not a "top ten', or even 'top 20' hotel, unless you are a budget traveller. The rooms were very nice, and the bathrooms suitably large by European standards. The location is excellent, with many small typically Parisian restaurants nearby, and of course proximity to the Metro a great 'plus'. The 'service staff', particularly the cleaning crew, and the Breakfast staff are the nicest and most enthusiastic that I have ever met, in my many travels. However, the front desk is a 'hit and miss'. We had some issues with our daughters room, including a 'toilette' red light that blinked off and on every 2 seconds or so. This not only produced a noticeable light effect, (seen through the bedroom window), but also was responisble for a 'clicking' noise. When we brought this to the attention of the 'female' concierge, we were told to 'just close the door'. This was not an acceptable solution. In addition, when the in-room safe was not working, when brought to the attention of the same female concierge, on 2 separate days, nothing was done to fix the problem. It required a more 'forceful' interaction on the day prior to our departure to get a response. Having said this, all of the other individuals we encountered were more than helpful, and very nice. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels over the years, many suggested by Tripadvisor, (GrandBretagne in Athens last June), and while i can endorse the Royal Magda, and would stay there again, it is not a 'top 10' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrowneDublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed only one night at this hotel. I wish we could have stayed longer. We had 2 rooms one standard & one junior suite. both were really clean & comfortable. the only difference between them was their size. the junior suite had a sofa & better closet space. the junior room also overlooked the courtyard. the staff are very friendly & helpful. the breakfast was really nice with more than enough to choose from and all very fresh. the location is great as well beside the Arc de Triomphe & Champs Elysee. The metro stop is just at the end of the street which was very convenient I would definitely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tissie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great Paris find --- it is located near the Arc and convenient to a subway stop. While the hotel rooms are small, they are very clean, nicely decorated and bathrooms are modern. The staff is accomodating and helpful. Unlike some of the other comments, we did have the hotel breakfast each morning and found it to be very nice. On our next trip to Paris, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Hotel Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: PineTree123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Hotel Royal Magda. We choose this hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews and I am very thankful we did! The location, price, rooms and service were all great! This is a small hotel but has all the amenities you might need for a trip to Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel. Close to the metro, sights, good food and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - strongly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveller38
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults & 2 kids) stayed here for one night in early June 2007, and really liked it. The location (beside the Arc de Triomphe) is perfect. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The family room, we were in, was very spacious by Paris standards. And the price was good too! Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Aust
Reviews.Content: On the basis of tripadvisor reviews and the location (close to Air France bus stop) we stayed here briefly in May. We checked in early after a long haul flight from Australia and were upgraded as our room was not ready. the suite was excellent; quiet, clean, light, tastefully furnished. the beds were comfortable, the staff pleasant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: mia888
Reviews.Content: On the strength of the previous reviews, my husband and I booked the hotel for 8 nights in June for the French Open. We must say that the raving reviews were true and we found the hotel and its staff lived up to our expectation. The room is small but there is enough space to meet basic requirements. The bathroom is impressive and the shower is comforting. Free internet access is a gem and was what we needed most for our particular trip. Yohan speaks perfect English and was most helpful. The location could not be better with the nearby metro station and numerous choices of buse lines. We did not sample the hotel breakfast as there are supermarkets, fruit markets, fast-food and a large number of restaurants in the neighbourhood. The Air France bus from the airport stops in the next street and is most convenient to us even with heavy luggage. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and consider it good value for money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueJenkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for 4 nights for my birthday after reading the wonderful reviews and were somewhat disappointed with the Royal Magda. Having stayed there, it is a good value hotel, which was clean and in an excellent location. The rooms were very small and the bathroom tiny . We were on the fourth floor and could hear the family in the next rooms. There were only 3 pillows so had to take turns for the third pillow, the area to store all your clothes was extremely small and the space between the bed and the furniture and walls was so limited that it was difficult for the two of us to pass each other and we are not particularly big! Location: excellent. A short distance from the from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. This was the best feature of the hotel, in our opinion. Customer Service: Johan was very friendly and helpful although when I booked the hotel - their website stated that there was a late checkout facility, when we asked we were informed that we had to be out of our room by 12.30 at the latest. I asked the night clerk if there was somewhere we could wash and change before leaving for the airport and we were told 'no', although when we asked Johan again when checking out he did say we could use the toilets on the ground floor. Extras: We did not try the 12 euro/day breakfast, as there were very good brasseries in the local area. The lift was small, and only really held one person and a suitcase or two adults. I'd recommend the Royal Magda for budget travellers looking for a clean hotel for a good price. I just can't give this hotel the rave reviews that everyone else has. It wasn't one of the best hotel experiences we've had. Just a recommendation for other travellers staying here - try the Bistro Du 17 restaurant which is probably about 10 minutes walk away at 108 avenue de villiers. A excellent three course meal with a bottle of wine between two people is 34 euros per per person and is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “truely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lolaandfelix
Reviews.Content: I must say this hotel was quite a disappointment compared to the accolades received on tripadvisor. There was no help with the luggage to the room, elevator was tiny, and could fit one person and one piece of luggage. My room was so small, I could barely move around. The shower stall was also very small. The location was out of the way for all my activities. I was just totally disappointed with the whole experience. I would never stay at this hotel again. The only positive thing about the hotel was the air conditioning, it worked and it was adapted to each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: c4948
Reviews.Content: Location - Walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe, Champps Elysees, and metro stations. Relatively quiet streets after 11:00PM. Accommodations - normal size rooms for the area that were very clean with a large bathroom that had sparkling tile and facilities. Food - breakfast was a buffet with cereals, meats, cheeses, fruit, breads and pastries. It included juice, coffee, and tea. It was very attractive and fresh. Service - Very accommodating staff with restaurant recommendations, walking directions as needed, luggage service and any thing we asked for. All spoke english very well and were pleasant to talk to. Price/value - competitive with other similar class hotels that we looked at. The value was excellent due to the service and accommodations provided.

Reviews.Title: “Another Positive Review”
Reviews.Author: Kona05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Madga Etoile for three night from 5/27. We arrived around 9am, but the room was not ready as expected, so they offered to keep the luggage while we enjoy the sightseeing in Paris. After returning in the afternoon, they upgraded us to the Jr. Suite from the Club room, which was spacious and delightful. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, however, we enjoyed having their coffee in the morning for 3.5euros when we get up in the early morning (jetlag) as we realized most local restaurants are closed until 8~9am. Their coffee is more "American" style with generous portion as compared to all other hotels/restaurants we've visited during our entire trip. The coffee that we had in our room was served in a tray with a cup and a single-serving pot that was nice and hot. One day, we left our room around 8am for breakfast across the street and returned a little before 9am. As we walk toward our room, we noticed our door was open for room cleaning. Since we needed to get ready for our plan for the day, we were going to ask her to leave the room as is, but she said the room is already cleaned and she was just getting ready to leave. As we went inside the room, I could not believe how efficiently she had cleaned and organized the room! I mean, when we left, our room was a complete mess - shoes, socks, shirts, books, coins, sunglasses, candy wraps all over the place - as we were going to clean up ourselves after coming back from our breakfast. She managed to fold our clothes, stack books, arrange shoes, neatly put sunglasses and coins on the table, etc. As embarassing as it was, she did an amazing job and we were extremely impressed. In-room refrigerator was very convenient. We put some cheese and wine that we had bought from the nearby supermarket. The available English TV channels were CNN International and BBC World, but six other hotels we stayed during our France trip had only CNN if any, and it really didn't matter to us anyway because after a long day of exploring, we were dead tired and went to bed early right after coming back from dinner. Overall, we enjoyed staying at Royal Magda Etoile and definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for affordable, friendly , English-fluent hotel with convenient Metro access .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadianseh101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda for 3 nights at the beginning of June and I must say it was even better than I had expected. The room we were in was on the 4th floor and although the elevator was small it was adequate. The room was small but clean, the bathroom was nice and freshly re-modeled, all we needed was there. Size doesn't really matter because we didn't come to Paris to sit in our hotel room all day, it was just a place to crash. We did find the breakfast a bit pricey for what we got, 12 euros each was a lot, though the coffee was great and it gave us a good start to our day of touring. Staff very polite and accomodating. Front desk staff were very helpful on all of the shifts, recommending restaurants to go to and giving directions to sites that we wanted to see. One of the best features about this hotel is the location, couldn't get better for this price!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Average Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: jasonmarsell
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat disappointed with the Royal Magda. I have to be honest...when I read all of the wonderful reviews, I thought this would be one of the best hotels in Europe. Having stayed there, it is a great value, but nothing to write home about. I'm still scratching my head that the Royal Magda won a "Traveler's Choice" award. Rooms: We switched rooms midway through the stay, to get a higher, quieter room. The street noise from the first floor is definitely noticeable, and the hotel is very old - you will know exactly when the folks above you are up and about. The rooms were small, as we expected, and there was a very heavy smell of smoke. (Not a big surprise in Paris) The bathroom was very clean, yet the shower had a door that only extended 1/2 way, so the bathroom kept getting soaked. Not a big deal, just not expected in such a highly rated hotel. Location: Fantastic. Two blocks from the Charles de Gaulle Etoile station, on the metro. A stone's throw from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. This was the best feature of the hotel, in our opinion. Customer Service: Johan and Flor were very friendly and accommodating. The night desk clerk was somewhat pushy and unfriendly. We wanted directions to a laundrette, and all he'd tell us was how to use their (expensive) cleaning service. Extras: We opted out of the 12 euro/day breakfast, as there were way to many brasseries in the local area. The lift was small, but worked great when lugging us up to the fifth floor. Oh, and the TV carried two English stations: BBC and CNN. It would've been great to have a non-news English station, for winding down at bedtime. Finally, I noticed in many of the other reviews for the Royal Magda, the reviewers had been given a free upgrade to a Junior Suite. I'm almost curious if this didn't skew the reviews, slightly. We weren't upgraded, so maybe our experience was a bit different than others. I'd recommend the Royal Magda for budget travelers looking for a clean hotel for a good price. I just can't give this hotel the rave reviews that everyone else has. It wasn't one of the best hotel experiences we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Yoiu Won't be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ReitredTraveller
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend the Royal Magda to the many travelers who have previously had a “bad” experience in a Parisian hotel. Rest assured that your stay here will be a memorable one for all the right reasons. I am a retired Travel Agent and I have had the luxury of staying in a number of fine hotels all over the world. I selected this property based on the number of excellent reviews I found here on the Trip Advisor site. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel lives up to and even surpasses its reputation. It offers exceptional value for the money. While we were there in May the majority of guests were repeat European vacationers and business people who clearly knew that the Royal Magda was a “gem.” The staff are pleasant, helpful, and knowledgeable. The rooms are quiet and well maintained. The mattresses are firm and comfortable. The hotel is easy to find and within easy walking distance of a number of attractions and the safe and inexpensive subway is very close by when needed. Remember Paris is a city for strolling and sightseeing. The European style breakfast was excellent with a variety of choice and excellent coffee. In all I cannot think of anything that needs to be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: We recently had a one night fantastic stay at this classy hotel. Our journey began in Atlanta with a flight to Paris through Boston. We arrived in Paris after a cramped Air France flight where I wore the seat in front of me in my lap for six hours. Exhausted, we arrived at the hotel at 8:00 a.m. and was advised (not surprisingly) that our junior suite was not ready. I asked if we could leave our bags at the desk while we wait for the room. To our delight, Flore upgraded us to a suite and checked us in immediately. We went to sleep until noon and then had a full restful day in Paris. Without this gesture, we would have been tired throughout the day. A class act from this hotel. The hotel is absolutely spotless - not a crumb any place we looked. The furnishings are nice and comfortable. The bathroom and shower were great and I only made a tiny mess. The location is a quick walk from the AirFrance Bus stop and a stone's throw from the Arc de Triumphe. The hotel arranged dinner reservations for us at Cafe de L'Homme with a great view of the Eiffel tower at dusk. Outside the restaurant is the absolute best view of the Eiffel Tower. How about some Travelduck (Le Travelduck) tips for you? 1. Take the AirFrance Bus from CDG to the Arc de Triumphe stop. I suggest you 'Google Earth' the hotel location. You will see the AirFrance buses and know your exact route to the hotel from the bus. Follow that tip and you will not get lost. If you are flying Delta from Atlanta or Boston, the bus stop at CDG is right outside baggage claim. Cost is 20 euro rt per person. 2. Cafe de L'Homme was great but not all tables have an Eiffel Tower view. It was raining so we could not sit outside and there are only about 2-3 tables right near the window. I guess my wife and I were not chic enough to get one of those tables but it was still a great dinner. 3. Take the boat rides down the Seine River - save some walking and enjoy the ride. 4. Get to the Eiffel Tower very early (like 8:30 a.m.) if you want to go to the top. Lines are very long! 5. Enjoy a nice crepe during your stay in Paris. Be careful because the crepes are very hot when handed to you. The rude guy making my crepe (he told me to zip it after I repeated my order) shoved the crepe in my hand and made me spill my coffee. I left it there (bad duck). 6. If you have a five hour layover in chilly Boston (like us), do not drag your wife all over the city searching for a crabcake sandwich. It will make a rough start to your trip - lucky we were going to Paris which ended the bad mood quick! Have a great stay at the Royal Magda and in Paris. I highly recommend it. Contact me for any further advise!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GapRancher
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The rooms are very clean. The staff is very professional, yet very friendly and accomodating of service requests. The location is superb....one block to Metro station and two blocks from Arc de Triumph, and on a very quiet side street. A taxi stand is also two blocks away. There are many good restaurants in the area. The fixed fee breakfast is the best we had in two weeks of travel for the same price as others charged, and English language newspapers are available each morning for free. The TV also has English channels for news (CNN and BBC). If it had an English movie channel as well it would be even better, but not to complain.

Reviews.Title: “The Cleanest Hotel-Will Stay Again If Come To Paris”
Reviews.Author: TurkishTripper
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel in May 2007 with my wife and 4-year child. I've decided to book in here after reading magnificent feedbacks. The position of the hotel is great. 1/2 minute to Arc De Triomphe, 2 mins to the start of Champs-Elysee. I've come to here from Disneyland directly with no train-change. I have to say that it's the cleanest hotel I've ever seen. The bathroom is shining. There is wired high speed free internet connection. If you don't have network cable, the reception gives you one. The breakfast are OK for my family. As we have stayed in Junior Room, the space is very enough for us. There is a safe in the room. The onyle extraordinary thing was the doors have classical keys which you have to lock. But this gives extra reliability other than electronic cards:) Everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position In Paris”
Reviews.Author: emmaAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda for 8 days in May and booked this hotel based on the mountains of positive reviews on this site. We were very pleased that we listened to our wise 'travel-advisors' because the hotel exceeded our expectations. Firstly, it is in a wonderful spot - very close to the metro and you could throw a 'euro' and hit 'The Arc'. Of course it is very, very, very touristy....but then we were tourists after all..although sometimes I had difficulty finding a french person amongst the throngs of Americans and Japanese...could be a turn-off to some. The staff were lovely - so helpful, the rooms were lovely and well-appointed(and not a bad size - I've had smaller in New York). The breakfast was also worth it - for us anyway. Yes 12 euro sounds alot (we had to convert to Australian dollars - so it is a PAINFUL process) but it was worth every cent...my husband putaway 3 coffees, cereal and 4-5 pastries every morning which would have set us back alot more than 12 euros on the street. The breakie is on until midday (and they don't seem to mind if you slip back later in the morning for another cup of coffee) and they will deliver it to your room if so desired. My only criticism (and it is a bit sad) is that the only english speaking channel was CBS (or some other American cable news program) - they had 2 great movie channels.. dubbed into French. Just one movie channel - even with subtitles would've been nice. Although France did elect a new President whilst we were there and due to the limited TV options we came home experts in French politics!!! Overall a great little boutique hotel that I would and already have recommended (to my parents for there next trip to Europe.) HOpe this is helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Is Always A Good Idea”
Reviews.Author: IndyTraveler007
Reviews.Content: My son and I sent our Spring Break in Paris. For both of us it was an unforgettable experience. The staff at Hotel Royal Magda helped make that experience even more special. They were always helpful with direction or diner recommendation. The hotel itself was clean and well maintained. It is very cozy which we did not mind since we spent most of our time exploring Paris. We were only a few blocks from a centralized Metro station directly under the Arc de Triomphe. When our daughter is a little older we will definitely come back. Thank You Flore!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked Royal Magda Etoile”
Reviews.Author: tenpmix
Reviews.Content: We booked the Royal Magda Etolie based on the excellent reviews that are posted on tripadvisor and so it is only right that I share a negative experience about this hotel. We booked our room months in advance and on the way to the airport I received a phone call from the hotel to say they had double booked our room and would move to a nearby hotel as it was easier to move a young couple than a family. To be fair they were very helpful we stayed a few streets away in thepleasant Hotel Balmoral and made up the difference in the room rate per night and offered us complimentary breakfast at the Magda Etoile. We had a great trip to Paris all considered but would have preferred not to have lost the first hour of our holiday being relocated and stressing on the plane about where we would be staying that night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelpink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 1st - 4th May for a girly getaway with my Mum and this was the perfect hotel. Hotel was so easy to find being just 2 streets away from the Air France pick up/drop off stop. We checked in at 10am without a problem. The room was spotless, yes as previously stated the rooms are very small but for the amount of time you spend in them they are perfect. The room had a mini bar which we emptied out onto the dresser and removed the shelves so we could keep water and more importantly wine in and the staff never had a problem with this as it was all put back as it was before we checked out! The water pressure in the shower is superb, it really blasts the cobwebs away. The staff are brilliant, they speak excellent english and couldn't be more helpful. Location wise you couldn't ask for much better 2 min walk from the Metro, the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and the Le Cars Rouge stop if you want an open top bus tour! The only negative point I would comment on is the fact that mirrors are positioned so far away from the wall sockets, so it's quite awkward if your using straightners/curling irons, we solved the problem by putting the mirror on the chair. One tip I would give is to do the Arc de Triomphe at night as the night views of the city are spectacular and in my opinion better than the Eiffel tower!! I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and if I return to paris will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Mo_Auckland
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 weeks travelling around France and this was our favourite Hotel. We had a suite which was perfect for 2 adults and 2 children and at 213 Euro/night was great value. The hotel is very cute and has that certain appeal that large chain Hotels can never get. The lift is tiny and takes 3 at a squeeze, but does the job. Location is great being about 100m from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. It can be an expensive area to eat out around here. Would definitely go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: gustotobie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from spending 5 nights at the Royal Magda in a club room with large bed. The room was a bit smaller than we had expected but very comfortable and the ammenities certainly made up for the size. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful with everything from directions to dinner recommendations...all of which were very good. Yohan was a lifesaver in assisting us with the necessary phone calls when we discovered our America Express card was lost. Thanks to Yohan, our vacation was saved! We loved the Royal Magda and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience.”
Reviews.Author: CaptCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Magda Etoile for 3 nights in April of 2007. The staff is friendly and responsive, and the room we had - and the hotel in general - is nicely decorated. We were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival, which was a nice surprise. The room was still a bit on the small size, but then I looked at the floorplan for the entire floor, and realized that we'd really lucked out. The standard rooms are very, very small. If you can afford it, go for a junior suite at minimum. As well, the location of the hotel is excellent - only 1.5 blocks away from a key metro station. It also doesn't hurt that when you emerge from the metro station the first thing you see is the Arc du Triomphe! Very nice. One complaint that I have is that one of the staff talked us out of going to the Moulin Rouge in favour of the Lido. The Lido show was absolutely terrible - I've subsequently heard that the Moulin Rouge is much better - and we couldn't help but wonder if the recommendation was based on pocketing a larger "referral fee" from Lido when she booked our tickets. It was a fairly big issue to us, because the Lido show cost us 200 Euros, for an embarrasingly amaturish and tedious evening. We expected better advice from the hotel staff. All that said, that unfortunate incident does not stop us from giving the hotel 5/5. Just do yourself a favour and do your own trip research on Paris before going, because you won't be able to count on unbiased advice in a tourist oriented city like Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: MariusStrydom
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Royal Magda on 17 and 18 April and had a really amazing time. The hotel has an excellent position, within 150m from the Arc de Triomphe. Great if you have a baby stroller. We had a family room and had our seven year-old and seven month-old sons staying with us. The room was large and perfect for our needs. The staff were great and went out of our their way to help us with all our needs. I would really like to commend Thibault and his team. The lack of stars (only 3) has nothing to do with a lack of quality, but more due to a lack of extras (that you often don't use in any case). We will most certainly be back as a family and I will also use the hotel if I come to Paris on business. Marius Strydom

Reviews.Title: “Best location, staff, and price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AdamZach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a five night stay at Royal Magda and loved the entire experience. Juliette, Flore and Johan were the people at the hotel who made our visit so enjoyable. The hotel is a stone's throw from the Arc d' Triomphe and the beautiful city of Paris is right beneath you!

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: kjplanb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel on the 19th of April. We were originally going to stay for two nights, but due to bad weather in the states we had to cancel our first night. The staff at this hotel is excellent and very accommodating! We canceled at last moment and they said they would try to rent out the room. They were not able to do this, but without even asking they upgraded us at no extra charge to a beautiful suite. It was clean, comfortable and had all the charm of Paris. The location is perfect. Flore (one of the front desk staff) is like having your own personal guide. If we got lost or had questions, we simply called Flore and she gave us perfect directions and recommendations in English that was superb. The location could NOT be better. The Metro is a minutes walk from the hotel. The breakfast was fabulous and I am looking forward to another stay at this hotel. We fell in love with Paris and we fell in love with the Hotel Royal Magda Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Handy Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob82SantaFeNM
Reviews.Content: Comfortable small hotel on quiet street in historic building adjacent to the Arc de Triomphe. Desk personnel excellent and informative. Well appointed room with hotel safe. Excellent breakfast buffet. Within walking distance of Eiffel Tower and easy Metro transport to tourist attractions in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beeny630
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda April 9th to the 11th and had a wonderful time in Paris. We stayed in a club room-large bed and we were very pleased. The price was reasonable and our room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the shower had great water pressure. Location was great - the hotel was off the beaten path just enough to be a nice quiet location but still only a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Elysees and access to the Metro to go anywhere else in the city. Staff was very friendly and helpful- our arrival to Paris was early in the morning and our room was not quite ready, but Flore was kind enough to let us leave our bags at the hotel while we went sightseeing (did the same on the day we were leaving because our return flight was late and we still had more sights we wanted to see). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris and we will certainly stay here again if we ever had the opportunity to see Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigT71
Reviews.Content: Well the reviews cover it all really: Great Location Quiet enough Small Lift (big Deal!) Small Rooms (cant complain for the price in Paris) Great Service We stayed 8 nights from 13th April and had a great time. The room was comfortable as was the bed, it was well decorated, very clean and modern with a small flat screen TV. Only a couple of English channels but you don't really go to Paris to watch TV! Flore and Yohan at reception were exceptional. They provided me with lots of restaurant recommendations before arrival and made bookings for me, i drove them mad but they were always happy to help. I cant recommend this hotel highly enough and when i return to Paris I will stay there, well deserving of its ratings on Trip Advisor. A big thanks to Flore and Yohan!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: N.Davies
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews on Tripadvisor, we choose Hotel Royal Magda. The hotel is convenient for the Metro and RER line at Charles de Gaule Etoile, which is a five minute walk. You do not need to be overly energetic to walk to the Champes Elysee, and the Eiffel Tower is probably twenty minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is small with no more than 40 rooms. The rooms are in turn small but comfortable and very clean. The hotel resides in a side street just of the main boulevard Wagram which helps reduce noise etc. The price is very reasonable and we enjoyed our stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: britmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda for 2 nights. It was a great location, within 2 minutes walk of the L'Arc du Triomphe and the Metro. Being so close to the top of the Champs Elysee I had expected traffic noise - but the hotel is located down a side street and the area was very quiet. We are a family with 2 young children so we booked the family suite - one king bed and a pullout sofa bed. This worked well for us - our children are 7 and 10 - but may be limiting for older children. The staff, in particular Sebastian and Flore, were extremely helpful and the hotel and our room was very clean. There are plenty of places to eat around this area at reasonable prices. The only downside to this hotel is parking-the street parking is very tight. If you are flying into Paris avoid driving at all costs and use the excellent Metro system - it makes life much easier. As it was our first time in Paris and time was limited we hired a guide for the day, Michael Osman, (---) and he was excellent. Very knowledgable, great with the kids and took us everywhere we wanted to go and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrcarlisle
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and was not dissapointed. It's everything previous visitors say it is, a special thanks to Flore who went out of her way to help. Would reccomend this hotel for your visit to Paris. We had heard about the rude French people, don't you believe that, we went all over Paris by subway and bus visited lots of shops, restrurant, markets and verious other places. Everyone was nice and eager to help which was a great help in our visit. While we were there April 9th to 15th. Melvin Carlisle

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Red123London
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda Etoile is situated very close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and it is within walking distance of most of the major attractions. The nearest metro station was the Charles de Gaulle Etoile, which made it easy to get to anywhere that wasn't within easy walking distance. It's true that the lift is small and our room was also on the small side but as we didn't spend a lot of time there this was not a problem. The walls were thin but we weren't particularly bothered by noise from our neighbors or from the street outside, which was reasonably quiet. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower was powerful. We didn't make use of the breakfast facilities but it was available until 12:00. I would recommend the Royal Magda for anyone visiting Paris and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: phelan24647
Reviews.Content: Booked the Royal Magda based on feedback from a work colleague plus reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. I was in Paris with my wife and my three yr old son. We booked a Club room with large bed and I was concerned that the room might be too small but it was perfect. As other reviewers have said, location is excellent, near Metro and RER to disneyland, plus its very close to a supermarket, fast food joints and cafes. We did'nt avail of breakfast in the hotel but tried Jacques on the corner of Rue Troyon and Avenue MacMahon and also Cafe Lateral on Ave MacMahon for breakfast. As we'd been to Paris before, we did'nt need to rely on the staff for advise but I'd echo other reviewers in saying how efficient they were when dealing with them. highly recommend this hotel and will be using it again when in Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Review Are All True- Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: This is my first time going on blind faith in the Tripadvisor reviews and I am so impressed! This hotel was very fresh and clean, spacious by Paris standards (we had a junior suite), and wonderfully located. The absolutely BEST thing about this property is those who work there!!!!! So incredibly kind and nice, not to mention perfect English speakers! Flora was amazing and even booked our dinner reservations and detailed my daughter's food allergies. She also typed this out for me in French so that we would have it everywhere during our stay. I will not go back to Paris if I don't stay there. I stayed in Paris 15 years ago and had a polar oppposite experience at my hotel. When we went downstairs on Easter morning the hotel had bags of chocolate for our kids. When we got back to our hotel housekeeping had left a leather box full of chocolate Easter eggs tied in a ribbon - only in Paris! It made our stay so relaxed and fun! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip from heaven”
Reviews.Author: AdelitaManchester
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Paris as a birthday surprise mid march 2007 and booked the Magda due to the great reviews I'd seen on here. When I called I mentioned that it was a special occasion and was overjoyed when we checked in to find we had been upgraded free of charge to the best suite in the hotel. Our time in Paris would have not been half as amazing had it not been for the marvellous service we received in the hotel. Johan was beyond helpful and got us a table in a wonderful restaurant overlooking the Seineand Eiffel Tower, when we stepped out of the taxi Johan had called for us we were beneath the Eiffel Tower that was sparkling with lights and lasers, it truly took our breath away and we would never have known to go here or been able to get a table ourselves. Johan offered to get tickets for a show but we didn't have long in Paris and they were quite expensive so we decided to leave it for another time. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. This isn't a super trendy stylish hotel but it's was perfect for our intimate weekend away. Breakfast was lovely,not a bacon and eggs type affair but most importantly for me good quality coffee served in nice pots and a selection of cheeses, pastries, cereal and dried fruit/yogurt. We only ate breakfast in the hotel but when we came home from our meal we had cocktails in the bar with snacks and talked to the lovely night concierge who made our drinks and was really friendly and interesting. Much to our embarassment and inspite of the fact I studied French til A-Level and was once quite good at it we were beyond appauling when it came to speaking French, thankfully we were put to shame by the impeccable English spoken by Johan and his colleague on the night shift and pretty much every person we came into contact with. Nobody lived up to the snooty Parisian stereotype we were so hoping not to encounter on our first venture over the Channel. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and we found the location to be ideal for getting to pretty much everywhere by foot, we only needed transport to and from the airport and for me in my stilettos on our big night out, other than that we walked everywhere. Our return flight was not until late in the evening and we were able to leave our luggage safe all day whilst we saw more of Paris which was a weight off our minds and shoulders. We both agreed that the service we received was without a doubt the best, and most personalised service we have ever received in a hotel. Without Johan's advice and help we could have ended up having a very different experience so we really do owe the success of our trip to him as he made my partner's birthday such a memorable one in many ways. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy we booked the Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: chris65NewYorker
Reviews.Content: My family of six, including three children and one senior, stayed at this great little hotel in late March through early April. It was a wonderful value for the money. We have only good things to say...the staff was patient and friendly (despite my rambunctious kids), the rooms were immaculate, and the location was fantastic. The Air France bus from the airport drops you off just two blocks away. The Metro is also two short blocks away, and the Arc/Champs De Elysee is right there. And if you're on a budget, try the restaurant right on the corner...have forgotten the name already, but it was a cafeteria-style restaurant with a price of 9.6 euro for a hot entree, drink, and dessert. You'll pass it on your way to and from the metro.The food is fine and the atmosphere is perfect if you're with kids, as it's a casual place with a relatively high tolerance for noise. Yes, the rooms (and elevator) are small compared to American standards, but aren't they all in Paris? Thank you, Yohan! The Vercelletto Family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, like advertised”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Magda Etoile is great! I read these reviews while planning my trip, and the hotel did not let me down. It's small, but cozy and high quality. The front desk staff is excellent, again as advertised. Fleur, in particular was very sweet and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Chester100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Magda for 6 nights in late March early April 07. The location is excellent, being only a few minutes walk from the metro station (from which you can easily explore all of Paris' attractions), the Champs Elysees, the Arch de Triumph and plently of cafes and restaurants. The staff are very helpful, accomodating and courteous and they all speak English very well (which was great because my French is terrible). We stayed in a club room on the fourth floor, which consisted of 2 single beds. The room is very small (which is standard for Europe) but very clean, comfortable and quite adequate considering the very reasonable price. The room had a view of the street below and apartments opposite, and considering the central location of the hotel there was not a lot of noise. My partner did notice noise coming through the wall of neighbouring rooms, but this was minor. We had breakfast at the hotel, which consisted of coffee or tea (bottomless cup), cereals, fruit, cold cuts and an assortment of pastries. The breakfast costs extra, and although it seemed a bit expensive it was convenient and plentiful. However, we did notice quite a few cafes serving breakfast nearby, which looked like they would be viable options. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: CALove2travel23
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day stay at the Royal Magda. The hotel is modern and sophisticated in terms of decor. We were greeted by a friendly staff who seemed to be friendly to tourists who speak English. We stayed in a double room, which was small in comparison to the average American room, but quite cosy and included free internet access, a flat screen t.v. and a wonderful bathroom, equipped with a nice shower. Additionally we found the balcony to offer a wonderful respite and peek into parisian life. The street the Royal Magda is located on, is quiet but within walking distance to the Arc de Triumph, Champs-Elysees and the Metropolitan stop. Overall, for the value, there is nothing better. This hotel offers the best in amenities at a great location. Au revoir

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: MicaBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 07' with my husband and young children and would recommend it for most travellers. The hotel undoubtedely has a fantastic location - literally turn the street corner and your faced with the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is small, well run and clean with staff who are very helpful and pleasant. We booked a Junior Suite which was spacious with a large double bed and a very comfortable sofa bed. Unfortunately the rooms look out onto a small court yard but considering the price and the location, its not a big deal. The only other details that may need to be taken into consideration is that the lift is tiny and therefore more than one trip may be required for luggage/ prams etc. and the walls are a little on the thin side but these are very insignificant gripes when taking into account all the many positives the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good vist at the Magda”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for two nights in March and had a very good visit. We had a larger club room (#312), which was very nice, good size, and a very good sized bathroom. The bathroom came equipped with nice towels, and tioletries. The service at the front desk was fantastic every day just like listed on the website by other guests. We did not however try the breakfast, so could not comment on that. The hotel is in a good location on a quieter street just behind the Arc, with very easy metro access one block away (easy walking distance). There were numerous restaurants and pastry shops close by. Only feedback was the room was a little smokey and you could hear everything in the next room compared to any other hotel we have stayed at in Paris. As well, not sure if it was just our room, but we could hear water running non stop throughout the day. It almost sounded like a leak in the walls, and was quite annoying at times. If not for these two items, would of given it a 5, but would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Czman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for 2 nights. The hotel is in a very good location. Just one block from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. Our room was very nice. We even had a small balcony and a window that could be opened. As Paris was having some very warm sunny weather the open windows were nice...especially at night. I failed to get his name, but the night concierge was very nice and helpful. We had an unbelieveably early wake up to catch a flight and he secured a taxi for us. I think staying at the Royal Magda Etoile is well worth the money. The location is very good. In fact, 3 or 4 blocks behind the hotel is a very good outdoor market with fresh foods and wine. Cheryl and Dorie

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magda”
Reviews.Author: americanindijon
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Royal Magda Etoile for a few nights at the end of February. The first thing I liked was the location. It is so close to the Arc de Triomphe and the rest of the main sites in Paris that it saved a lot of travel time when we headed out to see the city. The front desk staff was extremely nice, very friendly and helpful. Also, the room looked exactly as it did on the hotel's website. It is the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Paris. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Relton14
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights for my wife’s birthday based on the reviews on this site and was not disappointed. On arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room which set the tone perfectly. The rooms were good size but most importantly spotless. The bathrooms were immaculate and the rooms had all the basic facilities. Although the hotel is not bang in the heart of the tourist areas ie. Latin Quarter, St Germain, Eiffel Tower etc, its proximity to the underground means it really doesn’t make that much of a difference as the nearest underground station is quite a large one and services the bulk of the tourist areas in a matter of minutes plus the area around the hotel is very good as well (2 min walk to Arc De Triumph). In addition to the quality of the hotel, the staff were amazingly helpful. Flore, who was on reception for most of the time we were there, helped us immensely, particularly by recommending some fantastic restaurants for the night of my wife’s birthday as I would have been lost otherwise. She was helpful to a fault and always happy which makes a big difference to guests. Given the value, quality of staff and location I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: LawyermanNewYork
Reviews.Content: I just came back from 4 days in Paris with my wife and 2 teenage boys, and I must say, the hotel was much better than I expected. We had 2 rooms next to each other on the 6th floor, and fearing the worse (because I had heard horror stories about Parisian hotels), I was really happy to find 2 very clean and comfortable rooms. The hotel was in an excellent location, and the staff was wonderful...they made all of our restaurant reservations, and arranged for a birthday cake for my wife. We will certainly stay there on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “This is why you're on tripadvisor...”
Reviews.Author: nroffman
Reviews.Content: You're reading this because you are looking for a great hotel at a reasonable price... The Royal Magda will not let you down. My wife and I and our two very young children (2,1) just returned from a week's stay at the Royal Magda, and it was a fantastic hotel. Johan is becoming famous, among the other talented employees at the hotel, precisely because he actually belongs in the hospitality industry, and is so extremely helpful. The rooms are nice, the neighborhood has nice bistros and bakeries very close to the hotel, and the metro is a block away. Basically, just trust this site - there's a reason so many people have written so glowingly about this place. Go and have a great time in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and comfortable stay - first time in paris”
Reviews.Author: kalide
Reviews.Content: Booked through venere.com at an excellent rate, we arrived sans baggage thanks to US Airways misconnects but our disappointment with our luggage quickly eroded when we checked in. The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, with excellent english, and the hotel itself is cute, efficient in use of space and felt very comfortable. Nice comfortable yet firm mattress in our room and open windows that were tall balcony like so plenty of air. Quiet side street but main roads a few blocks away so some noise, but we are in a city.....Bathrooms and showers were very nice (good hot shower) and whilst the room was small, this is what you would expect for a decent inner city hotel. Fantastic location (Arc de Triomph), near RER/Metro lines, and right next to the Air France bus so getting to and from airport is trivially simple, timely and cheap. Theres a bar up the block and across the street open to 2am (La Flamme) expensive but nice for a late night night cap, though cocktails there were a bit low on the "kick" side :) We didnt try the breakfast or bar in the hotel - there are plenty of places in the city. Would I stay again ? Absolutely. Any newbies to Paris - hit the Marais area, latin Quarter, St Germain area, and spend time on foot as well as on metro for a quick intro to great city. -Mark & Heather

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: wannatravelmuch
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. it is simple but pretty. the bathrooms were spotless. the toilets are separate from the bathroom in the junior suite. comfortable size. only problem was that they told us when we got there that breakfast was included in the rates, and then they tried to charge us for it at the end of our stay, when they did not even take note of exactly who or how many ppl were having breakfast each day. we made a fuss and eventually they gave in. so other than that, it was a nice hotel with a nice location, easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: gofar
Reviews.Content: At first we thought the location was a little off the beaten track,but once we discovered the Metro and how simple it was to use,we quickly changed our minds.It is is a commercial district with limited number of restaurants but very close to a Metro Station and all the shops .Museums and attractions are minutes away by Metro. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful.We stayed in the larger Club Rooms as past experience of Parisian Hotels tell us that rooms in general tend to be very functional and small.The Club rooms were normal sized rooms with good room service,flat screen tv,mini bar etc. Close by we were referred to the Chez Clement Restaurant for a nice dinner and it was excellent.For a little fun try the Happy Hours in the various Latin Quarter pubs,located by Metro to St Michael District. Taxi service in Paris is poor so dont miss the last Metro at 12.30am.We skipped breakfast,as €12 per head was a little steep,and the breakfast area lacked atmosphere (looked like a train carriage).Plenty of nice breakfast eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kate&Jayne
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with friends. The hotel was conveniently located with easy access to the Metro it also offered good value for money. The hotel was very well appointed however the accommodation would have benefited from a mirror in the bedroom as the bathroom was small and therefore difficult for two to share. Breakfast was good with choice of cereals, breads,jams and cold meats and cheese. The star of the Hotel was Johan in Reception who was an excellent host and guide. Every recommendation was outstanding, nothing was too much trouble for him. You need to stay at the Royal Magda soon before he gets a job at the George V or the Ritz !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Magda Etoile reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: Vikingstad
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, especially for 99 Euros a night in mid-January. The hotel is a mere block from the Arc de Triomphe and two blocks from the Air France Express Bus to CDG Airport. The service was friendly, and everyone spoke English when my French stumbled. I traveled solo for a long week-end holiday to the City of Lights. Although my room was small, it was certainly more than adequate enough for me. The sheets were soft and comfortable, the room and bathroom were immaculately serviced each day, and there was wireless internet access available. For such a small hotel, I was surprised to find that the hotel offers room service and a mini-bar (although I did not partake in either). The breakfast may be expensive for some at 12 Euros (it was not included in the room price I was quoted), but it consisted of a nice assortment of breads, croissants, cereals, yogurt, meats and cheeses. The breakfast area is quiet and comfortable--a nice place to plan your day over an endless cup of hot coffee. Overall, I find it hard to believe you can beat the value this hotel offers. HINT: Although most people would rather visit Paris during the spring and summer when Paris is in full bloom, don't neglect this city during the off months. Airfares are a bargain (I paid $550 round-trip from Newark Liberty), the tourist sites are empty, and in January especially, all of the stores have great sales. Even with the weaker dollar, I spent over $300 on great deals at the Men's store Madelios.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: JohnSterling
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a Three day break in Paris. As always we looked on Tripadvisor to find the most suitable Hotel. The Royal Magda was just the job. Spotlessly clean rooms, recently refurbished, great location, and very professional and helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble, and Johan on reception is excellent for recommendations of good restaurants to suit all tastes and pockets. The normal double rooms are a little 'bijou' but perfectly adequate and comfortable, with everything you need .(and very good value.) I think they have responded to some peoples earlier comments about breakfast and this now seems much improved with decent selection of meats,cheeses,cereals, fruit, yogurt, bread and croissants etc. plus selecton of teas, coffees and juices. All in all the perfect place for a visit to Paris and we will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Couldn't fault the professionalism or the location.”
Reviews.Author: MacDeeIreland
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel based on the Tripadvisor recommendation (I wanted to test how good and accurate the reviews were). We stayed Dec 1st -4th. Having stayed in the Georges V and the Hotel Napoleon nearby previously, I have to agree with the positive reviews of the hotel. It is a very pleasant environment to spend a few days exploring Paris. It is literally only 200 metres from the nearest Metro station. The management and staff were extremely professional and helpful. When our flight was cancelled in Charles De Gaulle, Air France put us up in a Hotel near the Airport Campus, however once we arrived there, I phoned the Hotel Royal Magda and we were able to check back in for another night. Superb. The rooms are very clean and pleasant. The restaurant serves breakfast but, to be honest with so many fantastic restaurants within walking distance, we never used it. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who doesn't enjoy large touristy hotels with impersonal service. We will be back in February. Mark (Dublin, Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “Class on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ecost
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for 3 nights with my mother in Jan 07. Could not fault the experience. The hotel is very conveniently located, we walked practically everywhere. The rooms and reception area are very nicely decorated and spotless. Very comfortable beds. Best of all, the staff were so friendly and helpful. Provided lots of great eating and sight seeing suggestions. Breakfast was great, very relaxed with a good choice. Just looking forward to the next trip! I would recommend Royal Magda Etoile to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PAMSTER-7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Magda in Paris is an absolute gem. Situated a few steps away from the arc de triomphe and the nearest metro, it has an ideal location in a quiet street. The hotel staff were very pleasant and after arriving before check in, after an early flight, the receptionist arranged a room for us to which we were very grateful. The rooms were bijou, but very very comfortable. Having read other reviews about the shower, I really feel I must mention it too...the shower is amazing!!! If your looking for a hotel in a central location, close to all attractions, I definitely recommend the Magda Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Drzava
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews - as usual they were spot on! We arrived on Jan 1st to find (a) we had been upgraded to a club room as it was our first time in Paris and (b) a Happy New Year card and box of chocolates in our room. Good start! The room itself was reasonably sized (it was one of the larger rooms) with a decent bathroom. Desk, table and a few chairs, along with aircon. Bathroom had a shower in a bathtub. Minibar prices reasonable compared to those in bars and restaurants (shocking!). I am docking one star though because there was intermittent machinery noise (lift or boiler?) throughout the night at the back of the hotel. This was not especially loud but, as I a light sleeper, I had to buy earplugs after the first night. There were no other disturbances. All staff we dealt with were friendly, tolerated my pidgin French, and spoke good English. Location is excellent. It seems to be a little bit out from the centre but the large Metro/RER station at the Arc de Triomphe (round the corner) ensures rapid access to any part of Paris you wish. There are also dozens of restaurants and bars in the immediate area of the hotel, so eating in the evening is absolutely no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Magda”
Reviews.Author: severhart
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to all who have left reviews for this hotel. I had never used Trip Advisor before and based on the reviews I read, I canceled reservations at another hotel and booked 2 rooms at the Royal Magda. I'm so glad that I did! This hotel is a gem and is wonderfully located. We were able to walk everywhere. This was very nice considering the logistics of traveling with 6 people, 4 being teenagers. Even a taxi ride is not as simple as it seems. The hotel is exactly as described. Very clean, comfortable and well appointed. The rooms we had were a 2 room suite with a double bed, a dresser, 2 nightstands and a flat screen television on the wall in one room. The second room of this suite had a fold out sofa, a table, 2 chairs, desk and chair, mini fridge, television and a closet area. The bathroom was large enough with plenty of towels, a robe and VERY GOOD water pressure. The 2nd room was a double with two twin beds, a closet area, desk and chair, flat screen television and two nightstands. The bathroom was smaller but very nice and appointed just the same as the other. Like I said, there were 6 of us, we had 7 larger suitcases and we all fit quite well into the rooms. The walls are indeed thin as everyone mentioned in the reviews, so we were happy to be on the end of a wing. I was worried the kids would be too loud for the other guests. I hope they were not. We were there from Dec 22 - 25. When we returned to our rooms on the evening of the 24th, we found a Christmas card signed by all of the staff and a gift in each room. This was quite a lovely surprise. The staff was very courteous and professional. Yohan was a pleasure to deal with. We will definitely stay here again. S. Everhart Cary, North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Durple
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 5 nights. The first 4 nights were in another hotel near the Gare du Nord station. We decided to splurge a little on our last 2 days and moved to the Royal Magda. It was a refreshing change being so close to all the action. A stones throw from the arch and Champs elysees. The room was nice and clean. The mini bar was loaded and the prices were not unreasonable. We however did not use the minibar. Free internet access, clean bathroom, a couple of english TV channels to put me to sleep, friendly service and all this at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: granipc
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris, and the tone was set perfectly by this delightful little hotel! We stayed from the day after Christmas until New Year's Eve and enjoyed every minute. We just really cannot say enough about their incredibly gracious staff, especially Kais and the darling little blond girl at the front desk. Everyone, down to the cleaning staff, were incredibly friendly and helpful and I certainly hope the management recognizes what gems they have in their staff! We arrived well before check-in time, but our rooms were available and ready to be occupied, this was such a treat considering the long overnight flight we had just arrived from. The location is outstanding, so convenient to the Metro, restaurants, shopping, the Arc... it goes on and on! We found the continental breakfast to be the perfect start to our day, and although many commented on the price, we found it worth the convenience. It's also nice they serve breakfast until noon. The staff in the dining room were wonderful. We also enjoyed late night drinks in the comfortable chairs in the lobby (Merci, Kais!) after we returned from dinner on several evenings. The rooms were spotless, and the cleaning staff did a fabulous job, even straightening up our luggage and kid's various odds and ends they had left around the room. We had a suite, which was more than spacious (and we are Americans who are used to LARGE rooms) for our family of four (kids ages 7 and 12), my mother and brother and his wife each had standard double rooms. Only smaill inconvenience was the occasional disco music from the restaurant next door on a couple of evenings that disturbed my mother and brother, who had rooms adjacent to their walls. Nothing too terrible, and didn't go on too late into the night. They also arranged a car to take us back to the airport, and he was terrific! When he couldn't pull right up to the curb because of so much traffic, he parked in the garage, took all our luggage in for us (7 bags, plus some!) and made sure he got us directly to the correct check-in area. All in all, a terrific experience and we will recommend you to all!!! Thank you so much for helping to make this such a wonderful memory for our family! The Mallinger Family Houston, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MagsAndDan
Reviews.Content: We spent a magical Christmas Eve and Christmas day in this lovely hotel. The excellent service began before our arrival,with Yohan confirming our booking and also helping out with information about getting there, local attractions and eating out. The hotel was easy to get to as it is very near to the impressive Arc De Triomphe. Yohan suggested taking the AirFrance bus from CDG airport instead of the Metro as it avoids having to change stations whilst carting luggage around. We took his advice both ways! The front of the hotel is probably the best looking out of all the buildings on this side street and the reception area of the hotel is very pleasant. The double room we booked was suprisingly large, very quiet and clean. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but again, it was very clean with modern decor. The toilet was separate and again rather small but adequate. The only staff we encountered were Yohan and the gentleman on reception in the evening (we never got his name!). Both spoke excellent english and were very helpful. On the first evening we were directed to a great brasserie a couple of streets away on Ave. De La Grande Armee (the SCS La Grande Armee). Although it may seem a bit pricey to some at 100 euros for two people, the meals were great. As a side note, if you plan to go to this brasserie, brush up on your french food as we had a bit of difficulty with the menu! On the subject of food, the hotel does do meals as there is a menu in the room, although we never did get to try it. We found breakfasts to be adequate for self service Continental style fayre. There was a nice touch on Christmas Day when we arrived back at the hotel to find a Christmas card and chocolates from the staff. Also, Yohan was very helpful in keeping our luggage for a few hours after we checked out as we had some time to kill whilst waiting for our flight. Overall, our experience of this hotel has been one of a pleasant surprise. We didn't quite know what to expect with various tales of small rooms being the norm in Paris. We actually downgraded from a four star hotel to this three star hotel after finding all the positive reviews from TripAdvisor. One of the key benefits is the location, being very close to the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs de Elysees (for big name shops such as Louis Vuitton, Cartier, and D&G) and a metro station only 5 minutes away.
