We will definitely come here again! Dan & Magda

Reviews.Title: “The perfect experience in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: saklein13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wonderful hotel with my boyfriend prior to Christmas. What a wonderful experience! The hotel is perfectly situated near the Arc de triomphe and two blocks from the metro station, making our travels around Paris extremely convenient. We were upgraded from a lovely room to a beautiful suite (with a towel warmer in the bathroom as an added bonus). The suite was an excellent size, nicely decorated, and with two flat screen tv's. The highlight of the hotel was the friendly and helpful staff, especially Johan. Johan readily helped suggest and reserve wonderful restaurants during our stay. Our experience in Paris would not have been the same without the help of Johan (thank you!). I highly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Holiday”
Reviews.Author: am79211
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location. Room was very clean, staff was friendly, very helpful and speak English for those not fluent in French. 5 minute walk to the "RER" station and Champs Elysees and the Arch of Triumph. Very easy to navigate to/from CDG airport and the sites from this location. Will definetly book this hotel again when I return for my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and nice location!”
Reviews.Author: kurokuroneko
Reviews.Content: - Friendly, and very helpful staff. Always a smile! - Housecleaning staff very good. Everything was spotless. - It is very close to the Arc de Triumphe and the Metro/RER. Very nice location. - The buffet breakfast is 12E. A basic selection, but items are fresh. - The room was nicely sized and clean. Our room overlooked the street. Noise was not a problem except for the trash truck in the morning one time during the week. There is a theatre across the street, but the noise was not excessive. Actually, you may find a little more noise from your neighbors as the walls seem to be a little thin. - The shower was prone to leaking on the floor if you angled the spout a bit high. The soap is rather small so we ended up buying some at L'Occitane nearby. Bathroom lacks a facecloth. - There are 2 supermarkets nearby. A small one just around the corner at the end of the street and a bit more upscale one (Monoprix) at the next square. - No alarm clock in the room. - Safebox in the room. - Yes, the elevator is small and new. Just enough for two people. - We used a shared shuttle van to the airport (42E for two people). Professional and door to door service. Airport Connection is the name of the company. - Reasonable selection of restaurants nearby. There are 2 safety items that i was a little concerned about. - Lack of fire detector in the room. All other areas seemed to have detectors and fire safety equipment. - The door does not lock automatically upon entry or exit. In fact, you need to lock yourself in the room. In an emergency, it might be difficult to find your key and then get the door unlocked. You will find there are two doors to the room. The inner one does not lock. Whenever we were in the room, we left our key in the door. Overall, i enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would recommend it without hesitation. Service and location are two key points of this hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drizotravel
Reviews.Content: Love it! We stayed at this hotel for two nights. This place was very stylish, clean, and cute. The staff are the friendliest people; make sure you ask them for recommendations on dinner places- they told us about two places within walking distance that were amazing. The location is also great- right next to the Arc de Triumph. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Seeka
Reviews.Content: This petite boutique hotel was a wonderful taste of Paris right from the moment we walked through the door. A quiet sanctuary just yards from the hustle-bustle of the Champs-Elysee and L'Arc de Triomphe. Yes the rooms were rather small but very cosy for the time of year and full equiped with all the neccessities. The free bedroom internet connection was a gift, considering we've stayed in higher class hotels who charge €10 per hour. Staff were very friendly, more than willing to speak English when our French got the better of us. All in all, I would highly recommend this little gem in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: yozzz
Reviews.Content: Perfect for Paris. Got details from Tripadvisor and knew the downsides - small lift (no problem if there are just 2 of you), door doesnt lock automaticaly (so --- what!) only camplaint is that the walls are a little thin (but not too bad) The upsides which are location, clean, great staff, close to metro, value for money make this an excellent choice and I would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: marvfish
Reviews.Content: Six months ago we stayed at the Hotel Splendid Etoile in Paris based on the rating and reviews on the Trip Advisor web site. The hotel was better than the reviews. In planning another trip to Paris (Dec, 06), I consulted Trip Advisor to find a better rating for the Royal Magda Etoile. Although the room was clean, spacious and adequate, it was no more. The elevator was barely large enough for two adults WITHOUT LUGGAGE. The room had to be locked going in and out with a key, minor but a nuicance. There were no washcloths in the bathroom and none available. Closet space was minimal and there were no drawers. The furnishings and decor was quite basic. The internet connection was hit and miss, mostly miss. Ther was no full length mirror in the room. The windows all faced a small courtyard. None of these by themselves were big deals and our stay was comfortable and fine. However, for similar money in the same area, the Splendid Etoile is a far superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: GTM1
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel a winner is its location and the staff's willingness to assist. Its never going to be considered a luxury hotel but it really is great value for money and you are not there to sit in the room. You can reach the rest of Paris from the metro and the staff cant help enough from locating a restaurant or offering advice as to how to get aound, upgrading you to a suite, or storing your luggage to trying to book you in before 2pm. Not 150 yards from the Arc de Triomphe and tbe metro, clean, quiet. To be recommended for the budget minded as a gem.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: odonnell
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has it all!. Its fresh and clean, the bedrooms are small but then so are all bedrooms in Paris! The staff are wonderful, warm and welcoming and anxious to help! Their english is superb. The location is great. Two minutes walk to the Metro which will take you anywhere! We didnt take a taxi once! Tons of eateries around. I will definetely use again, This is not a highly rated hotel on Trip Advisor for nothing! Best ive tried at that price!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: chitownmel
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Hotel Magda through Trip Advisor back in September. My husband and I just returned from Thanksgiving weekend in Paris. The Hotel Magda did not disappoint. We were immediately upgraded to a suite upon our arrival - at ten am! Allowing us to check into our room so early (after an eight hour flight) was fantastic. The only thing missing was a down comforter, but in Paris, I could do without! The hotel is in an amazing location about two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. It is also two blocks away from Metro line 1 which is one of the main arteries of the city. It took us almost everywhere we needed to go - and we only had to transfer once to get anywhere else. This was ideal. We never had to take a taxi. We ate breakfast in the hotel each day which was convenient, but there were also many options close by. I would highly recommend the restaurant Citrus Etoile which was only a few blocks away from the hotel. It is operated by an American woman, Elizabeth, and her husband who is a French native. We had our best meal at their restaurant. The staff at the Hotel Magda was extremely helpful and attentive. I am grateful to all of those who reveiwed the hotel before me b/c I probably wouldn't have found this gem otherwise. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “friendly warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinhorne
Reviews.Content: During our 3 day stay at the Hotel Royal Magda, we were made to feel very welcome. On arrival, the hotel was very warm and welcoming, the decor was very chic and the Hotel was exceptionally clean. Our room was excellent, it had eveything we needed and was kept clean during our stay. The Hotel was very central to all the sights we wanted to see. so we didnt have to waste money on travel expenses. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and a young gentleman named Yohann went out of his way to accomodate our needs and make us feel very welcome. The Manager also helped us choose a restaurant, booked and arranged taxis. We were very impressed with the high standard of hospitality we recieved. Paris is a beautifull city, and i would recomend this hotal to anyone visiting, we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Little Star”
Reviews.Author: kitegirl
Reviews.Content: We also booked the Royal Magda Etoile based on reviews on Trip Advisor for the first time ever and were a little nervous. We need not have been. It was everything you could want from a boutique, stylish property. From the warm welcome and personal service to the unbeatable location. We too were upgraded and the room was massive in comparison to others I have stayed in in Paris. It was spotless, contemporary, bright and well equipped. I would recommend anyone who would usually stay at Costes or George V to give it a whirl. It was a lovely place to stay and we will be recommending the Royal Magda to everyone. Id also recommend booking a table at the Cafe De L'homme which is inside the museum of man right infront of the E' Tower. Its quite expensive but possible one of the most romantic spots we have ever been to and the food was excellent. Make sure you get a table next to the window so you can see the tower twinkle. This place cannot fail to impress.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: MorningMartin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. I took my fiance and a couple of our friends to Paris for my fiance's birthday and we spent two nights at the hotel. I had emailed the hotel beforehand a couple of times to make some prior enquiries and arrangements and Yohan and Flore were always prompt in replying and giving me the information I needed. Upon arrival, Yohan greeted us at reception and knew who we were instantly, which was a nice personal touch. He also upgraded us at no extra cost to a Junior Suite room which we found to be very nice, clean and spacious. The room was very nicely decorated with lovely decor and the bathroom was a perfect size with lovely clean towels, bathrobe and handy little bottles of shampoo, shower gel and some nice little bath salts. On the evening of my fiance's birthday, Yohan and his Manager (sorry, I cannot recall his name!) recommended to us a lovely Brasserie about 5 mins taxi journey from the airport and went to the trouble of booking the restaurant and taxi for us. Yohan even joined us on his night off at the end of our meal for dessert and helped us sort out a minor problem at the restaurant when they attempted to rip us off by charging us for something we did not order - our French not being particularly good, Yohan was able to rectify this with the waiter! Breakfast was an additional 12 Euros per person but we preferred to venture out to find small cafes for breakfast instead, purely because we wanted to get out of the hotel quickly in the mornings to do our sightseeing. I am told that this hotel has recently been refurbished and you can definitely tell. The decor throughout was very sophisticated and tasteful and I particularly liked the leopard print carpet ! Overall we could not fault the hotel in any way, okay maybe the lift is a bit on the small side, but this would not affect anyone wanting to stay there, unless they are just plain fussy! The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The location of the hotel is also ideal, the nearest metro being just five minutes walk and right near the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. The area is extremely quiet and we did not experience any noise from the neighbouring properties. We will definitely be returning to Paris in the Spring/Summer of 2007 for another short break and will without a doubt be booking the Royal Magda for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: AmyG_31
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my stay at this hotel. As a first-time single traveler, I felt very safe in this neighborhood and was pleased to find the metro station within a few blocks walking distance. My room was spotless each evening I returned from my day out. All staff I dealt with were courteous and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: giantblue
Reviews.Content: The Royal Magda is located blocks from the metro and the Champs Elysees. The room was a little small, but very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bussman
Reviews.Content: I just got back after a 4 day stay in Paris and this hotel indeed deserves it's reputation as being one of the better rated hotels in Paris. Booked the hotel through the reviews from this website and being the first time using it's reviews, was abit nervous but keen on finding out what all the good reviews was all about. The hotel was ideally located at the Arc De Triomphe, only a street away from the bus stop (if taking the Air France bus from CDG airport) and just behind the CDG Etoile metro stop. We arrived early in the morning and the reception staff were kind, polite, receptive and allowed us to store our bags while waiting for our room to be ready (and we actually left and started sightseeing anyways!) We had a club room on one of the higher floors. It was suprisingly very large, spacious and spotless. Having done quite alot of travelling, I was extremely impressed with the cleanliness which was one of the things that I'm particularly fussy about. There was a tiny bit of music noise (still trying to sus out where it came from !) on the first night but the remainder of the nights were quiet. We decided not to have breakfast in the hotel because essentially there were loads of cafes/restaurants in the area. For those who are fastfood addicts, there's a McDonalds round the corner. We managed to walk to most Paris sights from the hotel easily but the CDG Etoile metro afforded access to most of Paris without much problems. We tended to go for walks at night to witness Paris by night and felt safe walking around the hotel late(though we were back by midnight). To give a fair critique, i've noticed that the mattress was quite firm but I guess that's personal preference. For the claustraphobic ones, the lift is quite cosy. To summarise, my partner is already bugging me to come back to Paris again and we would definitely come back to the Royal Magda.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Magda Etoile Hotel - Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 7 rue Troyon, 75017 Paris, France
